story:
My name is Jack Tapestry. I have been a competing slam poet in OKC for 15 years. This year I qualified for a place on a team of four poets that will represent our city at  21st Annual Southern Fried Poetry Slam in New Orleans in June. This will be the first time OKC will attend this tournament. Your contribution will help us spend more time practicing our craft instead of fundraising so we can represent our city in the best possible way at this tournament.

 

The money we are trying to raise will cover our fuel and hotel costs for the trip from OKC to New Orleans. A ten dollar contribution will get you a CD of poetry from all four members of the team. Fifteen dollars will get you a chapbook of poetry featuring all four team members plus members of our Red Dirt community. A twenty dollar contribution will get you the CD, chapbook, and photo of us. Fifty dollars will get you a swag bag with merch from each member of the team in the form of chapbooks and CD's. Seventy five dollars will get you everything mentioned above. If you donate one hundred dollars our very own Melissa May (ranked third in the nation at The Individual World Poetry Slam) will write you a poem on the topic of your choice or perform at a function of your choice. Three hundred dollars will get you a performance by the entire team at the event of your choice. Finally, a five hundred dollar donation will get you all of the things I mentioned above.

Here's the official synopsis of The Southern Fried Poetry Slam:

On June 5-8, 2013 New Orleans, Louisiana will host the 21st Annual Southern Fried Poetry Slam for the first time since Hurricane Katrina. The four-day festival is slated to take place in downtown New Orleans. The Southern Fried Poetry Slam is expected to attract over three hundred people. Thirty-two teams and new to the area spectators from all over the nation. The literary competition features preliminary bouts and culminates in the Southern Fried Poetry Slam Finals on Saturday, June 8th, 2013. In addition to the commemorative Moon Pies and RC Colas of Southern Fried tradition, this year's champions will receive over $7500 in cash and various prizes as well as a couple local merchant wears.

During the four-day event, poets will host free writing and performance workshops that are welcome to all throughout the community. There will also be special workshops designed for any young, aspiring writers who have any curiosity about becoming a spoken word artist. Outside of our traditional workshops we also provide opportunities for visiting poets to take part in community service in host city. While the Southern Fried Poetry Slam primarily highlights poets hailing from the South, it is also the second-largest poetry competition in the nation. This event is hosted by regional collectives that take pride in preserving its long-standing traditions while embarking on new ones. The 21th Annual Southern Fried Poetry Slam is proudly presented by The 2012 National Poetry Slam Champions, Slam New Orleans.

story:
Short Summary

About me:

I am Edita Tirkšliūnė. I’m Lithuanian art painter. I think paintings would be best description for an artist. You can’t express with words so much as with visual art. Let’s go to my blog at www.EditaPainting.com and get to know me better :)

 

Idea:

  • I’ll paint one 20 x 20 cm (7.9” x 7.9” inch) painting per day every day for 60 days in a row.

  • I’ll create several sentences of a story for each painting.

  • Every day painting and sentences will be continuation of previous day painting and sentences.

  • I’ll post my paintings photos with story lines to my blog every day, so you can follow it.

  • At the end, i’ll publish illustrated book with full story.

 This project starts on July 1st, 2013 and lasts for 2 months.

 

What I Need & What You Get

My Goals:

  • Paint many connected paintings,

  • Create unpredictable story for a book,

  • Release printed edition of a book.

 

What you get:

 

  • Entertainment: you can follow paintings and flow of a story every day on my blog.

  • Choose one or several perks, which you see on the right side of this page.

  • Everyone with perks $40 or more will be mentioned on my blog and book. You have this option with lower perks as well, if you add $5 or $10 to the amount.

  • Shipping costs are included in perk amount.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

You would help me very much, if you tell your friends about this project. You can give them link of this campaign http://igg.me/at/editapainting or my blog www.EditaPainting.com

Also, I would be very glad if you like or share this project on social networks :) You can find sharing buttons on this page.

 

Thank you ;-)

story:
RESERVEDMAGAZINE.COM


RESERVED MAGAZINE was originally concepted in the Fall of 2O11 by Vanity Fair Magazine photo producer, Richard Villani, writer/humorist, Jim Downey and creative director, Whitney Mercurio. Illustrator/creative director, Mitja Bokun has joined the team as co-owner/editor-in-chief, as of January 2013.


CURRENT OWNERSHIP:

WHITNEY MERCURIO    Co-Editor-in-Chief/Creative Director

MITJA BOKUN   Co-Editor-in-Chief

JIM DOWNEY   Editor at Large

photographer:Stephanie Dinkel     hair: Dennis Devoy

makeup: Mariko Aria  model: Solomiya (Ford Model Agency)


photographer: Michael David Adams   hair/makeup: Viktorija Bowers

styling: Don West   Model: Haley Sutton (VNY Model Agency)


illustrator: Mitja Bokun


Los Angeles Modern Auctions


SVALBARD #30, 47"x70", soft pastel on paper, 2009  

ZARIA FORMAN   www.zariaforman.com

story:
Helping an Artist.

Starting artwork at the beginning of the year on my own merits i have worked towards achieving graphic representations of ideas and thoughts on my head, i have been drawing artwork for free on Deviantart and am now looking at options to help get something more practical for drawing.

Things i have done so far include :

- Supportive artwork [for friends who need cheering up]

- Public artwork [for people who would like their OC drawn but lack funding]

- Silly artwork [for my tumblr for people to ask questions and get free artwork]


My Deviantart account can be found here : http://seto1337.deviantart.com/

My Tumblr account can be found here : http://askasillypony.tumblr.com/


These are a few of the things i have done so far and am now looking for some assistance in getting some better hardware to help improve the quality of my artwork.


If you are able to spare some funds to help out with this project, i will be looking at making a canvas of artwork for each of the contributors towards this goal as a thanks for donation, or other smaller artwork pieces at contributors request.


==-==-==-==-==-==-==-==-==-==-==-==-==-==-==-==-==-==-==-==-==-==-==-==
Please refer this funds raiser to others you may know where possible <3
I Will continue doing artwork requests on Deviantart and this Cintiq will help improve
the quality of that artwork.

:: For Every $5 donation will be an additional 'ticket' to a raffle i will be holding when
this fundraiser has been completed, and my current Intuos 3 will be donated with pen
and equipment to the raffle winner, please post this fundraiser where possible ::

Example : $10 donation = 2x Tickets
==-==-==-==-==-==-==-==-==-==-==-==-==-==-==-==-==-==-==-==-==-==-==-==

story:
My name is Guy Seide , and along with my Partner Torrance Reed we are Humble Kings Studios . We are a small (and by small I mean small) Logo design/tshirt design/Art direction company. By nature we both are artist who just live to draw,paint,and create. 

                 Our campaign is to basically allow us to get the proper tools as well as funding to allow us to start our little up start. You see although we are both in Florida we have never met. We work through google hang outs , phone calls and facebook. We have been business partners for a little over 2 years and its been a slow but fruitful journey . Now we are ready for next step , and part of that requires us to have more equipment and have more help . If we are able to meet our goal we would be able to have more face to face meetings, as well start the process to do this full time. We are also trying to get a studio to set our equipment . We are not looking to do this fully through the funding, were just looking for an upstart . We are confident that we will be able to maintain our studio rent as well as our equipment . Our issues with start up is that we both are family men , and we dont have the means to save to get that capital to start up . It would mean the world to us to get our dreams to actually come true.

                       We are very excited to start this process , and to share with the world our artistic abilities . We have t shirts that we would love to start printing , and are ambitious to make them for the first time with our own equipment and do unique style of design.

story: HI all! Allison Rihns Birthday is coming up! Some of you may or may not know that Allison is studying to get certified in Pilates. The cost is very high and she'd been working her butt off to pay for it. Since there is nothing that she really needs or wants besides that I decided to do this little fund raiser for her to help raise funds to her goal. Raising 500 dollars would cover half of the cost that she has to pay at the beginning of the year! I hope you will all help out! And Mums the word : )Thanks!!

story:
CHOLERA IPA 

The world's first ultra-premium, artisan ale to be brewed with absolutely no concession to commercial compromise. Its exceptional journey starts in Haiti where cholera-laden waters offer the perfect mineral profile to frame a phenomenal marriage of ingredients. The water is purified at source then travels to Europe where it is crafted into a work of art.

The finest Vienna and ultra-rare Bavarian malts are paired with the world's most elusive and coveted hop varieties, then imbued with yeast from the master brewers of a secret Trappist order. Smooth bitterness sets the stage for an ensuing complexity of alcohol warmth, tart fruit and delicate herbal aromatics. Not everyone will be able to justify the modest investment required to own this piece of brewing history. Those who do, enjoy an experience never to be repeated; an ephemeral glimpse of perfection.

WHAT?

Cholera India Pale Ale is an interactive art installation designed to highlight the inequality in living standards between the developed and developing world. Guests to an exclusive, annual London art event will be offered bottles of ultra-premium beer to drink. They will be clearly labelled as being made from "cholera-laden" water. It will be left up to them how they choose to react to the situation.

THE BACK STORY

I am a professional artist currently taking part in an MA in Fine Art at Central Saint Martins College of Art in London. My practice is influenced by political and human rights issues.

I had the idea for CHOLERA IPA while watching Youtube footage of the current situation in Haiti. By western standards the current Caribbean cholera epidemic is laughably simple to avoid. By the time water reaches boiling point, it's completely sterile. For us, avoiding cholera would be as easy as throwing the switch on a kettle.

So why has the disease killed thousands of Haitians in the last few months? Residents of the temporary camps and urban slums caused by the 2010 earthquake simply do not have access to electricity, fuel or any other way of heating their water. When I really started thinking about that which I take for granted and what it would mean to be utterly deprived of it, I felt moved to incorporate the subject into my artistic practice.

I wanted to create a work which reflected the absurdity of the situation. At the same time I want it to induce empathy, and lead us to question the values of our consumerist culture and what could be done with western resources given a slightly different frame of mind.

THE IMPACT

Being involved in the London art scene, I have chances to exhibit my work. However I want to take a more interactive approach and turn the audience into the exhibit. 
One of my roles at Central Saint Martins is sourcing beer sponsorship for exhibitions and events. For the next event (an art auction taking place in on July 8th) I will be offering CHOLERA IPA as the sponsored beer, rather than attracting the usual donations of Carlsberg, Becks, etc. I'm asking thousands of visitors to interact with the art directly by drinking it - thereby considering their relationship with the subject matter.

There will be two different forms of the Cholera IPA bottle. One will be an unsigned, unlimited edition destined for consumption during the event. The other form will be an etched, wax sealed bottle, signed and limited to 100 copies. This collectors edition is being offered as a perk to contributors on this site.

On a side note, the beer really will be made from Haitian water. However as part of the brewing process, the 'wort' is boiled for an hour and a half. Even the first few minutes of boiling would make it utterly safe to drink. For extra safety (mostly for the purpose of the risk assessment which the university will require me to sign) I will also pass the water through a 2 nanometer pathogen filter before the boil.

WHAT I NEED

The budget breaks down into three sections (all costs in GBP): shipment of sterilised water from Haiti (£210), purchase of professional grade (but small batch) brewing equipment (£725) and purchase of beer making ingredients (£92). I have spent the past few months avidly studying the art of brewing with a few small demijohns. I really am serious about actually creating an ultra high quality, craft beer.

If my entire goal is not met, I will use whatever funds are available to make the best product that I can with the available resources. One option might be to get a small bottle of water shipped from Haiti and dilute it with London tap water. I feel that this would be unfortunate as it would stretch the concept but we all have to work within our means.

I can email a spreadsheet containing the full cost breakdown on request.

WHAT YOU GET

Please feel free to give as much or as little as you can afford. All donations will be greatly appreciated. I would also like to reward those of you who show confidence in the value of my work. Because of this I want to offer a gift depending on your contribution.

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

I would really appreciate if you can spread the word on Twitter (@mikemarcus #choleraipa), Facebook and anywhere else you can. I'm also really interested in hearing from you, even if you just want to say 'hi'. Do you have any suggestions on how the project can be enriched? I'm really open to listening. Finally, if you are in Haiti or know someone who is, I really need some help on the ground.

LASTLY...

I really want to thank the exceptionally generous and very obviously talented Dan Gerding for allowing me to use his fantastic images of Haiti as part of the project. If it wasn't for his generosity, I would be faced with raising another $2000 and needlessly pumping 1275kg of CO2 into the atmosphere to travel to Haiti on a photographic expedition.

story:
Passions I laid to rest may still have some life in them
So dig, dig with me 
Letâ€™s raise this thing from the dead 
And breathe some life in it 
Believe with me 



Sexual abuse is too often shamed, kept in the dark, and silenced. It's time to end that. 

In October of 2011, I created a photography project called Project Unbreakable. I began asking survivors of sexual assault to write a quote from their attacker on a poster. At first, it was just to show the world how incredibly common this issue is. But then I soon realized that it was a form of therapy for these survivors; they were finally able to let go of things that had held them down for weeks, months, years. 

I began receiving hundreds of emails from people asking to be apart of the project, either by photographing them or allowing their submission to be published on my blog. Sometimes people shared their stories with me - and sometimes, those stories were the first time they had ever told anyone. 

I am nineteen years old, and my career could end tomorrow, but I'd still feel fulfilled. I want to take this project a step further. I want to be able to travel to different areas in America to photograph, to speak, to show my work - to show people that they are not alone. And maybe one day, I can turn this project into an organization, providing professional help for survivors, something that I am unfortunately not qualified to give. 

We all have the ability to change the world - it's just a matter of deciding how we want to. If you can donate, I would appreciate it. If you can't, please just share this page if you are willing. And if you are a survivor of sexual abuse, I want you to remember that you are unbreakable.

-- 


In addition to the prizes listed to the right, musician Allie Moss is offering two half hour guitar lessons via Skype for 75 dollars each. Her website can be found here: http://alliemoss.com/home

To purchase, go over to the green box and look for the "Contribute Now" button. Then:

1) Click the dollar amount and scroll down to "Other Amount". Click "Contribute Now". 
2) Afterwards, don't claim any of the perks listed and just choose "No Perk, just a contribution!"
3) Enter in $75 and scroll down to pay via PayPal. (You do not need a PayPal account. Major credit cards are accepted as well.)

When in PayPal, make sure you mention that you are purchasing the guitar lesson. If you have any questions, please feel free to email: grace@50extraordinarywomen.com

-- 

Many, many thanks to the incomparable Nino Gallego for the video above. His brilliance cannot be matched. http://vimeo.com/ninogallego

story:
Help a motley crew of artists take it to the streets!

We need to buy green building materials to get our trailer on the road by June 25th

We are a multi-cultural troupe of musicians, dancers, actors, hip-hop poets, puppeteers and visual artists  based in Southern California who want to take our art where the spirit moves us. A 1951 trailer will be our home base. We’ll roll into under-served communities, using art to help bring people together.  The trailer is being restored RIGHT NOW from the ground up. We need your help to turn it into green place to live and showcase art.

Our deadline is June 25th. That’s when we're hoping to participate at the Watts Village Theater Company’s “Meet Me @Metro II.” The event is an opportunity for folks who use public transportation to see mini-performances at Metro stops between the Watts neighborhood and Long Beach.

 “Meet Me @ Metro II” is our first event of the summer, but it won’t be our last. We have lots more performances lined up. We'll go into local communities in Southern California, performing at fairs, festivals and museums. We'll show up at parks, barber shops and farmer's markets.  Our art explores a common theme:  the meaning of home, community and identity.

The Pitch

Most of us are graduates or students of California Institute of the Arts. Like a touring band of performing gypsies, we will bring everything we need with us – stage, lights, sound and seating.  We will stage exhibits, concerts, plays and puppet shows.

We are going green! We will operate off-grid with solar-powered equipment. That means we can go where the spirit takes us - in densely populated urban areas or out in the desert.

We've already raised $20,000 - We've also received donated green building materials, including equipment for our solar system.

Your donation can help us obtain:

(1.) A window rebuild for puppet shows: We want to re-engineer the front curved windows so that they will be able to pop-out. That will extend our performance space, breaking down the physical divide between the "inside" and the "outside" of the trailer.

(2.) Solar Power

(3.) Energy-efficient lighting and sound equipment

(4.) A portable stage

(5.) Modular furniture: a dinette booth used for poetry readings and art making. The booth will transform into kid-size bleachers for indoor performances.

For all this to happen we need to raise $12'000 by the time I graduate in May with an MFA in acting from Cal Arts. Then we can work FULL TIME finishing up the restoration by the end of June.

 

Short on cash?  Here are other ways to help:

1. Donate your art, building materials or volunteer your home or art space for a fundraising event - you could donate green building materials or donate some art-work which we would auction off in an up-coming event. We're also looking for building volunteers (send us an email!).

 

2. Share your contacts - Connect us with like-minded groups or individual artists, curators, promoters and anyone who'd like to work with us, invite us to their venue, book us for an event, etc.

 

3. Make some noise about us - Participate in Facebook conversations about the project. Make comments and suggestions. You can also help us create a Trash Buzz by sending your friends a link to this campaign via your Facebook page, Twitter or email. (It really helps!) Post your suggestions... Please!

 

Donations Are Tax-Deductible

 

Trailer Trash is a member of Fractured Atlas. Donations are tax-deductible to the extent permissible by federal law. Please join our team of "guardian angels" and help us raise $12'000 to rebuild the "Silver Burrito" by the time I graduate this summer.

 

 Sam Breen is the project manager of Trailer Trailer.  See his short bio here.

 

Contact Sam Breen:

Email:  sam.breen@yahoo.com

Sam’s Spartan Revival: http://spartanrestoration.com

Or find me on Facebook

curators, promoters and anyone who'd like to work with us, invite us to their
venue, book us for an event, etc.
 
3. Make
some noise about us - Participate in Facebook conversations about the
project. Make comments and suggestions. You can also help us create a Trash
Buzz by sending your friends a link to this campaign via your Facebook page,
Twitter or email. (It really helps!) Post your suggestions... Please!
 
Donations Are Tax-Deductible
 
Trailer Trash is a member of Fractured Atlas. Donations are tax-deductible to the
extent permissible by federal law. Please join our team of "guardian
angels" and help us raise $12'000 to rebuild the "Silver Burrito"
by the time I graduate this summer.
 
 Sam Breen
is the project manager of Trailer Trailer.  See his short bio here.
 
Contact Sam Breen:
Email:  sam.breen@yahoo.com
Sam’s Spartan
Revival: http://spartanrestoration.com
Or find me on
Facebook

story:
The Lituanica birds’ effigy is a wooden sculpture representing a flock of birds in flight, illuminated by an orange light. 

 Lituanica is the name of a famed airplane that was piloted by two Lithuanian-American pilots Steponas Darius and Stasys Girėnas in 1933. The Lituanica birds’ installation pays tribute to these heroic pilots and their historic journey across the Atlantic.

80 years ago, Darius and Girėnas departed from Floyd Bennett Field airport (New York) with the intention of conducting a non-stop flight to Kaunas, Lithuania. Their aircraft was an orange Bellanca CH-300 Pacemaker called - Lituanica (meaning Lithuania in Latin).

The two pilots set out July 15, 1933 on their journey across the Atlantic Ocean, covering a distance of 3,984 miles (6,411 kilometers) without landing, in 37 hours and 11 minutes (107.1 mph). Despite having successfully crossed the Atlantic, the Lituanica crashed due to undetermined circumstances on July 17th, killing both pilots. In terms of comparison, as far as the distance of non-stop flights was concerned, their result ranked second only to that of Russell Boardman and John Polando, and ranked fourth in terms of flight duration at the time (source: Wikipedia). Despite the fact that Darius and Girėnas did not have navigational equipment and flew under unfavorable weather conditions, their flight was one of the most precise in aviation history. It equaled, and in some aspects surpassed, Charles Lindbergh's classic flight of 1927. Oddly enough, Lituanica is also noted for having carried the first transatlantic air mail consignment in history.

Today, Lituanica symbolizes deep cultural ties and a fond connection between the US and Lithuania. This orange colored airplane is a well-known icon and historic symbol of the two pilots’ heroic, but tragic flight.

We believe that these symbolic Lituanica birds will unite all flocks of burners making their way to the desert each year from their nests scattered in different parts of the world, joining these burner-birds empowered by a sense of community and the desire to fly freely.

As a CORE project, we expect this merge of a well-known historical and cultural symbol to bring a deeper significance to our region. The symbolic gesture of honor via performance will be captured when setting the Lituanica birds ablaze. This unique and expressive symbol will inspire all burners flocking to the playa this year. 

The dimensions of the sculpture are: 20 feet high (6 meters) and 20 feet wide.

story:
Who We Are

Roslindale Open Studios is an annual event entering its 9th year of supporting aspiring and seasoned artists as they showcase their work in the close-knit Boston neighborhood of Roslindale. We’ve grown from a small group of a few dozen artists to over 100 artists in nearly 50 locations. Our eclectic array of home studios, local talent and unique work is proof that our small community can do big things!  Roslindale Open Studios a volunteer-driven endeavor by a small committee of local artists who don't get paid to plan this entire event. Residents actively take part in all the neighborhood’s unique and fun events; and every year, thousands descend upon Roslindale during the first weekend in November for Roslindale Open Studios.

What We've Already Done

We've been working hard and have ambitious goals! 

Just this year we have:

  • Created a fresh, new logo
  • Revamped our website
  • A paperless application and payment process. 
  • Planning to redesign our brochure to make it more streamlined, compact and user-friendly. 

Why We Need Support!

For the first time in the nine seasons, Roslindale Open Studios is in need of new banners and signage. We have delayed printing new banners, signage and brochures that will allow for us to strengthen our brand and increase our outreach about the arts. 

If we raise $5,000 we can fund the following:

  • A large and centrally located map to help patrons navigate throughout the neighborhood.
  • New signage for our group locations and home studios. 
  • New brochures, postcards and posters
  • Provide music and other entertainment at our group sites



It takes a Village to make such a wonderful event happen, so we hope we can count on you! We’re offering many wonderful incentives to show our appreciation! Thank you for backing our project!

story:
Our Story

THANK YOU for visiting our campaign, we truly appreciate your support in helping us achieve our hopes, goals, & dreams.  As a good friend of mine would say...                           ..NAMASTE... 

My name is Zachary D. Morgan & this is my lady Angella Gyure.

 

               *                                                 

Zac, 

                                          My

                                      PASSIONS

                               Glassblowing & Music.           

                             *                              *

After more than thirteen years of Glassblowing & Music I am beyond ready to turn my passions into a living. Just need to get over the first speedbump 

I live in Abq NM. I am currently trying to purchase the house I've lived in for my whole life,

I work in a garage at my house where I built my Glassblowing & Art studio. I love my shop works GREAT for me. I get to work at home and therefore am able to spend more time with my family, my ol'lady, Angella" and my dog 'Kupa'. :) It's nice to have that option. I'm currently working on building a website to sell my glass work and other items such as paintings, woodwork, and my music ect!                                                                                                           

My mom (who is also my landlord)has been renting the house to us for i dont know how long? but a long long time!  Recently she informed me  due to financial difficulties she must sell the house or else it's going to be FORCLOSED and takin by the bank :(               

I have been desperately trying to come up with a downpayment so can keep doing the things we love.

 I've decided if we can just get back to ZERO,and outta the red. we would be fine. just need a little help getting there with no time thats a lot to ask i know.I really wish it was not such short notice im sure we could work it out if we had more time.

 

 If we could make it to $1000! we could pay off the bills and be ok.    

Im sure i can manage that with a lot of hard work. 

 

 

                                                *

 

I have been workin like crazy, It's been kina rough lately, but my motto is, Whatever it takes to keep youre dreams alive!

My definition of dream's is love and passion. When your so passionate about  somthing & you Love so so much you find a way to make it possible.The things that are in your way seem to fade away, you do whatever it take's to make it happen, No matter the task how big or small if the prize is Love & Passion, you will conquer all! "ZR"

Whats life without Love & Passion?   

 

So thats where I'm at now....I do not want to lose my house that I've lived in since I was a wee lil' midget....I've worked too hard to get to where I am & it would be devastating to myself, my sanity and my business!

I look at this as a huge opportunity for me to own my own house and move foward with my glassblowng business, my music, and financial stability. 

I'm definately a creative person & I do believe anything is possible, especially when the right people are on your side! 

What do you think? do you believe? can we do this?

If you believe, I want you on my side!! you must be the optimist like me:)

So lets do it!

 

PERKS

 

Snaggletooth prints! 1st edition Prints! of a drawing i did in 2010! 11x17 posters! only $25 & shirts for $30!  

Some perk's for the believers!

$1 you can do it Buddy!

$2 two Helping hands!!

$3 Buck achiever Believers!!!

$4 Quad Bucks 4 Luck!!

$5 Keep dreams Alive!

 

For those who are Alive!! 

You will get a post card with my Idol Dale Chihully's beautiful Art/glasswork on it! each one is unique and amazing! as a reminder that you are Alive!  And it is Possible to make a Difference in this weird world we live in!   Someday I hope to be as good as Dale, heck maybe even better! :)  

 

I'm offering a bunch of PERKS!!! for my contributors. Hand blown glass by yours truly! Zac D. Morgan :)  Like these candy dishes! i was eating salsa  

                                                                                                                                                             ... the BIG PERK is a GIBSON EPIPHONE LES PAUL STANDARD!!! for the largest donator:) 

*

The Impact

The impact from our campaign will allow us to own our home & keep doing all the things we love & are passionate about. It will allow me to expand my business. I would be able to increase the size of my studio invest in more equipment & start TEACHING glass lessons!

I will be able to produce and record my own music!, and would love to produce anyone else who wants to be recorded but does'nt have the kinda money it takes to pay for studio time! produce albums and share my passion for glass,music,etc. with the world.

Most of all we will be taking the burden off my mom's shoulders by taking over the house and payments.

 I hope to bring smiles and warm fuzzy feelings to my students, listeners, friends, and family....inspire and motivate people, share my intrests and passion. I hope to create beautiful and amazing art and music, while having fun and enjoying each & every accomplishment.

 

 Any amount will help! Even if you cant donate money...just posting and sharing this link with everyone you know would help a ton and be much appreciated. Thank you!

We want all contributors/supporters to know we greatly appreciate your help and kindness!!! It means more than you could possibly know.

Whether we succeed or not, we still thank you for your time, support, and donations to help myself, my mom, my girlfriend and my pup Kupa!:) woof!

 We thank you all from the bottom of our hearts.

Zachary D. Morgan,  Angella Gyure, and Koop doggie!

 

 I'd like to thank  MR. Miro for the inspiration!!!  "NAMASTE"

 

MORE ABOUT ME.....

Another passion of mine that will also be possible if I/we accomplish this overwhelming task is production of music mine aswell as others.

I love everything about music recording,mixing,mastering,live sound,making and editing music videos are all things i love and enjoy doing.

I play guitar,piano,drums,bass & vocals....I also make my own beats/loops :) I pretty much love anything that has to do with art & music! I play/record in my living room with a tascam digital 8 track. I've been recording and going through all my original songs that have accumulated over the years so i can finally complete my album:)

I have more than enough original music for two albums but one thing at a time right. Have to make sure I have the house situation under control first before I delve into another task.

I love glassblowing making music! these things are my life! and ive learned alot about them but more about myself from these things. I wouldn't know what to do if I couldn't do the things I love & share them with the world :)

                                       

 

                                              DVD LIST!!!

DVDS! I have a massive dvd collection. I'll post them all up for you to see & pick through! (first come first serve basis)First Snow,Strange wilderness,Dawn of the Dead,Friday,Chicken Run,A-team,True Lies,Amores Peros,Goodbye lennon,Good & evil toy machine sk8 video,About Shmidt,Carlitos way,Braveheart,Casino Royal,Romeo must die & cradle to the grave on 1 disc,Traitor,Fear,Dave Chapple,Anger Management,Armagedden,Starsky & Hutch,Way of the gun,Tears of the sun,Luck number sleven,Blow,Jarhead,spiderman 1-2-3,Drag me to hell,bulletproof Munk,fido,Pineapple Express,The Grand,Dont say a word,Rock n' Rolla,Doomsday,Rock 1 & 2,The Hurricane,Dead man walking,Body of lies,Ghost Rider,The Deer Hunter,Pancho Villa,Dude wheres my car,Stand by Me,Rambo,Point Break,Hustle and Flow,King of california,the return of the living dead,Envy,Machete,Harold & kumar 1 & 2,Law Abiding citizen,Hitman,Punisher 1&2,Lord of the rings two towers,aeon flux,catch me if you can,Butterfly effect,Greenstreet Hooligans,spys like us,Legend of the fist,Tropic Thunder,One night at Mcools,Requiem for a Dream,House of flying daggers,Broken Flowers,The wheight of water, Austin Powers gold member,mr. Brooks.Idiocracy,Aliens1-2-3,Labrynth,Wildthings,Pulp Fiction,Fun with Dick & jane,Natural Born Killers,Daredevil,Crouching tiger Hidden Dragon,Spawn cartoon,Ironman,300,d.o.a.,sin city,Unbreakable,Hancock,Copout,jonah hex,iron man 2,Batman begins,x-men123,vampire hunters,dynomite warrior,Hellboy 1&2 three disc directors cut,The last Samuria,Aqua teen Hunger Force the movie 2 disc,Aqua teen hunger vol 2,Stoned,Public Enemies,Born to Fight,the Count of Monte Cristo,Funny Games,Dont be a menace,Varsity Blues, shrek 1&2,Return of the living dead,motorcycle diarys,The Karate Kid,The wire comple 1st season,Oldschool,District 9,The devils rejects,Wicker Park,The Prime gig,Ray,9,Dead man,Starship Troopers,belly,Godzilla,Notorouis,Valkyrie,Pride & Glory,into the wild ,War inc,leaves of grass,The Onion,Robin hood,Animal house,Taken,Homegrown,Hudson Hawk,The whole nine yards&the whole ten yards 1 disc,Team America,Without a paddle,the cat in the hat,Van helsing cartoon,Hero,Kalifornia,Wyanes World,Very bad things,house of a 1000 corpses,the cable guy,Sherlock Holmes,The Prestiege,Rightous kill,Ninja Assassin,Blazing Saddles,Office Space,corky Romano,Blood Diamond,once apon a time in mexico,Cloverfield,Little Nicky,Nothing but trouble,meet wally sparks,Flushed Away,undercover Brother,The Decent,syriana,Ultraviolet,the protector,the time machine,The machinest,Wally,Bourne supremacy,Sleepy hollow,Burn after reading,28 weeks later,The wolfman,dodgeball,Rat race,tratior,simipro,Naked gun2&1/2,Fear,paprika,,The dark knight,Big Daddy,School of Rock,Idenity,Young Guns,Saving Private Ryan,Texas Chainsaw massacre the begining,Wonderland,Zombie honeymoon,zombie diarys,ghostbusters,i am legend,suicide kings,war of the worlds,matrix reloded,Children of men,reno 911 the movie,four brothers,there will be blood,super troopers,the forgotten ,silent hill,halloween,harlem nights,windtalkers,deja vu,the mask,the itialin job,the running man,and more the list goes on n on :)

story:
Our Story

I turn 41 next week (March 13th) and as I reflect back over the years I feel very satisfied with the service oriented life that I have led. This gift however is completely self serving!

I met Bridget Nielsen, the artist of this piece, a few months ago. I find Bridget and her work completely inspiring! 

I saw this piece at her art show last month where "Beaming Ecstasy" had a profound impact on me. It called to me and I have said YES!  With your help I can bring it home. 


Check out Bridget's information and art at BridgetNielsen.com

The Impact

I want to house this piece in my home and let its vibration and beauty infuse my home and Spirit. This campaign is self serving yet I wanted to offer the energy of the painting to you as well and thought that a meditation with you in mind would serve us both! 
The next forty years is about collaboration, expansion, synergy, loving, intention, discernment, surrender, and grace! This painting evokes this in me and will be a beautiful visual reminder every day. And hopefully to you as well if you choose to join in this experiment. 

What We Need & What You Get

I have put a deposit down on this piece and would love help in collecting the rest of the funds to bring it home. Any amount will be greatly appreciated and if you opt out of this experiment, nothing is lost. This painting will still find its way to me :-)  Depending on which perk you choose, you will get to offer your loving support to me personally, you will get a devoted mediation for either you or someone you love, you can choose the date if that is relevant and choose a follow up loving supportive call!
Be sure to email or FB me with your specific requests. Laurel.Lewis@yahoo.com

Other Ways You Can Help

You can help support this effort by sharing it online or talking to our mutual friends about it. 40 years! I have had a tremendous journey filled with so much love and support and want to take this opportunity to replenish my Soul with some meaningful art so that the journey may continue with devotion, play, and presence! 

Thank you for your consideration and participation in my life!!! Sending you all big love!


Laurel
story_txt:
Our Story
I turn 41 next week (March 13th) and as I reflect back over the years I feel very satisfied with the service oriented life that I have led. This gift however is completely self serving!
I met Bridget Nielsen, the artist of this piece, a few months ago. I find Bridget and her work completely inspiring! 
I saw this piece at her art show last month where "Beaming Ecstasy" had a profound impact on me. It called to me and I have said YES!  With your help I can bring it home.

story:
Printed Hues ... Making Things Pretty. Here at Printed Hues, we think everything should be pretty. Every product you buy... your curtains, stationery, tissue boxes, rugs, trash cans, cell phone cases, notebooks... anything and everything. It should all be pretty and make you smile. We're here to make that happen. 

No, we don't make all those things. Someone else does. But they need cool designs to decorate those things. That's where Printed Hues comes in. 

Printed Hues is breaking into the surface pattern and art licensing world with its fresh, approachable designs. We want to see our designs on products in major retailers all over the world. To really make a splash, we need to attend the SURTEX trade show in May 2013. SURTEX is the marketplace for original art and design, and the only place to find buyers from every product category imaginable under one roof. 

Your support will fund the booth fees associated with attending SURTEX. We've signed up for a 10x10 booth ($4500) in the May 2013 show. We're covering the travel expenses, costs of printing materials and advertising expenses. We're also attending Printsource New York, another key trade show for art licensing, in January 2013. The connections made there are sure to increase traffic at our SURTEX booth and help us land more licensing deals! 

Printed Hues is uniquely positioned to succeed quickly in the arena of art licensing and surface pattern design. Between Laura's eye for design, approachable aesthetic and technical skill and Stratton's business savvy, we are gearing up to license original art and design to manufacturers all over the world. Get ready to see Printed Hues designs all over the place!

Take a peek at some Printed Hues designs and see why we think our designs should be featured on products of all sorts: 


Here are some of the designs you'll get to choose from for your perks:

Now imagine seeing them on all sorts of products! Don't you want to be a part of that? Yep, we thought so. Thanks for supporting Printed Hues and sending us to SURTEX!

story:
The Sounds of Iceland project

The last ten years or so we have been recording various sounds from Icelandic nature. Many of these sounds are similar to those one could find in many countries around the world. However, there are some sounds - or rather sound environments -that may define Icelandic nature more than others, and these are the sounds we are interested in allowing others to experience. These are sounds of glaciers, geothermal activity, Icelandic bird life in tundra and then radio waves recordings of northern lights. 

Since the actual recordings of the nature sounds are already done - the funds needed are only to make these sounds available to others - CD's and a proper website.

The aim is to start with a sort of "best of" disk with good examples - have some 1000 CD's and a website made. This should be enough to get this project going and allow us to publish more recorded material as well as keep on recording more nature sounds and publish as they become available, 

Below are descriptions of selected soundscapes we captured and intend to make available on the first CD.  The description of each track is just like it will be on the CD.


1.Glacier: Sólheimajökull

Sólheimajökull is a glacier tounge that extends from Mýrdalsjökull , the glacier that holds one of the most feracious volcanos in the world, Katla. As you listen notice a slight but constant low to low-mid frequency rumble throughout the whole recording – this is not the wind but probably the sound of the glacier crawling onwards. Near the beginning there is more low frequency content due to large chunks of ice falling into the river at the side of the glacier. Also, notice around minute 6:20 - in the distance you can hear a large chunk of ice breaking from the glacier and falling into the river at the side of the glacier. Perhaps the most peculiar sound in this recording is an unexplained sort of punch at around minute 10:09 – and just a second before it there is a slight electric disturbance. This is not human made because at the time of the recording there were only five people on the glacier and all of these people were very far away. Furthermore, there is nothing situated this close to the microphone that could have made this sound – so, there is really no explanation. If you can think of some explanation then please let us know. This recording was conducted some time mid summer after midnight 2011.

2.Glacier: Svínafellsjökull 

Svínafellsjökull is a glacier tounge that extends from Vatnajökull, the largest glacier in Europe. The Svínafellsjökull area has been used for films such as Batman Begins and Game of Thrones and is known to shine spectacular blue colours. When listening carefully to this recording one should easily notice the vast number of different sounds. Underneath there is a faint rumble that varies throughout the recording but there are no big surprises and the multitude of gentle sounds compose a spectacular piece of art. Like the recording at Sólheimajökull, this recording was conducted on a beautiful night in the summer of 2011.

3. Geothermal: Krýsuvík 

There are quite a few places in Iceland with geothermal activity. Krýsuvík is one of these areas, on the Reykjanes peninsula, situated in the middle of the fissure zone on the Mid-Atlantic Ridge. It has several geothermal fields, such as mud pots, hot springs, solfataras and fumaroles. Because of the different types, the sounds are also different but constant. The recording was conducted between six and seven in the afternoon sometime in the spring of 2013.

4. Tundra: Skorradalur 

Iceland almost totally lacks any proper woodland but instead has areas covered with all kinds of tough vegetation that cover the land in large areas - and colors the land beautifully during the summer months. One such area is Skorradalur which is about an hour drive north from the capital of Reykjavik. This recording is quite diverse, having different kinds of birds, some different intensity of rain, and a babbling brook in the distance. The recording was done on a wet night in the middle of summer 2005.

5. Tundra: Úlfljótsvatn 

Another example of Iceland tundra is this very lively recording made on a small mountain near Lake Úlfljótsvatn – around an hour drive east from Reykjavik. The main actors in this recording are the birds, but the area has a large bird population. The recording was done on a quiet night early summer 2004.

6. Aurora Borealis/Northern lights: outside Reykjavik

In winter time one can often see beautiful northern lights in the sky above all over Iceland. However, few people know that these magnificent things also make some interesting sounds that can be captured with specially made equipment. The sound is alien as well as a bit haunting. These recordings were captured just outside Reykjavik early winter 2014.

story:
OUR CAMPAIGN: We are an art couple who has been together for 14 years. When we meet we feel instantly in love. The years went by and everything seemed perfect but something was missing - and that something was a baby.

After a miscarriage the doctor told us that the only way for us to have a child is through IVF.

Now we need your help to raise the money for this treatment. 

We offer you an unique opportunity to purchase our artwork and in exchange we'll get a possibility to have a baby. 


OUR BACKGROUND:

The award-winning art studio Ingela and Vi consists of Elisabeth M Marttala (illustrator/visual artist) and Peter Turkalj (photographer). They started working 2004 on an experimental scenographic image expression with integration of unexpected combinations, which made  them world famous in the art of tactile design. Since then they have been creating wildly original and intriguing work that has become their trademark style. www.ingelaochvi.com


Elisabeth's own illustration style called 'Illustrated by Em' is something she has been devolping for the last 3 years. Her unique style, which she calles 'sprayed' have appeared in various magazines. One of her proudest assignment is the cover illustration of the magazine Filter's support journal for the captured Swedish journalists Johan Persson & Martin Schibbye. www.illustratedbyem.tumblr.com


OUR NEEDS:
Help to raise money for our IVF treatment. 


YOU'LL GET:
SIGNED AND NUMBERED ARTWORK FROM THE ARTIST 'ILLUSTRATED BY EM' AND FROM THE ART STUDIO 'INGELA OCH VI'. EVERY ARTWORK IS IN LIMITED EDITION OF 30. Selected 'illustrated by Em' prints are from her yearlong project called 'Celebrity of the week' where she portraited various celebs who in some way are or has been inspirers, trendsetters or innovators and that they somehow do or have done an imprint. And from 'Ingela och Vi' we have selected some classic scenographic-photo prints.

 

   ILLUSTRATED BY EM ARTWORK                       INGELA OCH VI ARTWORK

  

                      


ILLUSTRATED BY EM ARTWORK            

INGELA OCH VI ARTWORK


V+D=SANT (V+D=TRUE) PORCELAIN SET OF THE CROWN PRINCESS VICTORIA AND PRINCE DANIEL OF SWEDEN.


                     

                                   
SPECIAL EDITION POSTER FOR THIS CAUSE. AVAILABLE SIZES: A4(21x29,7cm) AND A3(29,7x42cm). LIMITED EDITION OF: 30 EACH SIZES.

story:
some of the best schooling i've ever had - YEMOYA

- Che Kothari, Photographer/Artist-Activist/Instigator YEMOYA INDIA 2012


in order to cultivate a healing tree in the world, I must first nurture its roots in my soul

who am I and what is YEMOYA

My name is d'bi.young anitafrika and I am an Afrikan-Jamaican-Canadian dubpoet, monodramatist and educator who is passionate about people, self-actualization, storytelling and mentorship. In 2008 I founded an international artist residency named YEMOYA, in an attempt to combine all my passions. 7 years later, I have mentored over 50 artists globally through the residency. Let's celebrate them together by publishing a hard cover photo book featuring these global artists soon to become world leaders!

I follow a cyclical–reciprocal model of teach and learn, mentor and be mentored, using art as a medium of self-interrogation and expression while mirroring the society around me. I believe that artists are responsible for honouring the sacred in our present-day societies. People, our livelihoods, our planet, our cosmos, and beyond are sacred. I feel that if the work we create is truly for the people then we can’t avoid asking questions about our present state of being (globally, nationally, locally, personally). 

If you had known me and also known yourself, you would not have killed me. 

- Geordie Trifa, Filmmaker/HipHop Artist YEMOYA Jamaica 2013

YEMOYA is a three week international artist residency, that combines trans-disciplinary arts training with wellness practices for the (w)holistic development of people. Founded in summer 2008 in toronto canada, YEMOYA’s intensive twenty-one day program focuses on the creative, physical, mental, emotional and spiritual growth and development of its resident artists, using the Sorplusi Method. 

YEMOYA alumni include international artists such as Ngozi Paul, Kemba King, Titilope Sonuga, Jamilah Malika, Ria Hartley, Che Kothari, Bahia Watson, Mriga Kapadiya, LInda Kaoma, Amanda Parris, Adiyana Morris, Liza Paul, Julene Robinson, Raphael Cohen, Lishai Peel, Colanthony Humphreys, Kalmplex, Erin Bosenberg, Webster McDonald and Geordie Gescha. 

Residencies have been hosted in Canada, England, South Africa, Belize, Jamaica and The Bahamas with artists from additional countries such as Zimbabwe, Nigeria and America.

Photos by Wade Hudson

listen to your art and in turn you will learn to listen to yourself

What Is The Project FACES of YEMOYA

Working alongside the phenomenal Jamaican-Canadian photographer Wade Hudson, we would like to photograph the alumni artists of YEMOYA, interview them about their life and art since completing the residency, and choose an excerpt from what they created during the program; all to be featured in The Faces of YEMOYA hard cover book with each artist's full profile.

Why is the Faces of YEMOYA photo book important

These are the change-makers of the world. Supporting their growth and development through the YEMOYA program and the YEMOYA book gives us an opportunity to witness what happens to a seed when we water it and give it love constantly; it grows in(to) a dynamic forest that serves us all. This book is also a way to connect artists globally and foster communication across borders and cultures. It will serve as an inspiration to emerging artists worldwide who are able to connect with the artists and their profiles presented in the book; a living reflection of themselves and their potential.

The sorplusi method helped me to break down my preconceived notions that ‘real’ artists somehow exist on a plane different from the rest of us. It taught me that as long as I stay true to what is in my heart, my stories are worth sharing. 

- Liza Paul, Playwright/Actor/Producer YEMOYA India 2012

The Sorplusi Method - a YEMOYA Framework

The Sorplusi Methodology is a framework for 1) self-actualization 2) artistic creation and 3) public engagement towards community mobilization, that (a) focuses on the holistic development of the practitioner in the process of self-discovery & recovery, before, during, and after rigorous self-exploration; (b) helps the practitioner to identify their personal and professional integrities in art creation and dissemination (c) equips the practitioner with the tools to mentor others in their development towards the development of community. Based on seminal work of pioneer dubpoet Anita Stewart (d’bi’s mother), these ideas form a comprehensive eco-system of accountability and responsibility between the practitioner and their communities.

I must find peace within to mirror peace in the outside

There are eight guiding principles in the method: Self-knowledge, Orality, Rhythm, Political Content and Context, Language, Urgency, Sacredness and Integrity. These are balanced by and explored through the practitioner’s five bodies: the physical, emotional, mental, creative and spiritual. Each principle challenges us to live to our deepest integrities; to not only be self-invested but to (re)position to the centre of our micro and macro communities. Like a storyteller sitting under a tree, at the centre of the village, telling stories to the community gathered, the practitioner’s re-positioning urges them to become both accountable and responsible (able to account for and respond to) their communities. Participants of the residency create works of art catalyzed by their biographical experiences during the course of the residency.

we are the stories we have been told, the stories we believe and the stories we retell


What We Need & What You Get

The goal we have set for the project is $18,000 to cover everything related to organizing, interviewing, designing, photographing, and printing the FACES OF YEMOYA book.

  • Photo studio $3000
  • Book design $1500
  • Cover & Dust Jacket $1000
  • Administrative costs $2000
  • Printing Costs 200 hard cover copies $5000
  • Transportation costs $500

You can help us achieve our goal. For your loving contribution, there are some wonderful perks that are available to you that range from products to workshops to performances and even guest spots in the upcoming YEMOYA international artist residency taking place in Hawaii in August!

If we don't reach our entire goal, we will STILL publish a book, adjusting our aims to match the funding we receive.

r/evolution is love

Lyrics and prose I write are grounded in politicized messages, identity-based experience, and that which I call my truth.

- Jamilah Malika, Writer/Performer/Teacher YEMOYA Canada 2010


The Impact


There is ONE message that all the artists who have participated in the YEMOYA international residency have and that message is LOVE! Through the art that they create they spread love on the planet! And what we need is more LOVE!

it takes a global village to publish a book

Other Ways You Can Help

No worries if you are unable to financially contribute, you can help us in other ways. Please spread the word about our campaign. Help us by telling a friend or five. Share the links and spread the love!

WHO IS THIS WOMAN D'BI.

d’bi.young anitafrika is an internationally celebrated African-Jamaican-Canadian dubpoet, monodramatist, educator and mother to her sons moon and phoenix. She is the published author of two collections of poetry, eight plays, two dubpoetry albums, and The Sankofa Trilogy. d’bi. is the recipient of two Dora Mavor Moore Awards, the K.M. Hunter Theatre Award, Toronto Mayor’s Arts Council Award, the Women of Resilience Award, the Canadian Poet of Honor Award and the Best Spoken Word Artist Award. She is the Artistic Director of YEMOYA International Artist Residency and the originator of the Sorplusi Method. d’bi. is also the Program Designer and Facilitator of the Arts, Activism and AIDS Academy – a recent project of the Stephen Lewis Foundation and the Director of The Art(is)t Shaman Project. Her storytelling and mentorship have taken her to Africa, the Caribbean, South Asia, North America, Europe and the United Nations, where she has shared her passion for equality and integrity with all whom she meets. d’bi.’s latest offering is her new school, WATAH womb arts healing, based in Toronto Canada, where she teaches arts-based courses aimed at self-actualization towards global mobilization. dbi333.com | watah.org | yemoya.org

Photo by Wade Hudson

(globally, nationally, locally, personally). 
If you had known me and also known yourself, you would not have killed me. - Geordie Trifa, Filmmaker/HipHop Artist YEMOYA Jamaica 2013YEMOYA is a three week international artist residency, that combines trans-disciplinary arts training with wellness practices for the (w)holistic development of people. Founded in summer 2008 in toronto canada, YEMOYA’s intensive twenty-one day program focuses on the creative, physical, mental, emotional and spiritual growth and development of its resident artists, using the Sorplusi Method. YEMOYA alumni include international artists such as Ngozi Paul, Kemba King, Titilope Sonuga, Jamilah Malika, Ria Hartley, Che Kothari, Bahia Watson, Mriga Kapadiya, LInda Kaoma, Amanda Parris, Adiyana Morris, Liza Paul, Julene Robinson, Raphael Cohen, Lishai Peel, Colanthony Humphreys, Kalmplex, Erin Bosenberg, Webster McDonald and Geordie Gescha. Residencies have been hosted in Canada, England, South Africa, Belize, Jamaica and The Bahamas with artists from additional countries such as Zimbabwe, Nigeria and America.Photos by Wade Hudsonlisten to your art and in turn you will learn to listen to yourselfWhat Is The Project FACES of YEMOYAWorking alongside the phenomenal Jamaican-Canadian photographer Wade Hudson, we would like to photograph the alumni artists of YEMOYA, interview them about their life and art since completing the residency, and choose an excerpt from what they created during the program; all to be featured in The Faces of YEMOYA hard cover book with each artist's full profile.Why is the Faces of YEMOYA photo book importantThese are the change-makers of the world. Supporting their growth and development through the YEMOYA program and the YEMOYA book gives us an opportunity to witness what happens to a seed when we water it and give it love constantly; it grows in(to) a dynamic forest that serves us all. This book is also a way to connect artists globally and foster communication across borders and cultures. It will serve as an inspiration to emerging artists worldwide who are able to connect with the artists and their profiles presented in the book; a living reflection of themselves and their potential.
The sorplusi method helped me to break down my preconceived notions that ‘real’ artists somehow exist on a plane different from the rest of us. It taught me that as long as I stay true to what is in my heart, my stories are worth sharing. - Liza Paul, Playwright/Actor/Producer YEMOYA India 2012The Sorplusi Method - a YEMOYA FrameworkThe Sorplusi Methodology is a framework for 1) self-actualization 2) artistic creation and 3) public engagement towards community mobilization, that (a) focuses on the holistic development of the practitioner in the process of self-discovery & recovery, before, during, and after rigorous self-exploration; (b) helps the practitioner to identify their personal and professional integrities in art creation and dissemination (c) equips the practitioner with the tools to mentor others in their development towards the development of community. Based on seminal work of pioneer dubpoet Anita Stewart (d’bi’s mother), these ideas form a comprehensive eco-system of accountability and responsibility between the practitioner and their communities.I must find peace within to mirror peace in the outsideThere are eight guiding principles in the method: Self-knowledge, Orality, Rhythm, Political Content and Context, Language, Urgency, Sacredness and Integrity. These are balanced by and explored through the practitioner’s five bodies: the physical, emotional, mental, creative and spiritual. Each principle challenges us to live to our deepest integrities; to not only be self-invested but to (re)position to the centre of our micro and macro communities. Like a storyteller sitting under a tree, at the centre of the village, telling stories to the community gathered, the practitioner’s re-positioning urges them to become both accountable and responsible (able to account for and respond to) their communities. Participants of the residency create works of art catalyzed by their biographical experiences during the course of the residency.we are the stories we have been told, the stories we believe and the stories we retellWhat We Need & What You GetThe goal we have set for the project is $18,000 to cover everything related to organizing, interviewing, designing, photographing, and printing the FACES OF YEMOYA book.
Photo studio $3000
Book design $1500
Cover & Dust Jacket $1000
Administrative costs $2000
Printing Costs 200 hard cover copies $5000
Transportation costs $500
You can help us achieve our goal. For your loving contribution, there are some wonderful perks that are available to you that range from products to workshops to performances and even guest spots in the upcoming YEMOYA international artist residency taking place in Hawaii in August!If we don't reach our entire goal, we will STILL publish a book, adjusting our aims to match the funding we receive.r/evolution is love
Lyrics and prose I write are grounded in politicized messages, identity-based experience, and that which I call my truth.
- Jamilah Malika, Writer/Performer/Teacher YEMOYA Canada 2010The ImpactThere is ONE message that all the artists who have participated in the YEMOYA international residency have and that message is LOVE! Through the art that they create they spread love on the planet! And what we need is more LOVE!it takes a global village to publish a bookOther Ways You Can HelpNo worries if you are unable to financially contribute, you can help us in other ways. Please spread the word about our campaign. Help us by telling a friend or five. Share the links and spread the love!WHO IS THIS WOMAN D'BI.d’bi.young anitafrika is an internationally celebrated African-Jamaican-Canadian dubpoet, monodramatist, educator and mother to her sons moon and phoenix. She is the published author of two collections of poetry, eight plays, two dubpoetry albums, and The Sankofa Trilogy. d’bi. is the recipient of two Dora Mavor Moore Awards, the K.M. Hunter Theatre Award, Toronto Mayor’s Arts Council Award, the Women of Resilience Award, the Canadian Poet of Honor Award and the Best Spoken Word Artist Award. She is the Artistic Director of YEMOYA International Artist Residency and the originator of the Sorplusi Method. d’bi. is also the Program Designer and Facilitator of the Arts, Activism and AIDS Academy – a recent project of the Stephen Lewis Foundation and the Director of The Art(is)t Shaman Project. Her storytelling and mentorship have taken her to Africa, the Caribbean, South Asia, North America, Europe and the United Nations, where she has shared her passion for equality and integrity with all whom she meets. d’bi.’s latest offering is her new school, WATAH womb arts healing, based in Toronto Canada, where she teaches arts-based courses aimed at self-actualization towards global mobilization. dbi333.com | watah.org | yemoya.orgPhoto by Wade Hudson

story:
Honoring the Legacy of Ida B. Wells

We envision a monumental artwork honoring the life, work and words of Ida B. Wells, to be located in Bronzeville, the Chicago neighborhood where she once lived, worked and raised her family.

The art will be a fitting tribute to a legendary African-American woman who made a substantial contribution to civil rights for women and minorities during her lifetime, and left a great legacy of published writings.

The central sculpture, to be created by Richard Hunt, one of Chicago’s most honored sculptors, will invite reflection on Ida B. Wells’ writings and life, and provide inspiration to those who view this work of art. Upon completion, this monument will be donated to the City of Chicago’s Public Art Collection.

We're Looking to Fund the First Phase of Work

The Ida B. Wells Commemorative Art Committee is raising $100,000 in order for Richard Hunt to complete the design and obtain materials to start working on the interpretive and educational monument. The second phase will include completion and installation of the monument in the Langley Boulevard median, just south of 37th Street in Chicago’s Bronzeville neighborhood. The Langley Boulevard median lies at the heart of the Oakwood Shores community, on the former site of the Ida B. Wells public housing development.

There Are No Monuments to Women in Chicago!

Check out Michelle Duster and Anthony Rogers' recent interview with WBEZ to learn more about the importance of honoring Ida B. Wells in a public place.

About Richard Hunt

Richard Hunt, a world-renowned sculptor, will develop the monumental sculpture. He is a native Chicagoan, with over 50 years of experience in creating abstract works suggesting recognizable human and natural forms. Educated at the University of Chicago and the School of the Art Institute of Chicago in the 1950s, he has produced over 120 public-site sculptures. Chicago is home to 35 Richard Hunt sculptures and his work can be seen throughout the United States and as far away as Jerusalem and Vienna. Mr. Hunt holds 14 honorary degrees, and his work is represented in major museums and collections internationally.

The Ida B. Wells Commemorative Art Committee

Officers:

Anthony Rogers, Co-Chair
Sandra Young, Co-Chair
Ann McKenzie, Secretary
Jessica Caffrey, Financial Secretary

Members:

Dr. Carol Adams
Julie Elena Brown
Ald. William D. Burns
Dan Duster*
Michelle Duster*
Em Hall
Virginia M. Harding
Tiffany Ingram
Nathan Mason
Vanessa McClinton
Eve Moran, Esq
Shirley J. Newsome
Lee Pratter
Charis D. Tripplet
Claudice Ware
Joseph Williams

*Member of the Ida B. Wells family

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word!  And visit our Facebook page for more info on Ida B. Wells.

Please note: BPI - Business and Professional People for the Public Interest is the fiscal sponsor for the Ida B. Wells Monument project and your receipt will show up as being from that organization.  Rest assured that all of your dollars are going directly to support the monument.

story:
Grace knows how to computer

She was 37 years old and working as a mathematics professor when Pearl Harbour happened. She joined the Navy and was set to work on the first ever general-purpose electro-mechanical computer, the Harvard Mark I. She invented the compiler (used to translate computer programs written by humans into ones and zeroes that the computer can understand), created one of the most widely used programming languages of the 20th century, and was the first to use the term “bug” to describe computer errors, after a literal bug was caught in the relays of the machine she was working on.

After WW2 she left the Navy and worked for various tech companies, but kept serving in the Naval Reserve. As was usual, she retired from the Reserves at 60, but she was recalled to active duty by special executive order, and eventually rose to the rank of Rear Admiral. When she retired (again) she kept working as a consultant until the age of 85. She also did this great Letterman interview at the age of 80.

Don’t ever let anyone tell you women can’t computer, or that you’re too old to computer. Grace knows better.

What You Get

When I posted a picture of this linocut on Twitter, a lot of people asked me if I'd be selling prints.  The answer is yes.

Here's what you get:

A original linocut art print, printed with water-based ink on 220gsm A4 card stock (21cm x 29.7cm / roughly 8.5″ x 12″). The printed area itself is 17cm x 23cm (roughly 7″ x 9″).

Each print is made by hand, and there are small variations and differences as you would expect from this process.

The print is available in

  • black on white (standard)
  • colour ink on white paper (premium) - choose any colour ink from this range
  • black ink on colour (premium) - choose any colour paper from this range

The print will be shipped in a sturdy document envelope to prevent folding, spindling, or mutilation. Worldwide shipping (by standard postal service) is included in the price.

Note: prices are in AUD, which is a smidge cheaper than USD (0.94 USD at time of writing), just to save my international supporters a trip to the currency converter.

Why you should support me

I’m a community organiser who works in social justice, sustainability, and open technology. I do paid freelance work (tech for non-profits and social enterprise, event management, writing) and also spend 20+ hours a week on unpaid community and open source/tech work. I recently travelled to the US to attend several conferences around open technology and culture, which cut into my freelance work time. Around the same time, Gittip (through which I was getting a modest but steady stream of financial support) chose not to support activists on its platform, and I deleted my account.

Some of my projects: I founded Growstuff, an open source/data website for people who grow their own food, which also trains/mentors new coders (more than half our 60+ contributors are from marginalised groups in tech, non-traditional tech backgrounds, or are new to software development). I also founded and work on Geek Feminism, which addresses feminist issues in geek culture. One recent major project there was this guide for therapists to help women who are stressed and depressed by shitty workplaces or online harassment to get the help they need. You can read more about what I’m working on in a blog post from a month or two back.

The Impact

Apart from showing the world what a badass Grace is (a valuable goal in itself, in this age of dudes telling us that women don't know how to computer), if you buy a print you'll be helping support my other work as described above.

Risks & Challenges

This linocut is ready to go, and simply needs printing.  "Simply," hah.  Printing is a bit of a messy and time consuming process.  Each print is made by rolling ink onto the lino original, then placing the cardstock on it and rubbing to create as smooth a print as possible.  The prints are then allowed to dry for a few hours before handling.

The biggest risk here, for you, is that I simply don't follow through on this process.  I have to admit, that's possible, for instance if illness or some other major attack of life occurs.  However I don't see any particular reason or likelihood for this to happen.  I'm just putting it out there.

Another risk, which you will have to accept, is that handmade prints are individual pieces of art and each one is likely to have variations in colour and texture.  Don't view these as defects, but as individual quirks that make your piece of art unique.

If you choose the "premium" option (where you get different coloured ink or paper) there is a risk that your preferred colour may not be available.  If so, I will work with you to find another option that works.

Finally, there is a chance your print may get lost in the mail.  I'm going cheap on postage to keep costs down, so there's no tracking or anything.  If this happens to you, I'll do my best to get you another copy.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Teach people about Grace and her badassery. The world needs it.

And that's all there is to it.

Frequently Asked Questions

Will you sell t-shirts?

Maybe. I’m not sure how well this would work on a tshirt. Let me know if you’re interested and I’ll look into it.

I choose to only print t-shirts on organic cotton and in sizes that fit a wide range of body shapes. I have a print/ship vendor for this, though I’m afraid they’re not cheap. If you know other print-on-demand/they-handle-the-shipping tshirt vendors that offer t-shirts that fit those criteria (including fitted/”women’s” shirts in larger sizes) then please let me know. I’m not able to look into other printing/distribution options (eg.organising a screenprinting run) at this stage.

Can you print this on X item?

If it has a reasonably smooth surface, then probably.  If it has a textured surface (even as textured as cloth), then that's much harder. Talk to me and we can see if we can figure something out.

Is the image CC licensed?

The image is licensed CC-BY-SA. You may use it for any purpose as long as I am attributed (preferably with a link to this campaign, if you do it while the campaign is still running, otherwise to my website and/or Twitter) and your own work is licensed in the same way.

I request as a courtesy that you don’t sell anything with this image on it until I’m done with this fundraiser.

story:
Help Bring Mirror Art to Arundel Lodge and the Open Eye Gallery!


Please join our campaign to fund workshops by mirror artists Bob Benson and Rick Ames at Arundel Lodge and buy equipment which will allow our artists to create "flashies" for years to come. "It's a lot of fun. Anybody can do it," says Bob, who developed his own special process for flashy creation. "And it's very therapeutic."


Reflections of a Healing Community

We'll be placing the flashies on a tree sculpture in our Serenity Garden, a space for healing and wellness.



This is our tree stump. Yes, we know you can see that. But it was once a stately and beautiful tree, it sported bird houses, offered shade to anyone seeking it, and was loved by many who came to Arundel Lodge. Sadly, our tree had to be cut down when it became unsafe after bugs had their way with it.

It's been a few years now and there is still an empty spot where our tree used to be. We've had talks about how to honor the spirit of the tree and after talking with Bob and Rick, we thought what better way to bring new energy and light to this space than by creating a Reflection Tree and planting it right within the roots of the old stump. Life goes on doesn't it? 

Can you imagine it? A beautiful mirrored and reflective tree, created by so many hands, rising up from the roots of the tree which came before. It's going to be amazing!

In this world of "busyness" and appointments and stress, we are hoping to create an oasis of reflection and healing - but we need your help to make it happen! 



This summer, we started working on a serenity garden space. We have part 1 done, and are now working on adding the Reflection Tree - A shiny happy tree which will serve as the center point in our garden space. It will be just on the other side of the labyrinth (also coming soon!) and will provide a space for anyone who wishes to have some quiet reflection. Think about it - It's a beautiful day and you have a few moments, so you decide to park and sit down for a bit, reflecting on your day. You think of things you are grateful for and the sunshine sparkles all around, reflecting from the flashies on the tree. I can't wait to be there and I hope to see you there too!



Here's What We Need!

With $3000, we'll be able to buy the tools, mirror, and supplies to create the hundreds of flashy strands we'll need to add to the Reflection Tree. This will also help us pay Bob and Rick to come out and teach us how to make the flashies and how to create our very own Reflection tree, similar to the one which has stood outside of the American Visionary Art Museum, Baltimore, MD, for the last 8 years.

Bob and Rick have committed to donating the basic mirror we will need so this means we can focus on purchasing the colored mirror to accentuate the flashies!

We truly hope to reach our goal, but if we don't, we'll apply what we have and start where we are! Even if we have to pare down a bit, make the workshops smaller, we'll still be building flashies, it just might take us a bit longer to reach our goal.

Can’t fund a flashy? You can still help!

Help us spread the word by sharing our campaign on facebook, sending it to your friends, and encouraging people to check us out! 

Come by Arundel Lodge on Friday, November 14th, 6-9pm, and check out the flashy making workshop, or just stop in and see the amazing art created by the Arundel Lodge community. Together, we can make it happen! ! Help us build our tree and you can become a permanent addition to the Reflection Tree at Arundel Lodge, a space of healing and hope.


Arundel Lodge is a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization that has been providing services to individuals with behavioral health disorders in Anne Arundel County since 1975. Our mission is to partner with individuals and families to improve their mental health through recovery-oriented services. We currently serve close to 1,500 individuals in two Outpatient Mental Health Clinic locations and plan on welcoming approximately 600 individuals throughout this year; we provide Same Day Access so individuals can quickly receive the services they need; we have 32 residences in the community that 110 individuals can call home; the Supportive Living program provides support to individuals living in the community independently or with family; Arundel Lodge is also a Behavioral Health Home, coordinating all of an individual’s medical and behavioral health care needs; our Evidence-based Supported Employment Program helps individuals with behavioral health disorders locate competitive employment; and the Day Program provides life-skills classes, hot meals and opportunities for integration into the community. Additionally, artists in the art program exhibit their work in galleries across the region as well as in Arundel Lodge’s own Open Eye Gallery!
