there and I hope to see you there too!
Here's
What We Need!With $3000, we'll be able to buy the tools, mirror, and supplies to create
the hundreds of flashy strands we'll need to add to the Reflection Tree. This
will also help us pay Bob and Rick to come out and teach us how to make the flashies
and how to create our very own Reflection tree, similar to the one which has
stood outside of the American Visionary Art Museum, Baltimore, MD, for the last
8 years. 
Bob and Rick have committed to donating the basic mirror we will need so this means we can focus on purchasing the colored mirror to
accentuate the flashies! 
We truly hope to reach our goal, but if we don't, we'll apply what we have
and start where we are! Even if we have to pare down a bit, make the workshops
smaller, we'll still be building flashies, it just might take us a bit longer
to reach our goal. 
Can’t
fund a flashy? You can still help!
Help us spread the word by sharing our campaign on facebook,
sending it to your friends, and encouraging people to check us out! 
Come by Arundel Lodge on Friday, November 14th, 6-9pm, and check out the
flashy making
workshop, or just stop in and see the amazing art created by the Arundel Lodge
community. Together, we can make it happen! ! Help us build our tree and you can become a permanent
addition to the Reflection Tree at Arundel Lodge, a space of healing and hope.

Arundel
Lodge is a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization that has been providing services
to individuals with behavioral health disorders in Anne Arundel County since
1975. Our mission is to partner with individuals and families to
improve their mental health through recovery-oriented services. We currently serve
close to 1,500 individuals in two Outpatient Mental Health Clinic locations
and plan on welcoming approximately 600 individuals throughout this year;
we provide Same Day Access so individuals can quickly receive the services they
need; we have 32 residences in the community that 110 individuals can call home;
the Supportive Living program provides support to individuals living in the
community independently or with family; Arundel Lodge is also a Behavioral Health
Home, coordinating all of an individual’s medical and behavioral health care
needs; our Evidence-based Supported Employment Program helps individuals with
behavioral health disorders locate competitive employment; and the Day Program
provides life-skills classes, hot meals and opportunities for integration
into the community. Additionally, artists in the art program exhibit
their work in galleries across the region as well as in Arundel Lodge’s own
Open Eye Gallery!

story:
Howdy

I'm Bass. You probably already knew that, but I thought I'd get the formalities out of the way anyhow. 

Long story short, I'm trying to do a few things. 

  • Get a Cintiq
  • Create an Art-Book
  • Create more awesome stuff for all my fans in the future
I have been in the art game for quite a while, and I've fallen out and hit a lump. Well, I'm finally back on my stride and I'm ready to do several things, but to do it, I'm going to have to get over one really big hurdle, and I want to do it in the most effective way possible.

My tablet.

It's seen better days. It's about six years old and it only holds its connection -most- of the time. (Tried doodling the other day and that was a chore)

So I want to take the next step in the tablet world, A Cintiq. I want a good tablet that will help me produce more awesome content for my fans, and I want to do it right.

What I Need & What You Get

To break it down for you folks in more detail, I'm aiming for the highest of the high in the Cintiq line, and based on the contributions I get, will then decide on what I get, be it a brand new Cintiq 24HD Touch, or a used Cintiq 21ux.

BASICALLY you guys will decide ultimately what I get. So I'm going to offer some perks to help ensure that maybe I get closer to what I want than to what I'll settle for (though at the end of the day really anything would be great, and all donations would be super appreciated!)

I'll break it down further in the perks section, but if you donate, varying amounts could net you sketches, a spot in the art book, a digital copy of the art book, a PHYSICAL copy of the art book and more!

The Impact

You guys will basically be changing my career and putting it in my hands with more powerful, professional tools. I've known our fandom to be one of the greatest and most giving and I've never wanted to take advantage of that and I still don't. I hope through all of this that the only thing that comes of it is my ability to produce a better product for all the people who care about me and all the people I care about. I want to live up to promises and give people things they deserve.


Can't Donate? 

Spread the word! please if you can't donate then maybe spread the word out to the other furs and friends out there that may be able to help! Who knows, maybe they'll fund me just so they can get a commission of their own! but more than anything, your support is beyond money, beyond words.

story:
My name is Kathrin Schank, I’m a textile designer in my final year at the Shenkar College of Engineering, Art & Design in Tel Aviv, Israel. Growing up in the countryside between Germany and France influenced me as a designer in my work today in Israel.


This collection you are about to contribute to is my graduation project as a BA in design. It is based on illustrations I created, you could call them monster-creatures. I began working on this project in August 2013, researching the wonderful worlds of nomadic lifestyles & the use of tents as a way of life, that interested me and their diverse visual-textile language. They are all my original works and are to be printed on high quality fabrics. This campaign is the most significant thing in my life right now and is to be my debut collection after 4 years of studies. In designing this body of work I used different techniques such as watercolors, felt pens, pastel & gouache colors, paper cuts and finally scanning it all through a scanner to be digitally printed in the highest quality.

When printing textile designs, one tries to get as close as possible to the colors of the original work. In my school workshop I can print using silkscreens. However, after trying this out the results didn’t satisfy me. I had lost many colors and effects in the process. In this case the original colors are near impossible to achieve with anything other than high quality digital print. By contributing to my project you allow me to use the facilities of the highly renowned Glasgow based digital printing studio in Scotland named the “Centre for Advanced Textiles”. I have invested in this project my own savings so far, as well as the time and work for the year, including making first test prints in Scotland that yielded great results. The significant part of my remaining expenses in order to finish the project are however, too high for me to be able to complete alone.  And that is why I need your help. I need to cover the costs of scanning & printing all my designs in Glasgow, and even without me being there that is the core expense. In order to be able to overlook the process and insure my work is being printed correctly, I would want to be present as the work is done, this is a smaller expense yet still one I need help with.  


The scanning & printing costs:


  • Scanning - 250 Euro

  • Printing 13 Meter fabric - 750 Euro

  • 13 meter of Fabric - 400 Euro


What you get for contributing to my campaign:


  • For the ‘small yet helpful’ contribution of 5 Euro - You get a designed digital postcard sent to you in a personal email from me.

  • For the ‘1st stage hero’ contribution of 10 Euro -  You get a real life printed ‘thank you’ post card sent to your address. That’s a keeper you can pin-up on the wall!

  • For the ‘2nd stage hero’ contribution of 15 Euro - You get a set of 5 real life printed postcards sent to your address. That’s a keeper you can pin-up or send to other friends too!


                               


  • For the ‘we’re getting serious’ contribution of 20 Euro - You get to choose between

       1) A ‘Tote bag’ with a designed print from my collection for those shopping                                     trips or daily urban adventures.

       2) A tea towel designed with an original print from my collection                                                         for hosting important tea guests. 


  • For the ‘this is great!’ contribution of 30 Euro - You get a set of 2 tea towels with prints from my collection. No tea host can really do without them.


  


  • For the ‘like a pro’ contribution of 40 Euro - You get a unique T-shirt printed with my design from the collection.

            



  • For the ‘sweet dreams are made of these’ contribution of 55 Euro - You get 1 designed pillow case with prints from my collection, sized 50x50 Centimeters. So you can sleep in style.


              

  • For the ‘it takes 2 to tango’ contribution of 90 Euro - You get a set of 2 designed pillow cases with prints from my collection, sized 50x50 Centimeters and 40x40 Centimeters. So you can sleep in style twice, or with a partner. 


  • For the ‘angel in disguise’ contribution of 200 Euro - I will design for you, your own personalized monster per your request of color, mood and animal style that you like. This will be printed on the item of your choice from the list above.


If I do not reach the full goal of 1300 Euro I will still do everything in my power and capabilities to bring this collection to reality, however it won’t be easy with no further funding, so I hope you can help a little.

I truly believe design makes an impact in our daily lives. I hope to be able to make our lives a little bit more pleasant to the eye with my designs to be used in fashion, interior design and brighten our daily experiences.  

Hopefully, this project will reach many in the design and fashion world. As a final project it will help me make my first steps in this path. You can be a part of making this come to be.


Other Ways You Can Help

I know that some of you really want to help, but just can’t contribute right now. As a struggling student I understand, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:


  • Get the word out and my campaign with your friends, people who may be interested in design & art, really - every share helps.

  • Feel free to use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
ENGLISH VERSION BELOW


Vidéo de présentation : 00:00 à 01:41
Teaser de la websérie : 01:41 à 02:24


2 Gars 30 jours une web série pas comme les autres!
C’est l’histoire de deux hommes aux personnalités très différentes, Arno et Camille, mais qui ont tout de même beaucoup de choses en commun. Ils vivront des aventures palpitantes à travers des scènes célèbres de films qui ont su marquer l’imagination collective.


La naissance du projet!
Marc Desaulniers (réalisateur) et Martin Brisebois (Arno), ont réunis leur expériences d’amateurs de films d’action, d’horreurs et comédie des années  80` 90`et 2000, L’idée originale qui en découle est un retour en enfance, un mélange éclaté de réalité et de fiction  qui a donné vie à cette série.


Nos deux protagonistes
Arno, dont le rêve non négociable est de devenir un grand acteur, est venu vivre à Montréal quand il entendit parler des grandes productions hollywoodiennes qui tournent régulièrement dans cette ville.  Tout frais débarqué d’un petit village du nord du Québec, il fera rencontre de Camille ainsi que de plusieurs personnages qui bouleverseront sa petite vie.
Camille est un personnage sombre. Issu d'une famille mondaine, il n’a pas toujours trouvé de sens à sa vie, ce qui lui complique souvent les choses. Il voit en Arno un amis mais aussi quelqu’un qui pourra l’aider à remettre de l’ordre dans sa vie.

Notre casting comprends :

Jimmy Duperval

Alain Bérard

Stéphanie Aubry

Jean-François Raynaud

Woodson Louis

et plusieurs autres à venir.


Aide et support!
Avec quinze épisodes de tournés, nous en sommes à mi-chemin du projet. Il reste une quinzaine d’épisodes, que nous espérons tourner fin 2014 début 2015, avec une sortie au printemps prochain.
Nous ne demandons que le coût réel des journées de tournages (transport, nourriture, location d’équipements, post-production et montage). Les acteurs sont payés par le producteur et le reste des dépenses est réduits à l’essentiel.

Pourquoi participer à 2 gars 30 jours ?
Parce que, premièrement, l’équipe est extraordinaire. Tous unissent leurs efforts et travaillent ensemble avec plaisir et passion. Deuxièmement, le théâtre de notre série est cette ville vibrante et inspirante qu’est Montréal et finalement, nos inspirations pour une saison deux sont nombreuses.

C’est  plein d’action, c’est épeurant, c’est parodique, c’est triste, c’est bizarre, c’est parfois stupide et c’est drôlement touchant.
Une fois le montage terminé, nous présenterons la série dans des festivals, ce qui offre une certaine visibilité. Cela pourrait grandement contribuer à obtenir le financement nécessaire pour la poursuite du projet. 


L'argent ira à l'essentiel, incluant un ou des cadeaux à l'effigie de la websérie.

Toutes sommes vous vaudront une énorme reconnaissance de la part de toute l’équipe !


25$  Votre nom au générique (section spéciale à la fin de chaque épisodes).
50$  Tout ce qui précède en plus d’un DVD contenant toute la série.
100$  Tout ce qui précède en plus d’un t-shirt à l’effigie de la série.
200$  Tout ce qui précède en plus d’une tuque à l’effigie de la série et une photo du  poster autographié par Arno et Camille.
500$  Tout ce qui précède en plus d’une apparition dans un épisode spécial.
1000$ La totale plus, Tout ce qui précède en plus d’être attitré du producteur associé et d’un souper en compagnie d’Arno, Camille et l’équipe.

Il est possible de nous faire parvenir votre aide monétaire de la façon que vous voulez (chèque).

Veuillez nous contacter à : 2gars30jours@gmail.com pour faire les arrangements.


Nous sommes ouverts au partenariat et aux commandites.
Le ou les cadeaux seront remis au détenteur dans les meilleurs délais possible.
Livraison prévue printemps 2015.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

2 guys 30 days - Web series
Two people meet and will live hilarious adventures through the magic of classical films.


ʻʼ2 guys 30 daysʼʼ is a web series like youʼve never seen before!
Itʼs the story of two men with two completely different personalities, Arno and Camille, but who still have a lot in common. Theyʼre going to live exciting adventures via scenes from classic movies that have captured our imagination.


The birth of the project!
Marc Desaulniers (director) and Martin Brisebois (Arno) combined their love and
knowledge of action movies, horror movies and comedies from the 80ʼs, 90ʼs and
2000ʼs. This original idea takes us back to childhood, where we will meet a joyful mix of reality and fiction.


Our two protagosnists!
Arno, who has a non-negotiable dream of becoming a huge film actor, moved to
Montreal after hearing of all the big Hollywood blockbusters that are filmed in that great city. Just recently arriving from a small village in northern Quebec, he will meet Camille and a whole bunch of other characters that will turn his world upside down.
Camille is a gloomy character. Coming from a ???? family, he has yet to find a clear
meaning to his life, which often complicates things for him. He sees in Arno a friend but also a person that will help him put order in his life.

Our cast:
Jimmy Duperval
Stéphanie Aubry
Jean-François Raynaud
Woodson Louis
and many more to come.

Help and support!
With 15 episodes already shot, we are half way there. Thereʼs about 15 episodes left to film, which we are hoping to accomplish by the end of 2014, beginning 2015, to have a premiere in spring of 2015.


Our goal is to cover productions costs (transportation, food, equipment rental, postproduction and editing). Actors are paid by the producer and other expenses are brought down to the bare minimum.


Why give a hand to 2 guys 30 days?
Because, first and foremost, the team is incredible. Cast and crew members all work together and with passion.
Secondly, because the stage for our production is the beautiful, inspiring and vibrant city of Montreal.
Finally, to support and and encourage our hopes and aspirations for a second season.
This series is filled with action, itʼs scary, silly, sad, weird, sometimes stupid but mostly very touching.
Once the editing is complete, we will be showing the final product at film/TV festivals, which offers great visability. And that, in return, can contribute to financial backing for the continuity of our project.

Your contributions will go the the essentiels, including some gifts from the web
series.

Any contribution is HIGHLY appreciated on behalf of the whole team!!
25$-- Your name in the credits (Special section at the end of each episode)
50$--Everything before + DVD containing the whole series
100$-- Everything before + T-Shirt with the series logo
200$-- Everything before + tuque + picture of the series poster autographed by Arno and Camille
500$-- Everything before + a cameo in a special episode
1000$-- Everything before + associate producer credit + supper in the company of Arno, Camille and the team


Itʼs possible to send us your contribution by any means (ex: check).
Kindly contact us at: 2gars30jours@gmail.com to make arrangements

We welcome all sponsors.
All gifts will be given as soon as possible. Delivery currently aimed at spring 2015.

Thereʼs about 15 episodes left to film, which we are hoping to accomplish by the end of 2014, beginning 2015, to have a premiere in spring of 2015.Our goal is to cover productions costs (transportation, food, equipment rental, postproduction and editing). Actors are paid by the producer and other expenses are brought down to the bare minimum.Why give a hand to 2 guys 30 days?Because, first and foremost, the team is incredible. Cast and crew members all work together and with passion.Secondly, because the stage for our production is the beautiful, inspiring and vibrant city of Montreal.Finally, to support and and encourage our hopes and aspirations for a second season.This series is filled with action, itʼs scary, silly, sad, weird, sometimes stupid but mostly very touching.Once the editing is complete, we will be showing the final product at film/TV festivals, which offers great visability. And that, in return, can contribute to financial backing for the continuity of our project.Your contributions will go the the essentiels, including some gifts from the webseries.Any contribution is HIGHLY appreciated on behalf of the whole team!!25$-- Your name in the credits (Special section at the end of each episode)50$--Everything before + DVD containing the whole series100$-- Everything before + T-Shirt with the series logo200$-- Everything before + tuque + picture of the series poster autographed by Arno and Camille500$-- Everything before + a cameo in a special episode1000$-- Everything before + associate producer credit + supper in the company of Arno, Camille and the teamItʼs possible to send us your contribution by any means (ex: check).Kindly contact us at: 2gars30jours@gmail.com to make arrangementsWe welcome all sponsors.All gifts will be given as soon as possible. Delivery currently aimed at spring 2015.

story:
Active Rest has been selected for the Market Street Prototyping Festival (MSPF); an event sponsored by Yerba Buena Center of the Arts and the City of San Francisco. The goal is to create a more vibrant and positive experience on Market St. Read more about MSPF here. April 8-11, 50 prototypes will be erected downtown San Francisco along Market Street. 


Our Design

Active Rest came from a desire to combine our love of climbing with design. Really,  Active Rest can be many things:

  • It's a campusing  board
  • It's a bus stop
  • It's a meting place
  • It's a soap box
  • It's a place of meditation
  • the list goes on. 


The project was inspired by campusing (a training tool for rock climbers).It requires no extra equipment. It's something that can be done in a matter of seconds, or you could spend some time climbing around.  
Campusing boards are typically made of plywood. As an homage to both the campusing board and San Francisco's long history of wood construction, we chose 1/2" plywood as our primary building material.
so we wondered:
what if this?

Looked like this?



Who are we?

We are the Woodshed Collaborative. We're a group of designers, architects, structural engineers, and educators developing experimental art, architecture, and urban propositions as a means to hone in our craft outside of other professional obligations.


We are using this project as a great learning opportunity for Academy of Art Students. 


From concept design to physical assembly, students get a real life start to finish experience in creating an architectural piece.  


But we have also been working with engineers from Arup and Livermore Architecture & Engineering, Inc to make sure that the project works.



Your Support

With that said, we need help in purchasing materials. Between plywood, steel rods and transportation, we are looking to raise $5,000. Your donation would help us purchase the (pounds) of plywood needed. We have brainstormed some pretty cool donation perks and are very excited to get started with milling and assembling Active Rest!

Even if you aren't able to donate, you can still help by spreading the word! 

Tweet us, share us on a Facebook Status, or upload us into your Instagram Feed. The more social the better! Your help will make Active Rest a reality and we can work together to make Market Street the vibrant community we know it can be. 




This project will not only help to create a new and exciting environment in San Francisco. It's also a great learning tool for all of our students at the Academy of Art School of Architecture. Rather than just drawing buildings all day, they'll learn how to put a structure together and then actually get to make it...with their bare hands! It's a truly unique experience for them.


Other Ways You Can Help

Yes we need money, but most importantly, we need YOU. If you can't pledge financially, you can still let everyone you know about Active Rest.

story:
The Nuit Rose Festival

Nuit Rose Play/Space is the second edition of Nuit Rose, a vibrant, one-night-only, queer art and performance festival. Originally created for World Pride 2014, the inaugural Nuit Rose presented over 50 projects in several indoor and outdoor venues in two festival zones across Toronto. Nuit Rose returns to the Church-Wellesley Village and to West Queen Street West on the evening of June 20th 2015 with a multitude of events and presentations. Featuring art exhibitions, live music, dance, interactive performances, installations, video and film series, Nuit Rose showcases some of the best artists from across Canada, with new and diverse artistic voices from the queer community and beyond.
Audiences were thrilled by the WorldPride edition of Nuit Rose. The exuberant celebration of queer culture recalled the roots of the Pride movement, where locally organized events became sites for creativity and audience participation. The festival is always free and open to the public.
This year’s venues include the 519 Church Street Community Centre (Nuit Rose Hub – East Zone), the Canadian Lesbian and Gay Archives, Akasha Art Projects, Artscape/Youngplace (Shaw Street), the Theatre Centre and the Gladstone Hotel (Nuit Rose Hub – West Zone).

The Artists

Supporting Nuit Rose means proudly supporting the work of Canadian artists and local community organizations. All donated funds will help to provide opportunities for these talented individuals and groups to share their work with the public.

The artists appearing in Nuit Rose Play/Space are: 

Featured Artists

Damian Siqueiros– To Russia with Love / Akasha Art Projects
Kean O’Brien – Genocide / Canadian Lesbian & Gay Archives
Wynne Neilly – Female to “Male” / Canadian Lesbian & Gay Archives
Adam Zivo – Come As You Are / 519 Church Street Community Centre
Darryl Tracy Dance Company – lov/hunt / 519
The Counterpoint Community Orchestra – The Sound of Music / 519
Hugo Ares – Latino-Canadian Filmmakers Telling Stories / Theatre Centre
RT Collective – IN YOUR POCKET (Play/Space) / Videofag
Eshan Rafi – Video / Artscape Youngplace

Independent Artists

Ryan Livingstone – Mourning in the Morning / Artscape
Alan McIntosh – Remains of the Gays / Artscape
Violeta Rivera – A pink night in a multicolour mural / Artscape
Brad McDermott – The Homosexual Comedy / Artscape
Bruce Eves – Bruce Eves: Recent Work / Artscape
Christos Pantieras – Who Sits Here? / Artscape
Adam Moco & Andrew Coimbra – Tryst Pic x Andrew Coimbra / Artscape
Michael Venus – He Pops / Artscape
Evan Keleman – We ALL TRANSition / Artscape
Gambletron, Johnny Forever & Jamie Ross – Rusalka / Edward Day Gallery
Tottering Biped Theatre – First Dance / 519
Beck Gilmer-Osbourne – Lemon Scented / 519
Kayla Polan & Iona MacLeod – The Adventures of Shesus and Kink Girl / 519
The Reading Salon – Hamlet in a Kiddie Pool / 519
Seamus James Butterly – Pink Blanket Drive-in / 519
Pearl Lall – Bollywood Dance / 519
Florian Fructuoso & Guests – E.B. (Emotional Balance) / 519
Craft Action TO – Craft Action Banners / 519
Patrick Biller – Broadcast People / 519
Guillermina Buzio & Lorena Salome – Boundaries / Flight Centre (Church Street)
Alize Zorlutuna – Femme Futures (Church Street)
Link Tong – Nuit Rose’s Pink Carpet Experience (Church Street)
Christopher Lacroix – The Mis-Education of Homo
Francisco Gonzales Rosas – Adolescent Sex
Kelly Crawford – Bjorker

How to Support Nuit Rose

By selecting a level of support, you receive a corresponding perk. All funds go toward costs associated with the festival. Nuit Rose does not have an office, and operates with only one part-time staff Coordinator (paid by the Community One Foundation). As such, your funds go directly toward artist fees and event promotion, venue rentals and associated production costs. 

The Organizers

The first Nuit Rose was presented by a group of dedicated community volunteers and artists, in collaboration with numerous local cultural institutions and businesses. Formed in June 2013, The Throbbing Rose Collective is a group of independent LGBTQ artists, curators and arts producers who organized to develop a community-based art festival for WorldPride Toronto 2014.

Collective members past and present include:

Francisco Alvarez – Heritage Toronto
James Fowler – Curator, 10x10, The Church Street Mural Project & Queering Space
John Rubino - TDSB
Rodrigo Barriuso – Julie M Gallery
Michael Thompson - Artist
Sonja Sharfe – Akasha Art Projects
Britt Welter-Nolan – Myseum of Toronto
Christina Zeidler – Gladstone Hotel
Syrus Marcus Ware – AGO
Kaleb Robertson
Steph Rogerson
Joe Calleja

Other Ways You Can Help

Nuit Rose would like to hear from people interested in the arts, who wish to offer their time or expertise to the development of the festival. We are looking for dedicated volunteers and new collective members to assume key positions. Tell your friends about Nuit Rose, and come out for an evening of fun and entertainment. Follow us on social media or email us.  We thank you for reading about and supporting this exciting project.

info@nuitrose.ca
nuit.rose.toronto@gmail.com

story:
Who We Are

The Center for American Indian Research and Native Studies (CAIRNS) is an Indian-controlled nonprofit research and education center located in Pine Ridge Reservation. Since our beginning in 2004, we've stuck to our commitment of advancing knowledge and understanding of American Indian communities and issues important to them. We believe in the assets that are here in tribal communities, and are proud to present a project that celebrates the many strengths of Lakotas historically and today. Thank you very much for considering supporting this exhibit! Wopila Tanka!


What You Will Help Us Achieve

In contributing to this project, you will:
  • Help us bring a fundamental piece of Lakota history to the forefront of knowledge and understanding about Lakotas and Lakota communities.

  • Make it possible for us to present this critical narrative in a good way, with the reverence it deserves.

  • Amplify the voices of incredible Lakota men and women artists as they creatively respond to the narrative.

  • Make an incredible, formative experience available to young students in area school districts who will visit this exhibit and who are studying this narrative.

  • Broaden the dialogue between Native and non-Native community members in the Black Hills region of South Dakota, a place characterized by a tense history and persistent friction between these groups.

  • Support the self-determination of Lakotas and Lakota nations who, through this exhibit, are affirming, celebrating, and sharing their heritage.


What We Need & What You Get

We are asking for $8,000 in support from you to help see this project through. So far, this amazing project has only been possible through the generous and committed volunteer work of its organizers, our institutional partners, and our sixteen participating artists. It is necessary to us that the exhibit be free and open to the public, but this means that we have virtually no sources of revenue to help cover the many and diverse project costs of planning and hosting this exhibit. These costs include stipends for these accomplished artists, fabrication of the exhibit walls, displays, and literature, the production of the exhibit catalogue so that the impact of the experience can extend beyond the duration of the exhibit itself, hosting a catered, traditional Lakota foods event one of the evenings during the exhibit, and producing exhibit T-shirts and posters, in addition to the significant operational costs of CAIRNS in planning and executing this exhibit.


Your support will provide you the unique satisfaction of knowing you are part of a movement that is advancing knowledge and understanding of Lakota communities. Beyond this incredible collaboration alone, however, we have determined a number of ways of giving you a tangible sense of our appreciation. Our perks include a variety of CAIRNS educational products, different levels of sponsorship acknowledgment both online and in our printed exhibit catalogue, signed prints of the original artworks, and even several experiential opportunities, including a retreat to Wingsprings in the heart of Lakota lands and a tour of Wind Cave, the place of Lakota Emergence. See our campaign’s “Perks” on the right hand side of the page for more information.

The Exhibit

We are hosting a FREE exhibit that focuses entirely on the short Lakota emergence narrative titled, "How the Lakota Came Upon the World," published in 1917. The exhibit divides the 1,251-word narrative into 16 "passages."

What will it include? What can I expect to see?

-—-—-—-—-—-—-—-—-—-—-—

HISTORIC OBJECTS: Each passage from the narrative pairs with an outstanding example of a practical or artistic object. The selected objects span a period of time from before the 1868 Fort Laramie Treaty all the way to the early 1970s. All were created by Lakotas and were collected from within the boundaries of the 1868 Treaty lands, including what is now Pine Ridge, Rosebud, Standing Rock, and Cheyenne River Reservations, as well as the community of Rapid City.


ORIGINAL ARTWORK: In addition to the passages and objects, original artworks by distinguished and emerging contemporary Lakota artists will be featured, thereby creating what we are calling 'vignettes.' These 16 vignettes will thus recount the Lakota emergence narrative in written words, museum collections and contemporary artworks, illustrating that the emergence narrative continues to be a source of creativity, and that Wind Cave was and always will remain a landscape of special significance in Lakota cosmology.

What else is happening in conjunction with the exhibit?

-—-—-—-—-—-—-—-—-—-—-—

STUDENT ART SHOW: Just around the corner from the Lakota Emergence exhibit,  at the Performing Arts Center, there will be an exhibition of Rapid City high school students' artwork, responding to the same sixteen passages of the emergence narrative.

EXHIBIT TOURS: Every half-hour during the four days the exhibit is open, we will be running free tours through the exhibit. Everybody, from school field trips to company groups, are encouraged to take advantage of this opportunity! You can see available tour slots, and reserve one, on our website.

FRANK WALN: Thanks to the support of the Rapid City Area School District Office of Indian Education, renowned Lakota rapper Frank Waln will be performing for free on Wednesday, May 6th, at the Student Art Show at the Performing Arts Center. He'll then bring the crowd to the Dahl Arts Center, where he'll continue the show right at the Lakota Emergence exhibit itself!

LAKOTA SEWING CIRCLE: The Lakota Sewing Circle, located in in Rapid City, has graciously accepted the invitation from CAIRNS to create a quilt for the Lakota Emergence exhibit. The quilt will be on display throughout the exhibit.

THE SIOUX CHEF: This Minneapolis-based chef, Sean Sherman (Oglala Lakota), specializes in traditional and contemporary Lakota foods. On Thursday night, May 7th, we will host a traditional Lakota foods reception with The Sioux Chef, at the Lakota Emergence exhibit. It's a great opportunity to learn more about more Lakota traditions, visit the exhibit, and mingle with the exhibit organizers and artists. Ticket sales to this reception will help raise funds for the exhibit.


How can I learn more about the exhibit, and where do I get a ticket?

-—-—-—-—-—-—-—-—-—-—-—

Admission to the exhibit is free and open to everybody! Stay up to date with new developments here, on our Facebook page and at our Lakota Emergence exhibit webpage.


Other Ways To Help

We appreciate any form of support you can offer. If you'd like to pay via check or cash, you can mail your contribution (made payable to CAIRNS) to CAIRNS, PO Box 448, Martin, SD 57551. If you are unable to contribute to our project financially, please help us spread the word!

  • You can join our Facebook Event Page!
  • You can follow our CAIRNS Facebook page!
  • Tell your coworkers, friends, and family about this exciting opportunity, both for supporting a Lakota-organized initiative and for attending the exhibit itself.

story:
Ch!ps

Wha gwan internet? This is Infinite Livez hitting you up with the latest news regarding my first ever fund raiser. As you may know I am responsible for several recordings made for the likes of Ninja Tune and Big Dada and over the years have made a name for myself as an artist that likes to push the limits of Hip Hop music. Some of you may also know that I am also a visual artist and have produced work in a wide range of media including prints, comics and animations. Well after a long stint in the world of sound I am finally ready to immerse myself in a project that highlights my visual skills as much as my musical ones. And that is where Ch!ps comes in. Ch!ps will be a combined audio and visual release. Essentially it will be a 36 page artist book (limited to a run of 500 copies) that will also include a free downloadable LP of my latest recordings. The book will consist of illustrations and collages influenced by Surrealism,  Anime and Gothic Futurism. Whilst the music will follow my latest endeavours into the world of Left Field Hip Hop underpinning the trademark sound that I have become known for.

Funding me in this will not only help produce a great piece of art but will help contribute to a project aiming to put a new lease of life into the idea that the "hardcopy" still has relevance today. As many of you know it has been increasingly difficult for a musician to sell physical products based on the music alone (hence a book combined a with a recording).  So if you have been down with what I have done so far  and would like to see more by the way of cutting edge material then don't hesitate to get behind me on this.

So I need...

I estimate that I will need around 

500 euros to print the book

450 euros to master the recordings

450 euro to cover labour production cost

For perks I will offer ink drawings, prints, recorded vocals, animations and the all important pre orders on copies of Ch!ps.

But…!!

If I do not reach my target I will cover the outstanding cost myself and use what was contributed none the less to the completion of the project.

  • .

The Result

As mentioned I am mainly known for my music but for some years have been itching to find a way to open up my audience to the visual aspects of what I do  and feel this would be a fantastic project by which to do so. Anyone doubting my ability to realize this project only need look at the long collection of recordings that I have produced over my career for some of the most cutting edge labels in the world of  hip hop, jazz and electronica.  

Glitches and Obstacles 

It will be a risk trying to open up fans to seeing a different side of what I do, hence my aim is to make a combined audio/visual project, so as not to alienate  any existing fans.

Sharing is Caring

If what you see appeals to you, then please do your best to contribute by making a donation or alternatively share the link for this project in order to let folks  know the deal.

Thanks Infinite Livez
story_txt:
Ch!ps
Wha gwan internet? This is Infinite Livez hitting you up with the latest news regarding my first ever fund raiser. As you may know I am responsible for several recordings made for the likes of Ninja Tune and Big Dada and over the years have made a name for myself as an artist that likes to push the limits of Hip Hop music. Some of you may also know that I am also a visual artist and have produced work in a wide range of media including prints, comics and animations. Well after a long stint in the world of sound I am finally ready to immerse myself in a project that highlights my visual skills as much as my musical ones. And that is where Ch!ps comes in. Ch!ps will be a combined audio and visual release. Essentially it will be a 36 page artist book (limited to a run of 500 copies) that will also include a free downloadable LP of my latest recordings. The book will consist of illustrations and collages influenced by Surrealism,  Anime and Gothic Futurism. Whilst the music will follow my latest endeavours into the world of Left Field Hip Hop underpinning the trademark sound that I have become known for.
Funding me in this will not only help produce a great piece of art but will help contribute to a project aiming to put a new lease of life into the idea that the "hardcopy" still has relevance today. As many of you know it has been increasingly difficult for a musician to sell physical products based on the music alone (hence a book combined a with a recording).  So if you have been down with what I have done so far  and would like to see more by the way of cutting edge material then don't hesitate to get behind me on this.
So I need...

I estimate that I will need around 
500 euros to print the book
450 euros to master the recordings
450 euro to cover labour production cost
For perks I will offer ink drawings, prints, recorded vocals, animations and the all important pre orders on copies of Ch!ps.
But…!!
If I do not reach my target I will cover the outstanding cost myself and use what was contributed none the less to the completion of the project.

.

The Result
As mentioned I am mainly known for my music but for some years have been itching to find a way to open up my audience to the visual aspects of what I do  and feel this would be a fantastic project by which to do so. Anyone doubting my ability to realize this project only need look at the long collection of recordings that I have produced over my career for some of the most cutting edge labels in the world of  hip hop, jazz and electronica.  
Glitches and Obstacles 

It will be a risk trying to open up fans to seeing a different side of what I do, hence my aim is to make a combined audio/visual project, so as not to alienate  any existing fans.

Sharing is Caring

Thanks Infinite Livez

story:
Click Here for English Version!

Erase una vez...cuando las cosas importantes para transmitir se esculpían en las fachadas.


Con la ayuda en esta campaña, el  proyecto El murmullo de las piedras nos permitirá acercar por primera vez, desde que han sido creadas, unas obras de Arte espectacular, con un valor histórico y cultural incalculable, para poder contemplar, entender y disfrutarlas como nunca! Con su enigmática belleza van a estimular nuestra curiosidad a profundizar en el conocimiento que atesoran bajo su imagen.   Hablamos de obras escultóricas singulares que, por ser inamovible parte de edificios emblemáticos, están lejos del gran público e imposible de alojar en los museos.   

Ahora ya sabemos cómo hacerlo...


Presentarme 

Mi nombre es Daniel Yordanov, soy artista plástico y artesano muralista, afincado en Valladolid, España desde hace 24 años. 


Después de mi primera formación artística en la escuela de Bellas Artes en Sofia, Bulgaria, la inquietud me lleva a cruzar Europa para enriquecerme como persona y artista y....finalmente quedarme hechizado en España como  cuna y fuente de inspiración de muchos otros artistas. He estado aprendiendo de grandes maestros de la pintura, como mi admirado Antonio López y formándome en las autenticas técnicas antiguas en centros de oficios artesanales como CEARCAL, pero sobre todo INSPIRADO y ENTUSIASMADO por el inmenso tesoro artístico, histórico y cultural que hay en España. 

™

* muchos de mis trabajos y proyectos de Arte mural que puedes ver en Behance, están inspirados por el enorme patrimonio cultural artístico. 

Después de más de 20 años dedicando mi arte para sitios y clientes exclusivos, mi ilusión es acercar a muchas más personas a través de este  proyecto, la experiencia artística acumulada y, una necesidad de compartir un legado artístico universal de interés mundial que yace en las alturas de los edificios de algunas de las más importantes ciudades en el corazón de España desde hace siglos. 

 

¿Sobre qué va el proyecto?

DESCUBRIR LA ESCULTURA A TRAVÉS DE LA PINTURA! 

El murmullo de las piedras es, mi particular visión pictórica  de obras del arte universal en piedra, totalmente inamovibles, muy antiguas (algunas de más de 800 años) , de gran belleza e importancia histórica. De esta forma pretendo  ACERCARLAS a la gente y RE-DESCUBRIRLAS  de una manera artística original.

La particular fórmula para hacerlo, es a través de pinturas de gran formato, respetando las proporciones y detalles de los motivos originales elegidos. Voy a utilizar una técnica  pictórica muy personal para,  representar de la forma más atractiva los conjuntos escultóricos. 


 

El trabajo de la colección se complementará con los bocetos preparatorios para los lienzos. buscando a entender mejor y ENRIQUECER  la percepción de los conjuntos monumentales.


Para tener una idea algo más completa del exquisito patrimonio de piedra en Castilla y León (una de las regiones en EUROPA más rica en patrimonio cultural - 8 puntos declarados Patrimonio Mundial por la UNESCO, más de 1800 Bienes de Interés Cultural, 140 Conjuntos Históricos, 326 castillos y mucho más), - he decidido elegir 5 obras espectaculares, de cinco ciudades diferentes (Valladolid, Salamanca, León, Segovia y Zamora). Todas ellas de distinta  temática, estilos, épocas y que representan diferentes conceptos.


¿En qué consiste exactamente el proyecto?

Mi objetivo es realizar:

  • Cinco obras de gran formato.  Los tamaños están acondicionados por los motivos originales, muy cercanos a sus dimensiones originales y así, ser fiel a todos los detalles existentes.  Pintados con una técnica muy personal, y basada en técnicas tradicionales y artesanales de pintura como la grisalla y el trampantojo (Trompe l´oeil), todos ellos con materiales naturales y amables con el medio ambiente como: (pigmentos naturales, tempera, huevo, tela de lino, etc.)

  • Varios bocetos con creta, sanguina, aguadas, lápiz y tizas sobre cartulina de diferentes tamaños (técnicas de los dibujos renacentistas) 


Una de las partes más difíciles de este proyecto para mi es, la elección de los motivos. 

-¿Cómo puedo elegir las obras más representativas, interesantes y atractivas?

Por eso, después de infinitas horas de observación,  y tener en cuenta también la opinión de especialistas en la materia como restauradores, historiadores del arte etc, al final ...he decidido dejarme llevar por algo especial que me han transmitido las PROPIAS obras.



Los motivos elegidos para representar son:

1. Esculturas mitológicas del Palacio de La Granja de San Ildefonso. Segovia. Estilo barroco. Año 1722 apx (s. XVIII)

2. Capiteles Claustro Convento de las Dueñas. Salamanca. Estilo renacentista.   Año 1533 apx  (s. XVI)

3. El mítico hombre natural. Fachada Colegio de San Gregorio. Valladolid. Estilo gótico isabelino. Año 1496 apx (s. XV)

4. Figuras de los músicos de la portada norte de la Colegiata de Toro. Zamora. Estilo románico. Año 1170 apx (s. XII)

5. Detalle del infierno. Catedral de León. Estilo Gótico Año 1270 aprox (s. XIII)


¿Por que necesito tu ayuda?

Desde 2007 llevo experimentando y buscando la forma más fidedigna, pero personal de representar estos tesoros en piedra. Hasta ahora siempre he invertido mis propios recursos en tiempo y dinero, y por eso el desarrollo de esta idea se ha ralentizado mucho.  Hay que tener en cuenta que, estas obras son de una elaboración lenta y artesanal por su minuciosidad, tamaños y detalles. Para crear una obra artística de estas características, necesitas muchas más cosas, que el apreciado tiempo. Por eso es necesario el apoyo de los mecenas, igual que ha sucedido a lo largo de los siglos y a la manera que han sido creadas las obras antiguas, objeto de este proyecto.... Sin embargo, ya no es exclusividad de unos pocos. Hoy en día y a través de INDIEGOGO, el papel de mecenas está al alcance de todos. Por eso te invito a que participes en esta campaña a tu medida, para ayudarme a crear, una pequeña y exclusiva colección, de arte inmóvil, que NUNCA antes se ha  hecho. Ayudándome hacerla realidad... tú como mecenas serás el primero en recibir los resultados.   

*Momento de trabajo en el estudio.  Es como esculpir con pincel la forma desde la planitud del lienzo.


¿Qué necesito y como lo voy a utilizar para lograr este proyecto?

Recaudar con tu ayuda los 7.200 euros me permitirán continuar con este proyecto. Es la cantidad mínima para cubrir solo los gastos de los materiales necesarios y hacer llegar unas increíbles recompensas a tod@s que nos apoyan.

El dinero recaudado irá integramente para la realización del proyecto completo; comprando materiales de arte de calidad para los diferentes cuadros y bocetos como: lienzo de lino, bastidores, pigmentos, aglutinantes.  También un fotógrafo profesional, diseño, papeles e impresión certificada que responda a calidad museo de las recompensas, un embalaje adecuado y seguro, envíos,  y estar en las obligaciones tributarias exigibles aquí. 

Todos estos gastos son los mínimos necesarios para poder cumplir este proyecto con garantías, sin costes personales, ni aplicar gastos extra, como viajes a las diferentes ciudades, manutención que correrá por mi cuenta, igual que el largo tiempo que necesito "un verdadero lujo" (5-6 meses como poco) para realizarlo, o cualquier tipo de gasto que no está relacionado directamente con la creación de la colección pictórica y su reproducción en la máxima calidad que garantizará unas recompensas EXTRAORDINARIAS que recibirás en tu casa. 


El presupuesto

Los gastos necesarios para cada una de las obras será conservativamente unos 650€, que en total son 3,250€ ( con el 21 % I.V.A. incluido) para los cinco lienzos grandes, representando un 40% del presupuesto. El resto del presupuesto se reparte de la siguiente manera:


Si no consigo la cantidad completa que se solicita, se seguirá adelante con el proyecto de todas formas,  aunque por supuesto, se va a retrasar, y me va a llevar más tiempo en completar  los trabajos.

Sin embargo, si conseguimos MÁS de lo que se ha pedido, este proyecto se va a ENGRANDECER inmediatamente con nuevas y originales propuestas, que van a incluir espectaculares piezas de todos los rincones de España, que vamos a elegir con la ayuda de todos. Se va a aprovechar cada céntimo de los fondos recaudados extra para mostrar la enorme diversidad de culturas y,... las recompensas podrán llegar a más personas y organizaciones interesadas en esta propuesta.


¿Qué vas a recibir a cambio de tu generosidad?

La grandeza de una persona no se mide por lo que tienes...sino por lo que das. Por eso, es de agradecer a todos los que se han envuelto y nos ayudan de alguna manera. Incluso a aquellos que nos dedican su tiempo simplemente a valorar este proyecto y a compartirlo.

A cambio de la generosidad mostrada,voy a entregar TODAS las obras que se van a hacer pero, como los originales son tan pocos, y quiero llegar a mucha gente, vamos a reproducirles en los más altos estándares de calidad que existen, como por ejemplo, en impresión Fine Art Giclée. 

Para poder satisfacer diferentes exigencias y gustos, y para los diferentes niveles de mecenazgo, se ha elaborado amplia variedad de recompensas para elegir. Es una oportunidad SOLO para la campaña y su duración en INDIEGOGO.  

 A parte de las recompensas que elijas más abajo, veras que una de las cosas más importantes que también vas a recibir, (y que no tiene precio), es la experiencia emocional de estar envuelto en un proyecto artístico y llevarle a cabo.

Las recompensas en los diferentes niveles de mecenazgo:


Te la enviamos estés donde estés!

* esto es solo en modo de ejemplo


* Ejemplo - este es uno de los leones (símbolo de vigilancia de valores entre otras) que, delimitaban el espacio de jurisdiccional especial, un privilegio del que gozaba la Universidad de Valladolid una de las más antiguas (1346). Objeto de leyenda entre los estudiantes : aquellos que la curiosidad les lleve a contar el número de leones allí colocados nunca terminarían sus estudios universitarios


Una enooorme postal de agradecimiento, de 14,8 x 21cm (5,8" x 8,3"). En realidad es ALGO MÁS que una postal, es una mini obra imprimida Y FIRMADA en tamaño A5 lista para enmarcarla y colocarla a decorar el espacio que tú quieras. En la parte de atrás figurará información del monumento al que pertenece con una dedicatoria personal. 

* esto es solo en modo de ejemplo

¡Te la enviamos estés donde estés sin más gastos!



Los bocetos originales impresos en la única calidad apta para los museos.

* los envíos son siempre certificados y con seguimiento.




*Es la única forma de tener los originales de las obras grandes en tamaño reducido!

 DURABILIDAD + 200 AÑOS

SOLO EN INDIEGOGO Y LIMITADO A 50 EJEMPLARES POR MOTIVO!

PAPEL FINE ART LIBRE DE ÁCIDOS



Puedes elegir entre la BELLEZA, MISTERIO, PUREZA, CREATIVIDAD o los MIEDOS una de las 5 grandes obras del proyecto, impreso en Fine Art Giclée, NUMERADO y FIRMADO
* Reserva AHORA tú Murmullo, HAY SOLO 50, y si quieres, puedes CAMBIARLO POR OTRO antes de acabar la campaña! 


Puedes acceder a todas las recompensas a través de la

 barra lateral designada 



 

Tú generosidad es la generosidad de muchos otros, el conocimiento y la formación también necesita de personas e iniciativas altruistas. Los Cuidados Paliativos son necesarios en cada persona que se enfrenta al final de su vida. Voy a donar todo el dinero a un grupo de formación que está desarrollando un proyecto en la ONG paliativos sin fronteras. Para más información:         http://www.paliativossinfronteras.com/es/         

Página web del grupo formativo: http://www.cuidadospaliativos.info/

*Envío de la obra después del evento de la entrega de la donación. El nombre del generoso mecenas se hará público.



¡La obra original grande -  solo en esta campaña y directamente del artista, tienes la oportunidad de quedarte con 1 murmullo! 

+ las otras 4 OBRAS en impresión geclée (valor 200€)  
*Sí es en la península en España, lo recibes sin coste de transporte 

#Hay una RECOMPENSA ESPECIAL a todo aquel que consigue para el proyecto un mecenas al nivel "MURMULLO ORIGINAL GRANDE" 




*Observación:

Se va a estudiar, cuando se acaben de enviar todas las recompensas a los mecenas y benefactores, si hay posibilidad de "compra" posterior o no, y a qué precio y  condiciones. 


Ideas y motivos por los que estarías encantado de tener alguna de las recompensas del Murmullo


      - para sentir la diferencia de SER mecenas y no comprador de arte.

    - para tener una obra de arte en tu hogar en la que  has participado de alguna manera activa desde su creación hasta  su final, aportando un valor propio añadido a la misma, convirtiéndola en experiencia artística.

  - para poder contemplarla con amigos, hijos o familiares entorno a una conversación sobre arte, historia, valores o lugares del mundo.

    - para animarte a emprender algún viaje (que te puede cambiar la vida) o para recordarte alguno relacionado con este maravilloso país España. 

    - para comprender mejor como eran las persona y como pensaban cuando todavía creían que el mundo era plano.

    - para profundizar aprendiendo y descubriendo cosas de la historia universal (como ha sido en mi caso)

      - para acercarte y descubrir un artista (yo mismo) y ¿porque no a un amigo?!- empezando por unirte a Facebook, ¡estaría encantado!

      - para estar más atento y empezar a escuchar el murmullo de las piedras(porque donde está puesta una piedra, hay una intención humana), vayas donde vayas, descubriendo lugares y vivencias. 

    - ¿y porque qué no como un regalo original para esta persona tan especial que tenemos todos?


El Impacto

¡Con tu apoyo vas a permitir crear nuevas formas de interpretar y difundir el patrimonio artístico universal! 

Que éste es, autentico, original y exótico arte que nunca pasará de moda, lo demuestran las notas de admiración y las descripciones de los viajeros a lo largo de los tiempos. Este Patrimonio es el resultado de la convivencia de distintas culturas durante siglos, que ha dejado en España tesoros de valor incalculable. España es el tercer país del mundo en número de bienes declarados Patrimonio Mundial de la Humanidad. Pero las  obras del Murmullo están ancladas en un determinado lugar, que solo se pueden ver, si tú te acercas a ellas. Y esto no siempre es posible.. Hay que tener en cuenta que las obras originales elegidas están en lugares y sitios dispersos en la geografía, donde su contemplación es muy incómoda (por su ubicación y las alturas), y breve (si eres turista), pero sobretodo desconocidas todavía por mucha gente.

Ahora, por primera vez podemos ACERCAR estas obras a tod@s  que lo desean para DESCUBRIR algo único.  Con esta campaña de micromecenazgo, además, es posible hacerlo PARA LA GENTE de TODO EL MUNDO.

Estas esculturas representan y nos transmiten valores, y son una parte importante de la historia universal. 

 ¡Esto sin duda enriquece nuestros conocimientos! 

Es un verdadero  placer visual contemplar las obras elegidas, por ser extremadamente narrativas y de gran belleza plástica.  El auténtico faz de los motivos escultóricos se muestra con la luz adecuada, y para ello, he pasado  horas observando y esperando captar estos momentos únicos que les revelan en todo su esplendor.

Todavía se desconoce la autoría de algunas de las obras y el significado de otras son un encantador misterio sin descodificar aun. Contienen una gran dosis de hechizo, creyendo algunos que son portadores de buenos augurios.  Se crearon como enormes libros en imágenes que ilustran a la perfección el auténtico carácter de la gente de cada época. Si les observas, se comprende mejor como fueron gente tan ilustre como:

La gran reina Isabel la Católica, el imperador Carlos V (nunca se ponía el sol en sus dominios),  descubridores de nuevos mundos como Cristóbal Colón, exploradores como Hernando de Magallanes, grandes hombres de las artes: Diego Velázquez, Rubens, Goya  o Miguel de Cervantes y muchos otros personajes universales que, han contemplado cruzándose las miradas con estos testigos excepcionales de la historia. 


¿Por qué es tan importante para mí? 

En 1998 tuve la suerte de ser el primer artesano especializado en pintura ornamental sobre el muro  en la región de Castilla y León, recuperando de nuevo este arte y oficio.

Siempre intento contribuir con mi arte a difundir la belleza y el importante papel que tiene el arte clásico en nuestra vida moderna. 

REFLEJADO EN LOS MEDIOS


Este proyecto de una manera muy especial está cambiando mi vida... El trabajo de  tantos años ya está dando resultados, siendo premiado uno de los cuadros del Murmullo de las piedras en uno de los concursos más relevantes de artes plásticas en la región de Castilla y León en España. Ver video

Me hace feliz ver un "Murmullo"  en la entrada de Las Cortes de Castilla y León en una perfecta armonía, conviviendo la modernidad con la historia, la cultura y la tradición artística.

... y esto junto con las muchísimas referencias positivas de  la gente, y gracias al apoyo de un GRAN EQUIPO, me anima a seguir con ilusión, contribuyendo "a mi manera"  con este novedoso proyecto.


Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar

             #TheMurmurOfTheStones  #ElMurmulloDeLasPiedras

Sabemos que no todos pueden ayudar económicamente¡ Por eso no te preocupes! Puedes ser también EMBAJADOR del Murmullo, compartiendo este proyecto con tus amigos, contactos o familiares. Utiliza las herramientas para compartir de INDIEGOGO o los medios que tu creas oportunas. Puedes copiar y pegar este link:

http://igg.me/at/El-murmullo-The-murmur/x/12848471

Seguro que alguien puede estar interesado en algún lugar del mundo y te lo va a agradecer. 

Para cualquier duda o sugerencia, o simplemente para animarnos con el proyecto, puedes contactarme al:

elmurmullodelaspiedras@gmail.com 

danielyordanovartesanos@gmail.com

 


Riesgos y desafíos


La vida en si es un desafío, así que lo más arriesgado seria no aventurarse en explorar lo que te apasiona en la vida.

Otro peligro podría ser; quedarte enganchado y enamorado de las obras escultóricas, no solo a las propuestas en el proyecto, pero por todo lo que empieces a descubrir a raíz de esta idea. 

Por eso te invito a que nos acompañes en este proyecto, y ser testigo no solo de lo que vamos a hacer, sino de lo emocionante que va a ser, y CóMO se hace, paso a paso, compartiendo contigo esta (aventura)....así que...¿TE APUNTAS?


¡Muchísimas gracias por tu apoyo de ante mano!




English

Once upon a time the important values to be transmitted were sculptured on the façades.

The help we hope to receive for this campaign the "murmur of the stones" will for the first time allow many people to draw close to spectacular works of art, of an incalculable historical and cultural value and enable us to contemplate, understand and enjoy them in a way we have never done before. Their enigmatic beauty is going to stimulate our curiosity and desire to go deeper into the knowledge hidden in the treasure, in the image. We are speaking about singular sculptures which as they are carved on the façades of emblematic buildings are not so easily accessible to the public and impossible to display in museums.

And now that we know what this is about...


Let me present myself 

My name is Daniel. I am an artist, painter and artisan, living here in Valladolid for 24 years.


I was first introduced into the world of art in the classrooms of the School of Fine Arts in Sofia. My restlessness  - desire to learn more - soon led me to cross Europe, enabling me to develop as a person and artist until finally coming to Spain where I fell under the spell of its beauty in art, perceiving it as the cradle and source of inspiration to many other artists. I have learned from many great masters of painting, such as Antonio López, one of the most famous living Spanish painters and have learned the real techniques used over centuries in artisan centres like CEARCAL. However, in addition to these influences just contemplating the immense artistic, historical and cultural treasures in Spain has inspired and delighted me.  


* Many of my works of art and project you can see in Behance are inspired by the enormous cultural and artistic inheritance of Spain.

Now after 20 years dedicating my art uniquely to working inspired by sculptures  on sites often “off the beaten track” and to clients’ commissions, my hope is to bring many people closer to these works and through my accumulated artistic experience to share this universal artistic legacy that has been in some of the most important cities in the heart of Spain for centuries.


What is the project about?

DISCOVER SCULPTURE THROUGH PAINTINGS! 

"The murmur of the stones" is my own vision in my paintings of universal art in stone. The works are totally immovable and very ancient (some works are over 800 years old), of great beauty and historical importance. By doing these paintings I aim to BRING PEOPLE CLOSER SO THEY MAY RE-DISCOVER this art in an artistically original way.

My particular way of bringing these works to the people is through large scale format paintings, respecting the proportions and details of the originally chosen motifs, using a very personal pictorial technique to represent the sculptures in their whole in the most attractive way.

  


*Motif taken from a sculpture of the façade of the University of Valladolid, representing the Allegory of the Sciences (Geometry), interpreted on canvas

The work of the collection is complemented with the preparatory sketches for the canvases, seeking to better understand and enhance the perception of the monuments in its full grandeur.


To have a more complete idea of the exquisite heritage in Stone in Castilla and León (one of Europe’s richest regions in term of cultural heritage - 8 places have been declared World Heritage by the UNESCO, there are over 1800 sites of Cultural Interest, 140 Historical monuments and 326 castles), - I decided to choose five spectacular works in five different cities (Valladolid, Salamanca, León, Segovia and Zamora). All of them are distinct in their themes, and styles, and date from different epochs, representing different concepts. 


What exactly does the project consist of?

My objective is to realise:

  • Five large scale format works.  Their size is conditioned by the original motifs, and is very close to the original dimensions and the Works are very faithful to the existing details. They have been painted in a very personal technique, based on traditional techniques and artisanship from grisalla painting and Trompe l´oeil, all of them with natural and environmentally friendly materials, such as tempera, egg and linen canvas, etc.)
  • Various sketches with creta, pencil and inks on different sized pieces of card, made with the renaissance artistic techniques.

For me one of the most difficult parts of the project was to select the motifs. 

- How could I pick out the most representative, interesting and attractive works?

To make the best pick, after infinite hours of observation, once having taken into account the  opinion of specialists in the field, such as restorers, art historians and others, in the end I had to follow the guidance of the what was special in the works themselves and what they had transmitted to me. 



                        The motifs chosen to be represented are:

1. MythologicalSculptures at the The Royal Palace of La Granja de San Ildefonso. baroque style. 1722 cerca (s. XVIII)

2. Capiteles of  the Cloister of the Convent of the Owners. Renaissance style.   1533 (s. XVI)

3. The mythical natural man. Façade of the College of Saint Gregorio. Isabelina Gothic style. Year 1496 (s. XV)

4. Figures of the musicians, Northern portal of the Collegiate Church in Toro - Zamora. Romanic style. Year 1170 (s. XII)

5. Close up of hell. Cathedral of León. Gothic style, Year 1270 (s. XIII)


Why do I need your help?


Since 2007 I have been experimenting and seeking the most faithful but personal way to represent these treasures carved on stone. So far I have always invested my own time and money in this, although this has slowed down all the development. One must take into account that I will elaborate these works dedicating all the time necessary – I will only be satisfied with the my most care and achieving the best results, getting the size just right and taking care down to the finest details. To create an artistic work of these characteristics, I need many things other than time and commitment, so valuable. All of this means having the support of patrons, just as has been the case over the centuries, shown in the way in which the ancient treasures, the object of this project were created. However, being a patron no longer remains the possibility of only a few, but rather nowadays, and through INDIEGOGO, the role of encouraging and backing art is in the reach of all. This is why I invite you to participate in this “made to measure” campaign to help me create a small and exclusive collection of immobile art which has NEVER BEEN “moved” before from the sculpture to the canvas. Help me to make this a reality ... you as a patron will be the first to receive the results.  


*Working in the studio. I “sculpture” with my brush on the flatness of the canvas.


What do I need and how am I going to use it to make this project a success?

Finding funds of 7 200 euros will allow me to take this project to its successful end. This is the minimum quantity to cover just the expenses of the necessary materials and to send you the lovingly crafted perks of thanks and recognition for all those who supported me and made this possible.

The funds raised will go in their entirety to carry out the project in full; buying the art materials of quality for the different pictures and sketches, such as the linen canvases, embroidery frames, pigments, and binders.  Also hiring a professional photographer, design paper and certified printing which is up to the necessary museum quality of the perks, safe packaging, the dispatches and to satisfy all tax requirements generated by this.  

All these expenses are the minimum required so as to guarantee the successful accomplishment of this project, without adding in personal costs, or extra expenses such as trips to other cities, lodging and food - which I am happy to pay for out of my own pocket – and most importantly the time dedicated "a true luxury" (5 to 6 months at the least) to carrying it out, or any other type of expense that is not directly related to the creation of the picture collection and their reproduction at the maximum quality level which will guarantee the EXTRAORDINARY PERKS - TOKENS OF THANKS AND RECOGNITION - you will receive at home.  


The budget

The expenses necessary for each one the works will at a conservative estimate be about € 650, which make a total of € 3250  (with 21 % VAT included) for the five large scales canvases, representing 40% of the budgeted figure. The rest is divided in the following way: 40 % expenses of materials, 39 % prints, 4 % photography and design, 8 % packaging and post, 9 % crowd-funding and bank commissions.



If I don’t raise the complete amount needed, I shall continue with the project anyway, although, of course, it is going to be slowed down as it will require more of my time to complete all the pieces – though I am more than prepared to dedicate all that is necessary.

However, if we raise more than what is asked for, this project will move up a notch immediately to take on new and original proposals, which WILL INCLUDE SPECTACULAR PIECES FROM ALL ACROSS SPAIN, chosen with the help of everybody. We will use to the full every cent raised to show the enormous diversity of cultures in Spain, and to ensure more perks can be sent out to the people.


What are you going to receive in recognition of and exchange for your generosity?

The generosity of all people should not be judged by what she or he has, but rather what they give. This is why all artists must thank all those who surround him or her and have helped them in some way. Even those who simply dedicate their time to just value the project and to share it.

In exchange and recognition for the generosity shown I will deliver to all patrons a representations of the works of art that are made, but there are so few of the originals and I want to reach so many people. I am going to reproduce them with the highest standards of quality that currently exist, one of which is Fine Art Giclée. 

In order to satisfy diverse demands and tastes, and for different levels of patronage, I have drawn up a wide range of perks from which the patrons can choose. It is an opportunity ONLY VALID while the campaign is ongoing and it will remain so as long as it is in INDIEGOGO.  

In addition to the perks you can choose from below, you will see that one of the most important rewards you are going to receive (and this is priceless), is the emotional experience that surrounds the artistic project as it becomes a reality .


The perks for these different degrees of patronage, the reproductions we send out as a way of saying a big thank you are:


We will send it to you wherever you may be!

* Your full name and the city you are from (if you so wish) will be on the patron wall on our Facebook page.



* Example – this one is of the lions (symbol of the watching over of values, among others) which mark off the legal space in the campus, a privilege which was enjoyed by the University of Valladolid, one of the oldest universities.

The legend says: “Those who out of curiosity count the number of lions set up shall never finish their university studies.”



An enormous 21 cm postcard of gratitude from Valladolid. In reality it is MORE THAN JUST a postcard: it is one of the works printed and SIGNED, size A5, and ready to be framed and placed wherever you wish. We are going to put on the card the relevant information of the monument. 

* This is only an example

We will send it to you wherever you may be!




*always  sent out by certified post. 



*The only way to have the originals of the large scale works in the small size!

 DURABILITY + 200 YEARS

Only in INDIEGOGO and LIMITED TO 50 EXAMPLES FOR EACH MOTIF!

You can choose BEAUTY, MYSTERY, PURITY, CREATIVITY or FEARS, one of the 5 works of the project in large scale format, printed on Ceclée, SIGNED and NUMBERED. Always  sent out by certified post.

* Pre-order now your "Murmur" HERE to go on the designated sidebar. There are only 50, and YOU CAN CHANGE IT FOR ANOTHER ONE, if you so wish, before the campaign ends.


Your generosity enables the generosity of many others. Learning and training mean that people and altruistic initiatives are necessary. Palliative care is necessary for every person who is facing the end of their life. I shall give all the money raised to a training group that is developing an NGO “palliative care without frontiers”.           For more information: http://www.paliativossinfronteras.com/es/

The training group’s web page: http://www.cuidadospaliativos.info/

*The work shall be sent out once the donation has been received. The name of the generous sponsor will be made public.

The original large scale work - only in this campaign and directly from the artist you have the opportunity to be the owner of a murmur of the stones!


+ the other 4 WORKS in PRINTED CECLÉE (value € 200 )
*If you are on mainland Spain, you will receive it free of transport cost 
 There will be a SPECIAL PERK for anybody who gets a patron at the level of "ORIGINAL LARGE SCALE MURMUR" 



*Observation:

We are going to study, once all the perks of thanks and recognition have been sent out, if it will be possible to “buy” or not, and at what prices and under what conditions.


Ideas and reasons why you will be delighted to have one of the perks of thanks and recognition of the Murmur

   - to feel and to know the difference between BEING A PATRON and not just a buyer of art.

    - to have in your home a work of art in which you have participated actively from its creation through to the end, adding value to it and converting all the process into YOUR OWN artistic experience.

    - afterwards you will be able to contemplate it with friends, children, and relatives, in a quiet conversation on art, history, values or places in the world.

    - serves as an encouragement to undertake a trip (one can that mark or change your life) or to remind you of something marvellous about Spain. 

    - to understand what people are and used to be like and how hard they used to strive for truth in the epoch when they still believed the earth was flat.

    - to delve deeper into learning and discovering new ideas on the history of the university (as has been my case)

    - to come closer to and discover an artist (I, myself) and why not a friend? - start by joining to Facebook.I’d be delighted!

     - to be more aware and “awake” as one listens to the murmur of the stone (for wherever there is a stone placed there is a good human intention), wherever you go, discovering new places and experiences.

    - All of us have a person who is special to us and so why not make them an original gift?


The Impact

With your support you are going to make possible new ways of interpreting and spreading our universal artistic heritage.

The fact that this is authentic, original and exotic art that will never go out of fashion is shown by the exclamations, notes of admiration and descriptions made by travellers over time. This heritage is the result of distinct cultures living together over centuries, leaving Spain with treasures of an incalculable value. Spain is the third country in the world in terms of the number of sites of heritage declared World Heritage of Humanity. However, the works of the Murmur are anchored in their own specific places, and only can be seen if you go to that place. And this is not always possible. One must take into account that the original works chosen are on sites spread out over Spain, sometimes where contemplating them implies one making a strenuous effort (because of their placing or height), and they can only be seen briefly – one is a tourist, and so above all they remain unknown to many people.

So for the first time we are going to BRING these works of art CLOSER to everybody who wants to DISCOVER something new. With this campaign for patrons it is possible to BRING ART TO PEOPLE IN ALL THE WORLD.

These sculptures represent and transmit values that are important for the history of our universe.

Beyond doubt this deepens our understanding and wisdom! 

It is a true visual pleasure to contemplate the works chosen, even more so as they are extremely narrative and show the great beauty of plastic art. The authentic face of the sculptured motifs are when they are seen in the right light, and to get this effect in its full I have spent hours observing them, an eye on the sky to capture them in their moments of finest splendour.

We still do not know who were the authors of some of the works, and the significance of others remain giving them an  enchanting mystery, not yet de-coded. Each work casts its own spell, which leads some to believe that they all bring good portents. The works were created as books of large pictures perfectly illustrating the people’s real character in each epoch over history. By looking at them intently one can better perceive these enlightened people, such as the great queen Isabel the Catholic, the emperor Carlo the Fifth (“the sun never went down on his domains”), and discovers of the new world, such as Christopher Columbus, explorers like Hernando de Magallanes, great men of art like Diego Velázquez, Francisco de Goya, Miguel de Cervantes and many other characters who have survived over the centuries, and who have made their mark on history and been worthy witness.  


Why does this mean so much to me? 

In 1998 I had the honour and good fortune to be the first artisan specialized in ornamental mural painting in the Spanish region of Castilla and León, bring back this artisan’s craft.

Through my art I always try to contribute to beauty and build on the important role classic art has today in our modern world.

COMMENTED ON IN THE MEDIA


In a special way this project is changing my life. The work put in over so many years is now bearing fruit, as shown by the fact that one of the Murmur of the stones paintings won one of the most relevant awards in a plastic arts competition in Castilla and León. Ver video


I feel it is rewarding to see a "Murmur" in the entrance to the “Las Cortes de Castilla and León” (the law courts). It is in perfect harmony and sits well with history, culture and artistic tradition, and yet it is still modern.

All of this, together with the positive comments from across the spectrum make it worthwhile, gives me a push to keep going, plus I am fortunate to be able to count on a great and supportive team.  This keeps one feeling positive and keen to do my best for this novel project in "my way".


Other ways in which you can help

We know that not everybody can help economically, but another way to help us to push forward is to be an AMBASSADOR of The Murmur of the stones, spread the word about our project with friends and other people you meet. Use tools like INDIEGOGO or other social media to share the news, simply copy and paste this link:

http://igg.me/at/El-murmullo-The-murmur/x/12848471


There is sure to be someone somewhere who finds it interesting and they are going to be thankful to you.  

If you have any questions or suggestions, or simply to encourage us in the project, please feel free to contact me at:

elmurmullodelaspiedras@gmail.com

danielyordanovartesanos@gmail.com

 


Risks and challenges

Life itself is a challenge and so the biggest risk of missing out would be not being bold enough to explore what brings passion and fun to life. 

Another danger would be to get stuck in the past, enamoured with the works of sculpture as if they had to remain in just one form of presentation. We are not limited to the sculptures of the project. We want to go further and out of respect and admiration we want to find a new way to discover the riches of these works.  

Everything comes together in inviting you to join us on this project, and to be a witness of not simply what we are going to do but also to feel how emotive it is, watching step by step as we share this adventure with you .. So are you coming on board?  


         Many thanks in advance for your support!
story_txt:
Click Here for English Version!


Erase una vez...cuando las cosas importantes para transmitir se esculpían
en las fachadas.



Con la ayuda en esta campaña, el  proyecto El
murmullo de las piedras nos permitirá acercar por primera vez, desde
que han sido creadas, unas obras de Arte espectacular, con un valor
histórico y cultural incalculable, para poder contemplar, entender y
disfrutarlas como nunca! Con su enigmática
belleza van a estimular nuestra curiosidad a profundizar en el conocimiento que
atesoran bajo su imagen.   Hablamos de obras escultóricas singulares que, por ser inamovible parte
