de edificios emblemáticos, están lejos del gran público e imposible de
alojar en los museos.   
Ahora ya sabemos cómo hacerlo...

Presentarme  
Mi
nombre es Daniel Yordanov, soy artista plástico y artesano muralista, afincado
en Valladolid, España desde hace 24 años.   
Después de mi primera formación artística en la escuela de Bellas Artes
en Sofia, Bulgaria, la inquietud me lleva a cruzar Europa para enriquecerme como
persona y artista y....finalmente quedarme hechizado en España como  cuna
y fuente de inspiración de muchos otros artistas. He estado aprendiendo de grandes
maestros de la pintura, como mi admirado Antonio
López y formándome en las autenticas técnicas antiguas en centros de oficios
artesanales como CEARCAL,
pero sobre todo INSPIRADO y ENTUSIASMADO por el inmenso tesoro artístico, histórico y cultural que hay en España. 
™



* muchos de mis trabajos y proyectos de Arte mural que puedes ver en Behance, están inspirados por el enorme patrimonio cultural artístico. 



Después de más de 20 años dedicando mi arte para
sitios y clientes exclusivos, mi ilusión es acercar a muchas más personas a
través de este  proyecto, la experiencia artística acumulada y, una
necesidad de compartir un
legado artístico universal de interés mundial que yace en las alturas de los
edificios de algunas de las más importantes ciudades en el corazón de España
desde hace siglos.  
¿Sobre qué va el proyecto?DESCUBRIR LA
ESCULTURA A TRAVÉS DE LA PINTURA! 
El
murmullo de las piedras es, mi particular visión pictórica  de obras del arte universal en piedra,
totalmente inamovibles, muy antiguas (algunas de más de 800 años) , de gran
belleza e importancia histórica. De esta forma pretendo  ACERCARLAS a
la gente y RE-DESCUBRIRLAS  de una manera artística
original. 
La particular
fórmula para hacerlo, es a través de pinturas de gran formato, respetando las proporciones y detalles de los motivos originales elegidos. Voy a utilizar una técnica
 pictórica muy personal para,  representar de la forma más atractiva los conjuntos escultóricos. 


 

El trabajo de la colección se complementará con los bocetos
preparatorios para los lienzos. buscando a entender mejor y ENRIQUECER  la percepción de los conjuntos
monumentales.





Para tener
una idea algo más completa del
exquisito patrimonio de piedra en Castilla y León (una de las regiones en EUROPA más
rica en patrimonio cultural - 8 puntos declarados Patrimonio Mundial por la
UNESCO, más de 1800 Bienes de Interés Cultural, 140 Conjuntos
Históricos, 326 castillos y mucho más), - he decidido elegir 5
obras espectaculares, de cinco ciudades diferentes (Valladolid,
Salamanca, León, Segovia y Zamora). Todas ellas de distinta  temática,
estilos, épocas y que
representan diferentes
conceptos.
¿En qué consiste exactamente el proyecto?

 

Mi objetivo es realizar:


Cinco obras de gran formato.
 Los tamaños están acondicionados por los motivos originales, muy cercanos
a sus dimensiones originales y así, ser fiel a todos los detalles existentes.
 Pintados con una técnica muy personal, y basada en técnicas tradicionales
y artesanales de pintura como la grisalla y
el trampantojo (Trompe l´oeil), todos ellos con materiales naturales y
amables con el medio ambiente como:
(pigmentos naturales, tempera, huevo, tela de lino, etc.)



Varios bocetos con creta, sanguina, aguadas, lápiz
y tizas sobre cartulina de diferentes tamaños (técnicas de los dibujos renacentistas) 

Una de las partes más difíciles de este proyecto para mi es, la
elección de los motivos. 
-¿Cómo puedo elegir las obras más representativas,
interesantes y atractivas?
Por eso, después de infinitas horas de
observación,  y tener en cuenta también la opinión de especialistas en la
materia como restauradores, historiadores del arte etc, al final ...he
decidido dejarme llevar por algo especial que me han transmitido las
PROPIAS obras.






Los motivos elegidos
para representar son:

1. Esculturas mitológicas del Palacio de La Granja de San Ildefonso.
Segovia. Estilo barroco. Año 1722 apx (s. XVIII)
2. Capiteles Claustro Convento de las
Dueñas. Salamanca. Estilo renacentista.   Año 1533 apx  (s. XVI)
3. El mítico hombre natural. Fachada
Colegio de San Gregorio. Valladolid. Estilo gótico isabelino. Año 1496 apx (s. XV)
4. Figuras de los
músicos de la portada
norte de la Colegiata de Toro. Zamora. Estilo románico. Año 1170 apx (s. XII)
5. Detalle del
infierno. Catedral de León. Estilo Gótico Año 1270 aprox (s. XIII)



¿Por que necesito tu ayuda?




Desde 2007 llevo experimentando y buscando la forma más fidedigna, pero personal
de representar estos tesoros en piedra. Hasta ahora siempre he invertido
mis propios recursos en tiempo y dinero, y por eso el desarrollo de esta idea
se ha ralentizado mucho.  Hay que tener en cuenta que, estas obras son de
una elaboración lenta y artesanal por su minuciosidad,
tamaños y detalles. Para crear una obra artística de estas características,
necesitas muchas más cosas, que el apreciado tiempo. Por eso es
necesario el apoyo de los mecenas, igual que ha sucedido a lo largo de los
siglos y a la manera que han sido creadas las obras antiguas, objeto de este
proyecto.... Sin embargo, ya no es exclusividad de unos pocos.
Hoy en día y a través de INDIEGOGO, el papel de mecenas está al alcance de
todos. Por eso te invito a que participes en esta campaña a tu medida, para ayudarme a crear, una pequeña y exclusiva colección, de arte inmóvil, que NUNCA
antes se ha  hecho. Ayudándome hacerla realidad... tú como mecenas serás el primero en
recibir los resultados.   


*Momento de trabajo en el estudio.  Es como esculpir con pincel la forma desde la
planitud del lienzo.
¿Qué necesito y como lo voy a utilizar para lograr este proyecto?



Recaudar con tu ayuda los 7.200 euros me permitirán continuar con este proyecto. Es la
cantidad mínima para cubrir solo los gastos de los materiales necesarios y hacer
llegar unas increíbles recompensas a tod@s que nos apoyan.
El dinero recaudado irá integramente para la realización del proyecto
completo; comprando materiales de arte de calidad para los diferentes cuadros y
bocetos como: lienzo de lino, bastidores, pigmentos, aglutinantes.
 También un fotógrafo profesional, diseño, papeles e impresión certificada
que responda a calidad museo de las recompensas, un embalaje adecuado y seguro,
envíos,  y estar en las obligaciones tributarias exigibles aquí. 
Todos estos gastos son los mínimos necesarios para poder cumplir este
proyecto con garantías, sin costes personales, ni aplicar gastos extra, como
viajes a las diferentes ciudades, manutención que correrá por mi cuenta, igual
que el largo tiempo que necesito "un
verdadero lujo" (5-6
meses como poco) para realizarlo, o cualquier tipo de gasto que no está
relacionado directamente con la creación de la colección pictórica y su
reproducción en la máxima calidad que garantizará unas recompensas EXTRAORDINARIAS que
recibirás en tu casa. 


El presupuesto
Los gastos necesarios
para cada una de las obras será conservativamente unos 650€, que en total son
3,250€ ( con el 21 % I.V.A. incluido) para los cinco lienzos grandes,
representando un 40% del presupuesto. El resto del presupuesto
se reparte de la siguiente manera:




Si no consigo la cantidad completa que se solicita, se seguirá
adelante con el proyecto de todas formas,  aunque por supuesto, se va a
retrasar, y me va a llevar más tiempo en completar  los trabajos.



Sin embargo,
si conseguimos MÁS de lo que se ha pedido, este proyecto se va a ENGRANDECER inmediatamente con
nuevas y originales propuestas, que van
a incluir espectaculares piezas de todos los rincones de España, que vamos
a elegir con la ayuda de todos. Se va a aprovechar cada céntimo de los fondos
recaudados extra para mostrar la enorme diversidad de culturas y,... las
recompensas podrán llegar a más personas y organizaciones interesadas en esta
propuesta.


¿Qué vas a recibir a
cambio de tu generosidad?


La grandeza de una persona no se mide por lo que tienes...sino
por lo que das. Por eso, es de agradecer a todos los que se han envuelto
y nos ayudan de alguna manera. Incluso a aquellos que nos dedican su tiempo
simplemente a valorar este proyecto y a compartirlo.
A cambio de la generosidad mostrada,voy a entregar TODAS las obras que se
van a hacer pero, como los originales son tan pocos, y quiero llegar a mucha
gente, vamos a reproducirles en los más altos estándares de calidad que
existen, como por ejemplo, en impresión Fine Art Giclée. 
Para poder satisfacer diferentes exigencias y gustos, y para los diferentes
niveles de mecenazgo, se ha elaborado amplia variedad de recompensas para
elegir. Es una oportunidad SOLO para la campaña y su duración en INDIEGOGO.  

 A parte de las recompensas que elijas más
abajo, veras que una de las cosas más importantes que también vas a recibir, (y
que no tiene precio), es la experiencia emocional de estar envuelto en un
proyecto artístico y llevarle a cabo.

 
Las recompensas en los diferentes niveles de mecenazgo:



Te la enviamos estés donde estés!

* esto es solo en modo de ejemplo


* Ejemplo - este es uno de los leones (símbolo de vigilancia
de valores entre otras) que, delimitaban el espacio de jurisdiccional especial,
un privilegio del que gozaba la Universidad de Valladolid una de las más
antiguas (1346). Objeto de leyenda entre los estudiantes : aquellos que la
curiosidad les lleve a contar el número de leones allí colocados nunca
terminarían sus estudios universitarios


Una enooorme postal de agradecimiento, de 14,8 x 21cm (5,8" x 8,3"). En realidad es ALGO MÁS que una postal, es una mini obra imprimida Y FIRMADA en tamaño A5 lista para enmarcarla y colocarla a decorar el espacio que tú quieras. En la parte de atrás figurará información del monumento al que pertenece con una dedicatoria personal. 


* esto es solo en modo de ejemplo
¡Te la enviamos estés donde estés sin más gastos!






Los bocetos originales impresos en la única calidad apta para los museos.


* los envíos son siempre certificados y con
seguimiento.






*Es la única forma de tener los originales de las obras grandes en
tamaño reducido!
 DURABILIDAD + 200 AÑOS
SOLO EN INDIEGOGO Y LIMITADO A 50 EJEMPLARES POR MOTIVO!
PAPEL FINE ART LIBRE DE ÁCIDOS


Puedes elegir entre la BELLEZA, MISTERIO, PUREZA, CREATIVIDAD o los MIEDOS una de
las 5 grandes
obras del proyecto, impreso en Fine Art
Giclée, NUMERADO y FIRMADO

*
Reserva AHORA tú Murmullo, HAY SOLO 50, y si quieres, puedes CAMBIARLO
POR OTRO antes de acabar la campaña! 



Puedes acceder a todas las recompensas a través de la
 barra lateral designada 





 
Tú generosidad es la generosidad de muchos otros, el conocimiento y la
formación también necesita de personas e iniciativas altruistas. Los Cuidados
Paliativos son necesarios en cada persona que se enfrenta al final de su vida. Voy a donar todo el dinero a un grupo de formación que está desarrollando un proyecto en la ONG
paliativos sin fronteras. Para más información:         http://www.paliativossinfronteras.com/es/          
Página web del grupo formativo: http://www.cuidadospaliativos.info/

*Envío de la obra después del evento de la entrega de la donación. El nombre del generoso mecenas se hará público.


¡La obra original grande -  solo en esta campaña y directamente del artista, tienes la oportunidad de quedarte con 1 murmullo! 


+ las otras 4 OBRAS en impresión geclée (valor 200€)  

*Sí es en la península en España, lo recibes sin coste de transporte 

#Hay una RECOMPENSA ESPECIAL a todo aquel que consigue para el proyecto un mecenas al nivel "MURMULLO
ORIGINAL GRANDE" 







*Observación:

Se va a estudiar, cuando se acaben de enviar todas las recompensas a los mecenas y benefactores,
si hay posibilidad de "compra" posterior o no, y a qué precio y 
condiciones. 


Ideas y motivos por los que estarías
encantado de tener alguna de las recompensas del Murmullo


      - para sentir la
diferencia de SER mecenas y no comprador de arte. 
    - para tener una
obra de arte en tu hogar en la que  has
participado de alguna manera activa desde su creación hasta  su final, aportando un valor propio añadido a
la misma, convirtiéndola en experiencia artística.
  - para poder
contemplarla con amigos, hijos o familiares entorno a una conversación sobre arte,
historia, valores o lugares del mundo.
    - para animarte a
emprender algún viaje (que te puede cambiar la vida) o para recordarte alguno
relacionado con este maravilloso país España. 

    - para comprender
mejor como eran las persona y como pensaban cuando todavía creían que el mundo
era plano. 
    - para profundizar aprendiendo y descubriendo cosas de la
historia universal (como ha sido en mi caso)
      - para acercarte y descubrir un artista (yo mismo) y ¿porque
no a un amigo?!- empezando por unirte a Facebook, ¡estaría encantado!
      - para estar más atento y empezar a escuchar el murmullo de
las piedras(porque donde está puesta una piedra, hay una intención humana),
vayas donde vayas, descubriendo lugares y vivencias. 
    - ¿y porque qué no como un regalo original para esta
persona tan especial que tenemos todos?
El Impacto

¡Con tu apoyo vas a permitir crear nuevas
formas de interpretar y difundir el patrimonio artístico universal! 



Que éste es, autentico, original y exótico arte que nunca pasará de moda, lo demuestran las notas de
admiración y las descripciones de los viajeros a lo largo de los tiempos. Este
Patrimonio es el
resultado de la convivencia de
distintas culturas durante
siglos, que ha dejado en España tesoros de valor incalculable.
España es el tercer país del mundo en número de bienes declarados Patrimonio
Mundial de la Humanidad. Pero
las  obras del Murmullo están ancladas en un determinado lugar, que
solo se pueden ver, si tú te acercas a ellas. Y esto no siempre es posible..
Hay que tener en cuenta que las obras originales elegidas están en lugares y
sitios dispersos en la geografía, donde su contemplación es muy incómoda (por
su ubicación y las alturas), y breve (si eres turista), pero sobretodo
desconocidas todavía por mucha gente.


Ahora, por primera vez podemos ACERCAR estas obras a tod@s 
que lo desean para DESCUBRIR algo único.  Con esta campaña de
micromecenazgo, además, es posible hacerlo PARA LA GENTE de TODO EL MUNDO.
Estas esculturas representan y nos transmiten valores, y son una parte importante de la historia universal. 
 ¡Esto sin duda enriquece nuestros conocimientos! 


Es un verdadero  placer
visual contemplar las obras elegidas, por ser extremadamente
narrativas y de gran belleza plástica.  El auténtico
faz de los motivos escultóricos se muestra con la luz adecuada, y para ello, he
pasado  horas observando y esperando captar estos momentos únicos que
les revelan en todo su esplendor.
Todavía se desconoce la autoría de algunas de las obras y el
significado de otras son un encantador misterio sin descodificar aun. Contienen
una gran dosis de hechizo, creyendo algunos que son portadores de
buenos augurios.  Se crearon como enormes libros en imágenes que ilustran a la perfección el
auténtico carácter de la gente de cada época. Si les observas, se
comprende mejor como fueron gente tan ilustre como:
La gran reina Isabel la Católica, el
imperador Carlos V (nunca se ponía el sol en sus
dominios),  descubridores de nuevos mundos como Cristóbal Colón,
exploradores como Hernando de Magallanes, grandes hombres de
las artes: Diego Velázquez, Rubens, Goya  o Miguel
de Cervantes y muchos otros personajes universales que, han
contemplado cruzándose las miradas con estos testigos excepcionales de la
historia. 




¿Por qué es tan importante para mí? 




En 1998 tuve la suerte de ser el primer artesano especializado en pintura ornamental
sobre el muro  en la región de Castilla y León, recuperando de
nuevo este arte y oficio.

Siempre intento contribuir con mi arte a difundir la belleza y el importante
papel que tiene el arte clásico en nuestra vida moderna.  

REFLEJADO EN LOS MEDIOS



Este proyecto de una
manera muy especial está cambiando mi vida... El trabajo de  tantos años ya está dando resultados, siendo
premiado uno de los cuadros del Murmullo de las piedras en uno de los concursos más relevantes de artes plásticas en la región de Castilla y León en España. Ver video



Me hace feliz ver un "Murmullo"  en la entrada de Las Cortes de
Castilla y León en una perfecta armonía, conviviendo la
modernidad con la historia, la cultura y la tradición artística.


... y esto junto con las
muchísimas referencias positivas de  la
gente, y gracias al apoyo de un GRAN EQUIPO, me anima a seguir con ilusión, contribuyendo "a mi
manera"  con este novedoso proyecto.



Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar
             #TheMurmurOfTheStones  #ElMurmulloDeLasPiedras

Sabemos que no todos
pueden ayudar económicamente¡ Por eso no te preocupes! Puedes ser también EMBAJADOR
del Murmullo, compartiendo este proyecto con tus amigos, contactos o
familiares. Utiliza las herramientas para compartir de INDIEGOGO o los medios
que tu creas oportunas. Puedes copiar y pegar este link:


http://igg.me/at/El-murmullo-The-murmur/x/12848471

Seguro que alguien puede estar interesado en
algún lugar del mundo y te lo va a agradecer. 

Para cualquier duda o
sugerencia, o simplemente para animarnos con el
proyecto, puedes contactarme al:

elmurmullodelaspiedras@gmail.com 

danielyordanovartesanos@gmail.com  
Riesgos y desafíos



La vida en si es un desafío,
así que lo más arriesgado seria no aventurarse en explorar lo que te apasiona
en la vida.

Otro
peligro podría ser; quedarte enganchado y enamorado de las obras escultóricas,
no solo a las propuestas en el proyecto, pero por todo lo que
empieces a descubrir a raíz de esta idea. 
Por eso
te invito a que nos acompañes en este proyecto, y ser testigo no solo de lo que
vamos a hacer, sino de lo emocionante que va a ser, y CóMO se hace, paso a
paso, compartiendo contigo esta (aventura)....así que...¿TE APUNTAS?


¡Muchísimas gracias por tu apoyo de ante mano!




English
Once upon a time the important values to be transmitted
were sculptured on the façades.

The help we hope
to receive for this campaign the "murmur of the stones"
will for the first time allow many people to draw close to spectacular
works of art, of an incalculable
historical and cultural value and enable
us to contemplate, understand and enjoy them in a way we have never done before. Their
enigmatic beauty is going to stimulate our curiosity and desire to go deeper
into the knowledge hidden in the treasure, in the image. We are speaking about
singular sculptures which as they are carved on the façades of emblematic
buildings are not so easily accessible to the public and impossible to display
in museums. 
And now that we know what this
is about...

Let me present myself 

My
name is Daniel. I am an artist, painter and artisan, living here in Valladolid
for 24 years.







I was first introduced into the world of art in the classrooms of the
School of Fine Arts in Sofia. My restlessness 
- desire to learn more - soon led me to cross Europe, enabling me to
develop as a person and artist until finally coming to Spain where I fell under
the spell of its beauty in art, perceiving it as the cradle and source of inspiration
to many other artists. I have learned from many great masters of painting, such
as Antonio López, one of the most famous living Spanish painters and have
learned the real techniques used over centuries in artisan centres like CEARCAL. However, in addition to these influences just
contemplating the immense artistic, historical and cultural treasures in Spain has inspired and
delighted me.  




* Many of my works of art and project
you can see in Behance are inspired by the enormous
cultural and artistic inheritance of Spain.

Now after 20 years dedicating my art uniquely to working
inspired by sculptures  on sites often “off the beaten track”
and to clients’ commissions, my hope is to bring many people closer to these
works and through my accumulated artistic experience to share this universal artistic
legacy that has been in some
of the most important cities in the heart of Spain for centuries. 

What is
the project about?
DISCOVER SCULPTURE THROUGH PAINTINGS! 
"The murmur of the stones" is my own vision in my paintings of universal art in stone. The works are totally immovable and very ancient (some works
are over 800 years old), of great beauty and historical importance. By
doing these paintings I aim to BRING PEOPLE CLOSER SO THEY MAY RE-DISCOVER
this art in an artistically original way. 
My particular way of bringing these works to the
people is through large scale format paintings, respecting the proportions and
details of the originally chosen motifs, using a very personal pictorial technique to represent the sculptures in their whole
in the most attractive way.
  



*Motif taken from a sculpture
of the façade of the University of Valladolid, representing the Allegory of the
Sciences (Geometry), interpreted on canvas

The work of the collection is complemented with
the preparatory sketches for the canvases, seeking to better understand
and enhance the perception of the monuments
in its full grandeur. 


To have a more complete
idea of the exquisite heritage in Stone in Castilla and León (one of Europe’s richest regions in term of
cultural heritage - 8 places have been declared World Heritage by the
UNESCO, there are over 1800 sites of Cultural Interest, 140 Historical
monuments and 326 castles), - I decided to choose five spectacular works
in five different cities (Valladolid, Salamanca, León, Segovia and Zamora).
All of them are distinct in their themes,
and styles, and date from different
epochs, representing different concepts. 

What exactly does the project
consist of?
My objective is to realise:


Five large scale format works.  Their size is conditioned by the original
motifs, and is very close to the original dimensions and the Works are very
faithful to the existing details. They have been painted in a very personal
technique, based on traditional techniques and artisanship from grisalla
painting and Trompe l´oeil, all of them with natural and environmentally
friendly materials, such as tempera, egg and linen canvas, etc.)


Various sketches with creta, pencil and inks on different sized pieces
of card, made with the renaissance artistic techniques.


For me one of the most difficult parts
of the project was to select the motifs. 
- How could I pick out the most representative,
interesting and attractive works?
To make the best pick, after infinite
hours of observation, once having taken into account the  opinion of specialists in the field, such as
restorers, art historians and others, in the end I had to follow the guidance
of the what was special in the works
themselves and what they had transmitted to me. 





                        The motifs chosen
to be represented are:
1. MythologicalSculptures at the The Royal Palace of La Granja de San Ildefonso. baroque style. 1722 cerca
(s. XVIII)
2. Capiteles of  the Cloister of the Convent of the Owners. Renaissance style.  
1533 (s. XVI)
3. The mythical
natural man. Façade of the College of Saint Gregorio. Isabelina Gothic style. Year 1496
(s. XV)
4. Figures of the musicians,
Northern portal of the Collegiate Church in Toro - Zamora. Romanic style. Year 1170 (s. XII)
5. Close up of hell. Cathedral of León. Gothic
style, Year 1270 (s. XIII)

Why do I need your help?

Since 2007 I have been experimenting and seeking
the most faithful but personal way to represent these treasures carved on stone.
So far I have always invested my own time and money in this, although this has
slowed down all the development. One must take into account that I will
elaborate these works dedicating all the time necessary – I will only be satisfied with the my most care
and achieving the best results,
getting the size just right and taking care down to the finest details. To
create an artistic work of these characteristics, I need many things other than
time and commitment, so valuable. All of this means having the support of patrons,
just as has been the case over the centuries, shown in the way in which the
ancient treasures, the object of this project were created. However, being a patron no longer remains the possibility of only a few, but rather nowadays, and through INDIEGOGO,
the role of encouraging and backing art is in the reach of all. This is why I
invite you to participate in this “made to measure” campaign to help me create
a small and exclusive collection of immobile art which has NEVER BEEN “moved” before
from the sculpture to the canvas. Help me to
make this a reality ... you as a patron will be the first to
receive the results.  


*Working in the studio.
I “sculpture” with my brush on the flatness of the canvas.

What do I need and how am I going to use it to make this project a success?
Finding funds of 7 200 euros will allow me to take this project to
its successful end. This is the minimum quantity to cover just the expenses of
the necessary materials and to send you the lovingly crafted perks of thanks and recognition for all those who supported me and made this possible.

The funds raised will go in their entirety to
carry out the project in full; buying the art materials of quality for the
different pictures and sketches, such as the linen canvases, embroidery frames, pigments, and binders.  Also
hiring a professional photographer, design paper and certified printing which
is up to the necessary museum quality of the perks, safe packaging, the dispatches and to satisfy all tax
requirements generated by this.   
All these expenses are the minimum required so
as to guarantee the successful accomplishment of this project, without adding
in personal costs, or extra expenses such as trips to other cities, lodging and
food - which I am happy to pay for out of my own pocket – and most importantly
the time dedicated "a true luxury" (5 to 6 months at the least) to carrying
it out, or any other type of expense that is not directly related to the creation
of the picture collection and their reproduction at the maximum quality level which
will guarantee the EXTRAORDINARY PERKS - TOKENS OF THANKS AND RECOGNITION - you
will receive at home.  

The budget
The expenses necessary for
each one the works will at a conservative estimate be about € 650, which make a
total of € 3250  (with 21 % VAT included)
for the five large scales canvases, representing 40% of the budgeted figure. The
rest is divided in the following way: 40 % expenses of materials, 39 % prints,
4 % photography and design, 8 % packaging and post, 9 % crowd-funding and bank
commissions.





If I don’t raise the complete
amount needed, I
shall continue with the project anyway, although, of course, it is going to be slowed down as it
will require more of my time to complete all the pieces – though I am more than
prepared to dedicate all that is necessary. 

However, if we raise more than what is asked for, this project will move up a notch
immediately to take on new and original proposals, which WILL INCLUDE SPECTACULAR PIECES FROM
ALL ACROSS SPAIN, chosen with the help of everybody. We will use to the full every cent
raised to show the enormous diversity of cultures
in Spain, and
to ensure more perks can be sent out to the people.


What are you
going to receive in recognition
of and exchange for your generosity?

The generosity of all people should not be judged
by what she or he has, but rather what they give. This is why all artists must thank all those who surround
him or her and have helped them in some way. Even those who simply dedicate their time to just
value the project and to share it. 
In exchange and recognition for
the generosity shown I will deliver to all patrons a representations of the works
of art that are made, but there
are so few of the originals and I
want to reach so many people. I am going to reproduce them with the highest
standards of quality that currently exist, one of which is Fine Art Giclée. 
In order to satisfy diverse
demands and tastes, and for different levels of patronage, I have drawn up a
wide range of perks from which the patrons can choose. It is an opportunity
ONLY VALID while the campaign is ongoing and it will remain so as long as it is
in INDIEGOGO.  
In addition to the perks you
can choose from below, you will see that one of the most important rewards you
are going to receive (and this is priceless), is the emotional experience that
surrounds the artistic project as it becomes a reality .

The perks for these
different degrees of patronage, the reproductions we send out as a way of saying a big thank you are:


We will send it
to you wherever you may be!

* Your full name and
the city you are from (if you so wish) will be on the patron wall on our Facebook
page.






* Example
– this one is of the lions (symbol of the watching over of values, among others)
which mark off the legal space in the campus, a privilege which was enjoyed by
the University of Valladolid, one of the oldest universities. 
The legend
says: “Those who out of curiosity count the number of lions set up shall never
finish their university studies.”



An enormous 21 cm postcard of
gratitude from Valladolid. In reality it is MORE THAN JUST a postcard: it is one of the works printed and
SIGNED, size A5, and ready to be framed and placed wherever you wish. We are
going to put on the card the relevant information of the monument. 

* This is only
an example
We will send it
to you wherever you may be!




*always  sent out by certified post. 




*The only way to have the
originals of the large scale works in the small size!
 DURABILITY + 200 YEARS
Only in INDIEGOGO and LIMITED TO 50 EXAMPLES FOR EACH MOTIF!

You can choose BEAUTY, MYSTERY, PURITY,
CREATIVITY or FEARS, one of the 5 works of the project in large
scale format, printed on Ceclée,
SIGNED and NUMBERED. Always  sent out by certified post.

* Pre-order now your "Murmur" HERE to go on the designated sidebar. There are only 50, and YOU CAN CHANGE IT FOR ANOTHER ONE, if you so wish, before the campaign ends.





Your generosity enables the generosity of many
others. Learning and training mean that people and altruistic initiatives are
necessary. Palliative care is necessary for every person who is facing the end
of their life. I shall give all the money raised to a training group that is
developing an NGO “palliative care without frontiers”.           For more information: http://www.paliativossinfronteras.com/es/
The training
group’s web page: http://www.cuidadospaliativos.info/
*The work shall be sent out once the donation has been received. The name
of the generous sponsor will be made public.





The original
large scale work - only in this campaign and directly from the artist you have
the opportunity to be the owner of a murmur of the stones!



+ the
other 4 WORKS in PRINTED CECLÉE (value €
200 )
*If you are on mainland Spain, you will receive it
free of transport cost 
 There will be a SPECIAL
PERK for anybody who gets a patron at the level of "ORIGINAL LARGE SCALE
MURMUR" 





*Observation: 
We
are going to study, once all the perks of thanks and recognition have been sent
out, if it will be possible to “buy” or not, and at
what prices and under what conditions. 

Ideas and reasons why you will be
delighted to have one of the perks of thanks and recognition of the Murmur
   - to feel and to
know the difference between BEING A PATRON and not just a buyer of art.
    - to have in your home a work of art in which you have participated actively
from its creation through to the end, adding value to it and converting all the
process into YOUR OWN artistic experience.
    - afterwards you will be able to contemplate it with friends,
children, and relatives, in a quiet conversation on art, history, values or
places in the world.
    - serves as an
encouragement to undertake a trip (one can that mark or change your life) or to
remind you of something marvellous about Spain. 
    - to understand what
people are and used to be like and how hard they used to strive for truth in
the epoch when they still believed the earth was flat.
 
  - to delve deeper into learning and discovering new ideas on the history
of the university (as has been my case)
    - to come closer to
and discover an artist (I,
myself) and why not a friend? - start
by joining to Facebook.I’d be delighted!
     - to be more aware and
“awake” as one listens to the murmur of the stone (for wherever there is a stone
placed there is a good human intention), wherever you go, discovering new
places and experiences.
    - All of us have a person who is special to us and so
why not make them an original gift?

The Impact
With your support you are going to make
possible new ways of interpreting and spreading our universal artistic
heritage.
The fact that this is authentic, original and exotic art
that will never go out of fashion
is shown by the exclamations, notes of admiration and descriptions made
by travellers over time. This heritage
is the result of distinct cultures
living together over
centuries, leaving Spain with treasures
of an incalculable value. Spain is the third country in the world in
terms of the number of sites of heritage declared World Heritage of Humanity. However,
the works of the Murmur are anchored in their own specific places,
and only can be seen if you go to that place. And this is not always possible.
One must take into account that the original works chosen are on sites spread
out over Spain, sometimes where contemplating them implies one making a
strenuous effort (because of their placing or height), and they can only be
seen briefly – one is a tourist, and so above all they remain unknown to many people.
So for the first time we are going to
BRING these works of art CLOSER to everybody who wants to DISCOVER something
new. With this campaign for patrons it is possible to BRING ART TO PEOPLE IN
ALL THE WORLD.
These sculptures represent and transmit values
that are important for the history of our universe. 
Beyond
doubt this deepens our understanding and wisdom! 
It is a true visual pleasure to contemplate the works chosen, even
more so as they are extremely narrative and show the great beauty of plastic
art. The authentic face of the sculptured motifs are when they are seen in the
right light, and to get this effect in its full I have spent hours observing
them, an eye on the sky to capture them in their moments of finest splendour. 
We still do not know who were the authors of some of
the works, and the significance of others remain giving them an  enchanting
mystery, not yet de-coded. Each work casts its own spell, which leads some to believe that they all
bring good portents. The works were created as books of large pictures perfectly illustrating the people’s real character in each epoch over
history. By looking at them intently one can better perceive these enlightened
people, such as the great queen Isabel the Catholic, the emperor Carlo the Fifth (“the sun
never went down on his domains”), and discovers of the new world, such as Christopher Columbus, explorers like
Hernando de Magallanes,
great men of art like Diego Velázquez, Francisco de Goya, Miguel de
Cervantes and many other characters
who have survived over the centuries, and who have made their mark on history
and been worthy witness.  

Why
does this mean so much to me? 

In 1998 I had the honour and good
fortune to be the first artisan specialized in ornamental mural painting in the
Spanish region of Castilla and León, bring back this artisan’s craft.
Through my art I always try to
contribute to beauty and build on the important role classic art has today in
our modern world. 
COMMENTED ON IN
THE MEDIA


In a special way this project
is changing my life. The work put in over so many years is now bearing fruit,
as shown by the fact that one of the Murmur of the stones paintings won one of
the most relevant awards in a plastic arts competition in Castilla and León. Ver video


I feel it is rewarding to see a "Murmur" in
the entrance to the “Las Cortes de Castilla and León” (the
law courts). It is in perfect harmony and sits well with history, culture and
artistic tradition, and yet it is still modern. 
All of this, together with the
positive comments from across the spectrum make it worthwhile, gives me a push
to keep going, plus I am fortunate to be able to count on a great and supportive team.  This
keeps one feeling positive and keen to do my best
for this novel project in "my
way". 

Other ways in which you can help
We
know that not everybody can help economically, but another way to help us to
push forward is to be an AMBASSADOR of The Murmur of the stones, spread the word about our
project with friends and other people you meet. Use tools like INDIEGOGO or
other social media to share the news, simply copy and paste this link:

http://igg.me/at/El-murmullo-The-murmur/x/12848471

There is sure to be someone
somewhere who finds it interesting and they are going to be thankful to you.  
If you have any questions or suggestions,
or simply to encourage us in the project, please feel free to contact me at:
elmurmullodelaspiedras@gmail.com

danielyordanovartesanos@gmail.com  



Risks and challenges


Life itself is a challenge and
so the biggest risk of missing out would be not
being bold enough to explore what brings passion and fun to life. 
Another danger would be to get
stuck in the past, enamoured with the works of sculpture as if they had to
remain in just one form of presentation. We are not limited to the sculptures
of the project. We want to go further and out of respect and admiration we want
to find a new way to discover the riches of these works.  
Everything comes together in
inviting you to join us on this project, and to be a witness of not simply what
we are going to do but also to feel how emotive it is, watching step by step as
we share this adventure with you .. So are you coming on board?  


         Many thanks in
advance for your support!

story:
The Catalog of Paintings


My series of nearly 200 water paintings is complete and I want to share it with you!
To celebrate the completion of this body of work, I have assembled a one hundred and twelve page full color, hardcover catalog of a selection of my paintings from 2005 - 2014.

It all started in my bathtub one night as I noticed my skin was greener and the edges less clear underwater and I wondered if I could paint it. My curiosity grew as I experimented with different filters and materials. I spent ten years looking at flesh through water and translating it into paint.  I have many stories of nearly drowning setting up some compositions, covering my head in Vaseline (which didn't come out of my hair for weeks), and putting flour in bathwater and floating oil on top to see what that would look like. There was so much to see and play with in paint. A drop of water could be three marks. A cloud of steam could obliterate the whole contour of a cheek, leaving only clues of who was there and feeling what.

I was sensitive to whatever emotion showed up without forcing drama. I was more interested in the subtlety of the an expression on its way somewhere or just after something happened. And there, I could sense my own vulnerability, sincere and un-obscured. I was observing what was there and taking it in, reflecting it back.

Painting is my place to understand what's going on around me and inside me, a safe quiet world to myself where I could feel, learn, craft and grow. These paintings are personal, honest, and each one holds a specific moment of my life. 

After I put all the work together in a catalog, to read the story from a distance, I decided that I want to share it. And I know this is not just my story.

Painting is much more of a collaborative process than I anticipated. I thought all this was just about me – but it is heavily influenced by the situations, feelings, thoughts, fears, and ideas that we all experience. So I'm aware and so grateful for those in my life who've affected me, encouraged and supported me, loved me, believed in my vision, those who broke my heart, challenged me, made me see the world and myself differently and, in doing so, helped me to make these paintings. It's all there. 

I meant every stroke, every color, and every attempt to tell my truth. I'll continue on and paint my next subject now. And this book will hold the memories of these paintings.


What We Need and What You Will Receive:

  • With your help, we can do an initial print run of 1,000 books. If we do not reach our goal, we cannot print any catalogs and your contribution WILL BE REFUNDED. If we exceed our goal enough, however, we will be able to print another 1000 copies! Otherwise, any extra funding goes into painting my new series and more catalogs and exhibitions to come!
  • The Catalog is laid out, edited and ready for press.
  • We have selected our printer and have quotes according to our specs (below). Now all we need is you! 
  • We expect the OIL AND WATER Catalog to ship out to IndieGoGo backers by Spring 2016. 
  • All other perks, such as Giclee Prints and Small Paintings are available now, and will ship once the campaign is complete and funded.

Challenges and Moving Forward
  • I have put together a great team, and we've prepared as much as possible to make sure that this project runs smoothly. From this campaign, through the book design and production, to shipping out orders, we know what our next steps are and what deadlines we have to meet. We know this is a book people want, and we've done the research to make this a success.
  • We do not have an advertising budget, so we're relying on grassroots word-of-mouth. Please tell your friends to visit and share
  • My website AlyssaMonks.com
  • Campaign Link IGG.ME/at/alyssamonks

story_txt:
The Catalog of Paintings



My series of nearly 200 water paintings is complete and I want to share it with you! To celebrate the completion of this body of work, I have assembled a one hundred and twelve page full color, hardcover 
catalog of a selection of my paintings from 2005 - 2014. 
It all started in my bathtub one night as I noticed my skin was greener and the edges less clear underwater and I wondered if I could paint it. My curiosity grew as I experimented with different filters and materials. I spent ten
years looking at flesh through water and translating it into paint.  I have many stories of nearly drowning setting up some compositions, covering
my head in Vaseline (which didn't come out of my hair for weeks), and putting
flour in bathwater and floating oil on top to see what that would look like. There
was so much to see and play with in paint. A drop of water could be
three marks. A cloud of steam could obliterate the whole contour of a
cheek, leaving only clues of who was there and feeling what.
I was sensitive to whatever emotion showed up without forcing drama.
I was more interested in the subtlety of the an expression on its way
somewhere or just after something happened. And there, I could sense
my own vulnerability, sincere and un-obscured. I
was observing what was there and taking it in, reflecting it back. 
Painting is my place to understand what's going on
around me and inside me, a safe quiet world to myself
where I could feel, learn, craft and grow. These
paintings are personal, honest, and each one holds a specific moment of
my life.  
After I put all the work together in a catalog, to read
the story from a distance, I
decided that I want to share it. And I know this is not just my story.
Painting is much more of a collaborative process than I
anticipated. I thought all this was just about me – but it is
heavily influenced by the situations, feelings, thoughts, fears, and ideas
that we all experience. So I'm aware and so grateful for those in
my life who've affected me, encouraged and supported me, loved
me, believed in my vision, those who broke my heart, challenged me,
made me see the world and myself differently and, in doing so, helped me to make
these paintings. It's all there. I meant every stroke, every color, and every attempt to tell my
truth. I'll continue on and paint my next subject now. And this book will hold the memories of these paintings. 
 What We Need and What You Will Receive:

With your help, we can do an initial print run of 1,000 books. If we do not reach our 
goal, we cannot print any catalogs and your contribution WILL BE REFUNDED. If we exceed our goal enough, however, we will be able to print another 1000 copies! Otherwise, any extra funding goes into painting my new series and more catalogs and exhibitions to come!

The Catalog is laid out, edited and ready for press.

We have selected our printer and have quotes according to our specs (below). Now all we need is you! 
We expect the OIL AND WATER Catalog to ship out to IndieGoGo backers by Spring 2016. 
All
 other perks, such as Giclee Prints and Small Paintings are available now, and will ship once the campaign is complete and funded. 


Challenges and Moving Forward


I have put together a great team, and we've prepared as much as possible
 to make sure that this project runs smoothly. From this campaign, 
through the book design and production, to shipping out orders, we know 
what our next steps are and what deadlines we have to meet. We know this is a book 
people want, and we've done the research to make this a success.
We do not have an advertising budget, so we're relying on grassroots word-of-mouth. Please tell your friends to visit and share

story:
J'ai terminé en mai 2016 un DEC Techniques de métiers d'art option Céramique du Cégep Limoilou, dispensé par la Maison des métiers d'art de Québec.  Je suis aussi verrière, spécialisée dans les techniques du chalumeau et de la thermo-fusion. 

Grâce à un partenariat entre la Maison des Métiers d'Art de Québec et l'Institut Européen des Arts Céramiques (IEAC), j'ai été invitée à participer à une résidence de recherche et création à l'IEAC.  J'aurai donc le grand plaisir et l'honneur de représenter le Québec et mon village, Saint-Jean-Port-Joli, durant une résidence de deux mois en Alsace,France.  

Au cours que cette résidence, je travaillerai sur deux projets en parallèle. Je poursuivrai et approfondirai mon exploration de la pâte céramique et du processus germinatoire des semences dans celle-ci.  Ce sera pour moi l'occasion de repousser les limites de l'accidentel, un esthétisme de la fragilité qui m'émeut et me passionne. J'entamerai aussi un travail de recherche de formes miniatures et d'assemblages avec pour objectif ultime de trouver un point de rencontre entre mes deux médiums, le verre et la céramique .

Ce projet de résidence est très important pour moi et pour ma pratique artistique.  L'impact de ce temps de réflexion sera majeur sur ma démarche de création.  Ce sera pour moi l'occasion d'ancrer dans le réel un nouveau processus de création.

C'est bien beau tout ça, mais on sait tous que les artistes crèvent la dalle!  Traverser l'Atlantique ça prend quelques moyens financiers, à moins d'opter pour la natation (ce qui est absolument hors de question dans mon cas!).  Et avoir un toit sur ma tête et du pain dans mon assiette durant ces deux mois de recherches ça coûte quelques radis...  Bref, aujourd'hui je vous demande un appui financier, sachant déjà que j'ai votre appui moral (pour la plupart d'entre vous bien sûr!).

Pour réussir à attacher tous ces petits fils, je vous demande bien humblement, grâce à la force du nombre, un montant de 1500,00$ (un peu plus si vous en êtes capable).  Ce montant servira à payer mon hébergement, ma subsistance, et une partie de ma participation aux Printemps des Potiers à Bandol, France.

Bien sûr en contre partie, je vous propose quelques petits cadeaux, des surprises... selon votre engagement.  Plus vous vous impliquez, plus je m'implique!   Allez voir les options...

Votre soutien est très important pour moi et pour la société.  L'Art témoigne des traditions, de l'histoire et de l'évolution du monde.  En vous impliquant vous participez à l'avancement de votre société et de son émancipation.

Je sais que pour certains les moyens sont restreints.  Chaque sous compte et est important.  N'hésitez pas à partager et à parler de mon projet.  La force du nombre fera une grande différence.

story:
Short Summary

Whether you are a train buff, a lover of history, or Philadelphian, learning about the Main Line will fascinate you.  Since 2010 I have photographed and handcrafted PicBricks of the Main Line.  Now I want to make these works of art available to everyone.  Remember PicBrick film can be used on ANY masonry surface. Don’t let the name fool you, PicBrick film can decorate almost ANY wall! Bricks are just one popular surface.

The Historic Main Line of Philadelphia dates to the late 1820’s. Back then it was known as the Philadelphia and Columbia Railroad. Passengers took the steam train all the way to the old Pennsylvania Canal. Now this line is internationally famous. The route is so entrenched in modern culture that the Philadelphia suburbs are simply known as the Main Line. These beautiful train stations stretch from rural Thorndale, Pennsylvania, all the way to busy downtown Suburban Station. Included in the set is not only the oldest train station in Philadelphia but in all of North America! This Greek Rival station dates back to 1834.

PicBrick film is a revolutionary material that when heated melts into any masonry surface. Any image can become a work of art.  I choose to use bricks as they make great doorstops, table centerpieces, and paperweights. To apply it is an easy three step process which adheres the film to bricks, slate, basement walls, and more. Any clean masonry surface can become your canvas. Cinderblock walls look great with the larger mancave posters turning ordinary walls into murals.

I need your help to print the entire Main Line Collection. In order to print these impressions economically we must reach critical mass printing levels.  Donations start at just one dollar and go all the way up to the Full Main Line Gold Set.


 

•The bare minimum to print out the first run will be $3,650 dollars. Any money past this goal will allow me to market and educate a larger crowd.

•Funding will be used for PicBrick material, UV resistant ink, bricks, packaging, and glossy paint.

•There are a lot of great rewards to choose. Look to the right for all the options. Remember you can apply this material to more than bricks.

Each station comes with its history and milepost number on the reverse side. I want everyone to create, play, and learn about the Main Line. Making these works of art will be a great way for kids and adults to create and work together.

Preserving and sharing the history of these elegant landmarks is my ultimate goal.

             

 

  

      

 

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand everyone is not in the position to donate financially, so please send this site to 10 other train buffs, history lovers, or collectors.  I can only reach the printing goal with your support and the support of the community.  If you like this project, please show your friends.

Please spread the word. 

All Aboard!

story:
Wow! You funded this project in under 24 hours! Thanks to the generous support, this project will be realized with the best quality supplies that I can afford. It will now look that much better and last that much longer for the city of Spartanburg.

Any further donations that are not needed for this specific project will be placed in a fund to help realize future AiR projects. Some things in the works are: Summer Art Show, The Epic Spartanburg adventure project (more details coming soon!), AiR Exit Show, Rungish Towers project, and the Heroic (re)Production Workshop.

Unfortunately, now that the project is funded, Steve cannot guarantee any further perks. if you would really like a drawing, though, talk to Steve personally and maybe we can work something out. (Steve@hub-bub.com)

Our Story

Each year, HUB-BUB Artists-in-Residence leave something behind for the HUB-BUB permanent collection before they go. I'm Steve Snell, a current resident, and I want to leave behind something that can be shared beyond the walls of HUB-BUB to become a literal part of the vision of Spartanburg. The idea is to fill the old garage door on the south side of the HUB-BUB building, which once served as the showroom for the old Nash car dealership and currently sits derelict and vacant, with the image of a photographed palmetto tree. The intention is to add life to a part of the building and the surrounding Grain District, which has the potential to become a public arts centerpiece for the city. 


The mural will be completed by March 29, 2012 and will be unveiled at the Artists-in-Residence Exit Show that day. Help us to raise the money to realize this vision!

The Impact

Public art is an important element for any city. Currently, HUB-BUB boasts and hosts the enormous graffiti wall, which draws hundreds of viewers to this area of the city each year. A block away is the Hub City Art Park, which provides installation and sculpture for public enjoyment. This mural will add to the creative climate of Spartanburg, bringing even more color and vitality to this area, which has the potential to become the public art center of the city. Help HUB-BUB draw attention to an often overlooked area of the Grain District and build this public art palmetto!  

What We Need & What You Get

All donations will be used to buy paint, plywood, epoxy, brushes, tape and any other material needed to create this painting. The mural will be 11 2/3 ft. wide by 14 ft. high, containing approximately 5,796 individually painted squares of solid color. What you get is a life-size image of a palmetto tree that is formed much the way an image comes together on computer. With your help, this tree will come to life!

Other Ways You Can Help

Tell your friends why you want a palmetto mural in the Grain District and help it happen! What does public art mean to you? What does the palmetto tree mean to you? We can't make this mural happen without you. Spread the word! Share the video!

Tell your friends why you want a palmetto mural in the Grain District and help it happen! What does public art mean to you? What does the palmetto tree mean to you? We can't make this mural happen without you. Spread the word! Share the video!

story:
Our Story

Happydog Performance Company and Frei Designs, come together once again to present an evening of art, fashion, and performance at the Packer Schopf Gallery in Chicago, Illinois.  This gallery presentation, for one night only, comments on the vast array of options women have to pave the way for the next generations' would-have-been wives, life-partners, and baby-makers.  They don't want to adhere to the traditional stages of adulthood, and yet, they're caught between the old and the new.  This evening event, is a nod to the next wave of feminism where women not only want their cake, but eat it too.

The Details

This work will be presented for one night only and it's FREE!  The production costs for this work far exceed our goal of $1,000, but we would love to cover the cost for this performance first, which includes paying our performers and buying our materials, including fabric.  We are creating a 3-hour experience where the visual is married to the performance; the work exists on the performers and we could not mimic the work without them.  We have 7 performers, 1 sound designer, 1 photographer, 1 videographer, 2 choreographers, 1 designer, 3 directors, 1 stylist/designer, and about 104 yards of fabric to make this show.  And did I mention it's a free show and  open to the public?  So please help us make the work, literally, come alive.  Your support will make this a night to remember.  We are eternally grateful for your support and we hope the small tokens of our affection for this campaign represent a mere fraction of our gratitude.    

Other Ways You Can Help

This is only the beginning of a new wave of Happydog.  If you are familiar with our work, watch out, you ain't seen nothing yet.  And if you are new to Happydog, welcome!  We are planning the launch of our website soon, with more current and archival information, and ways to support us through tax-deductible donations and staying up-to-date with our current projects.  We hope to kickoff our official organization this year, so please stay in touch! 



With love,


Muffie Connelly

Leslie Cuyjet

Anne Novotny


The show is June 3rd, 2011at 6 - 9 pm

The Packer Schopf Gallery is located at 942 W Lake Street Chicago, IL


We hope to see you there!

story:
THE SUGGESTED DONATION IS $100 PER PERSON (if you can afford a bit more please help cover the costs of someone who can't)

In the spirit of â€˜the giftâ€™ we are offering this event without charge. We are not collecting fees or making money. There are some hard costs which need to be covered.

As a participant in this event you will be getting access to AMAZING speakers, WORLD CLASS performers, and more than a whole week of fabulous, life changing adventures in the jungle!! If you can afford it, please consider donating more to help cover the costs of those who cannot.

If you would like to sponsor a specific speaker or aspect of the event, please include the specifics in the â€˜commentsâ€™ section when you donate.

SPEAKER-
CHIP MORRIS

Author of â€˜The Living Mayaâ€˜ Chip is an expert in Maya Textiles and culture and speaks fluent Tzotzil. Chip has devoted his career to preserving and promoting highland Maya weaving. He is a co-founder of Sna Jolobil, an 800-member weaving cooperative based in San CristÃ³bal de Las Casas. He has organized indigenous artisan groups throughout Chiapas, Yucatan, and Guatemala, and has established community-run museums for the Lacandon Maya and the Itza of Peten. He is currently engaged in a long-term study of costume changes among the highland Maya.

 

$150

SPEAKER-
CAROL KARASIK

Carol lives in El Panchan and was the inspiration for this event. She is a writer and editor who has worked on books and films in the fields of anthropology, art, ecology, and educational philosophy. In the past fifteen years in Chiapas, she has edited two books of photography, a collection of Maya womenâ€™s poetry, as well as numerous books on Maya culture. She is the author of The Turquoise Trail, a popular book on cross-cultural communication between the Southwestern United States and Mesoamerica. She has also worked as a writer on a variety of documentaries for the Smithsonian and National Geographic.

$150

SPEAKER-
CISCO DIETZ

OrquÃ­deas Moxviquil was established in 1994 to rescue principallyorchids, secondarily other epiphytes, which were being dumped and burned as garbage in the process of burning and clearing the forests: or were being removed for illegal commercial sales, or abandoned in the process as selling these plants is a Federal offence. Craig â€œCiscoâ€ Dietz rescues, catalogs and guards the plants he finds abandoned and left to die.

$150

LOCAL GUIDE-
GABRIEL

Gabriel can take us on hikes into the jungle to explore forgotten ruins and hidden treasures. He has been a guide in Palenque since he was a small boy and is a magical character with lots to share. For $500 we could engage his services for the whole week, taking us on adventures.

$500

EVENT COORDINATOR

We need one person to be the point person to coordinate and be on site all week to answer questions and make things happen. Itâ€™s a huge job to expect a volunteer to take on, so we would like to raise the money to pay for their flights.

$600

DON MOISES
(OUR HOST)

Although Don Moises said that he didnâ€™t want any money for using the land, we would like to give him a generous donation. He is 87 years old and lives in the jungle with five stray dogs and a pig. A few hundred dollars would mean a lot.

$500

DAY TRIP TO
WATERFALLS

We could take everyone on a bus for a daytrip to two beautiful legendary local waterfalls- Misol Ha and Agua Azul.

$800

TEMAZCAL

We could book the local Temazcal (Mexican Sweat Lodge). Just a 10 minute walk down the road from El Panchan, it could be ours for the whole week

$600

PRODUCTION
COSTS

Although itâ€™s difficult to know the exact costs, we are estimating that this would cover chair rental, generator, lighting, dÃ©cor, trash removal, and shipping

$500

CLEAN UP

Before and after the event we will need some help cleaning up. We could pay people locally to help us with some of the dirty work.

$200

story:
The "Prspectv" Interactive Art Installation

Hello, my name is Aaron Mostow, a 30 year artist, musician and inventor from Los Angeles.  The inspiration for "Prspectv" came from a dream and vision I had to create a giant pair of sunglasses.  Not just any sunglasses, the iconic retro sunglasses from my childhood memories in the late 1980's.  As ideas began flowing and new innovative technologies started hitting media platforms, I began realizing, not only could this be a cool piece of art for people to look at, but also to interact with.  The sunglasses stretch over 5 feet in length and they are a sight to see in person.  With your help, my goal is to have "Prspectv" featured and on display at select music festivals, sporting events, conventions, galleries and museums all around the world, for people of all ages to enjoy.  Seeing the look of smiling faces and people interacting with "Prspectv" would be a dream come true.

The Tasks At Hand

My first prototype of "Prspectv" has been assembled and in order to provide teh best live interactive experience, I need your help to do the following:

-Purchase 2 projectors to project on the left and right arms of Prspectv, which will add demention to the structure when being projected on

-Purchase 2 projector bulbs

-Purchase an Xbox Kinect to add motion detection and tracking, making the eye's on "Prspectv" reactive to people's movement

-Purchase a laptop to travel with, which will contain the graphics and program used to project on "Prspectv"

-Purchase a generator and powerchords to power "Prspectv" in public 

-Film an official video to document the interaction between "Perspectv" and people when it is publically displayed

-Collaborate with select artists to create original and innovative graphics, which will be projected on "Prspectv"

Your Contribution

My goal is to raise $10,000.  Regardless of how much money is raised, every cent will be going into the development of making "Perspectv" the best interactive art installation it is capable of being.  

  • The packages I've created are tokens of my appreciation to you.
  • From special thank you's, to credits in the "Prspectv" video, to invites to live viewings of "Prspectv", to having your eyes being projected on "Prspectv" at festivals, are just some of the many ways to bring you into my world and let you see from my "Prspectv"
  • Together we can create a masterpiece which will be shared and enjoyed by the world.  The difference your contribution will make will be enormous and you'll give "Prspectv" the momentum it needs to be fully functional as a live interactive art installation.  I'm thankful for all of your support and I'm excited to take this project to the next level.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Please help spread the word!:) 
  • Let your friends know
  • Use social media to bring awareness
  • Use the Indie Go Go share tools

story:
About This Project:

Hi, I'm Emily Cucalon and I am a painter and printmaker in Baltimore MD. I am currently a BFA candidate at the Maryland Institute College of Art, and I am working on my thesis exhibition, getting ready for commencement in May. 

Modulation is the main component of my thesis. It is a painting composed of small movable pieces that together make up its whole. Exploring the nature of thought, Modulation questions the legitimacy and accuracy of the written word, shared through postcards. In order to finish this project at the scale I intend, I need help funding materials. 

   

Where It's Going:

I have planned for Modulation to be 12" x 8". It will be made up of over 300 pieces, which will be secured to three panels by magnets. These magnets will let me move and redistribute  each individual panel. This movement is integral. Being able to move around and redistribute my composition lets me further explore the ephemerality of the written word.

How You Can Help:

All funding will go directly to material costs for the creation of Modulation. The largest part of this is the clear polycarbonate sheets and magnet system that will hold my pieces in place. I will also need to purchase other hardware materials for the installation of the piece: anchors, screws, adhesives, etc. 

Contributing to my project means so much more than just donating. You will be kept in the loop on every stage of Modulation, and also on my future projects. With every donation, you will be sent a thank you postcard and forever receive surprise postcards in the mail. 

Perks:

In addition to my eternal gratitude expressed in a handwritten thank you postcard, as well as surprise postcards sent in the future, 

By contributing you can receive: 

  • An invitation to my exhibition in May. 
  • Sets of postcards for you to send. These postcards are limited edition prints of pieces of Modulation, ready for you to write on.

  • A shout out on my blog, www.emilycucalon.com/blog
  • Your very own 4” x 6” piece of Modulation!

Impact:

Your help will let me complete my exhibition to its fullest potential. I will be incredibly grateful for all your support and to be able to graduate MICA with a successful exhibition behind me. 

Other Ways to Help:

Even if you cannot contribute, you can still help! Share this project with social media, send it to your friends, your family, your coworkers. The more the merrier!
