story:
My story:

  I’m 22 years old a product design student in Kymenlaakson University of Applied Sciences, Finland.
  I am in a love affair with Calligraphy but the love story seems not so easy.

I was not born with a magical hand. In fact, my handwriting in primary school was unreadable. When I was 12, I received one Christmas card from my cousin. She had such amazingly beautiful handwriting. Simply, I got jealous and just started to practice right away, at first by imitating her handwriting. So my very first calligraphy practice was writing “Merry Christmas” countless times.

Since then, I began to develop my skill, and to learn more different styles through books and internet. I couldn’t help practicing it, especially when I was in class, taking note from lessons, or writing essays. Once I was caught by a teacher. I was taking note in Gothic style during her lesson . Of course, I didn’t follow the whole lesson, and the note was so empty enough for her to start telling me off in front of the class. I couldn’t recall all the bitter words, but something about “distracting and useless”. The best is yet to come, afterward she complained to my parent how distracted I was in her class, and that “the useless flowery writing habit is up to no good”. The young innocent love ended right there bitterly when I was 15.

Until last month, when I was in “Basic in graphic design” class, my amazing teacher Sarah Jane-Leavey showed us a video clip of Seb Lester – a famous calligrapher in UK. ( that’s also how the word calligraphy, and the title calligrapher was added to my vocabulary ). I was thinking to myself “oh god, this is what I had been always doing, so It is an Art and people earn a living from it???” Sure, they do and at the end of the day it was not  “useless” AT ALL. After school, I went directly to stationery store, bought a couple of calligraphy pens, and a calligraphy sketchbook, then started practicing right on that night. I was quite not so satisfied, I came back to the stationery the following day, bought a bunch of nib pens, filt-nib pens, calligraphy markers, and brushes ( try not to think about the prices). Trying all the technique I used to do, with a proper pen and paper, surprisingly, the skill came back to me so naturally. A revenge-idea crossed my mind, " I must prove the world that Calligraphy is not useless-at-all" ( in case, some of them still think so or being forced to think so). Then, I almost immediately linked it with my handmade  greeting-cards making hobby, and came up with this project. I’ve been working non-stop in less than a month creating calligraphy, filming, telling my story, and editing the video ,just to get all of this ready before November. Therefore, the Christmas cards can reach everyone before Christmas.

To conclude this, I do hope that this story means something to you, and that if you ever had a dream, a “love affair” with something/someone, keep making your dream comes true, keep fighting for love. It’s ways beyond satisfying, its fulfilling and rewarding. Cheers!


The Impact:

Thanks to your support, I can work more on my calligraphy which I couldn’t do much (because of the expensive cost of materials here). A package of 5 Sakura pens, and 10 pieces of calligraphy papers already cost over 50 euro. To have one calligraphy work done, I have to sketch a lot and usually have to use up a complete un-fillable pen with lots of paper. As practicing more, I’ll improve my skill, and hopefully no need to sketch that much anymore, hence I can save the materials.

I’m eager to have my calligraphy exhibited in Helsinki Art and Craft fair 2014. I missed this year, because the cost of exhibition stand and delivery cost was out –of-student budget. Therefore, this fund will help me afford the expense for next exhibition in 2014. 

This will be a turning point in my life. Thanks to your supports, I step one step closer to be a professional calligrapher. The greater goal is to organize regular courses for people in town who are interested in calligraphy, especially children. In this digital age, it seems like no one care about their children handwriting anymore. However, writing is not only a way to communicate, research has shown that writing practice can improve children's idea composition and expression, and may aid fine motor-skill development. In additions,  handwriting could be a good cognitive exercise for adults working to keep their minds sharp as they age.

I am counting on all of you to give me a hand ( either by supporting or spreading the word would be appreciated) and help me make this project possible.



Why are you here?

· You’re a big fan of Calligraphy? Good, Calligraphy is my passion. This project is to  bring Calligraphy to life

· You’re a big fan of handmade? Sure, I only use my hands for most of  the perks you will earn here for supporting this project

So what will you get out of here?

1. Carefully designed UNIQUE handmade Christmas cards for your beloved, or simply some inspiration.

   You may ask: “What so special about your KoivuChristmas cards?”

+ Well, firstly there will be only 50 available, as compared to 6.5 billions Christmas cards mass produced every year that you can find easily from any nearby stationery store. If you think of a special gift for someone special, you are at the right place.

  + The Koivu Christmas cards are carefully designed, inspired by nature and using high quality material. I use acid-free paper from England, gold, silver and opaque ink pens from Japan. The birch barks are meticulously peeled off the wood which takes lots of time and efforts.

 You may ask: “ How about a printed version which can be a bit more affordable ? “

  + I have thought about it, yet I believe that the very first idea about Christmas card and calligraphy is the connection between people. Reading a letter is always different from reading an email or a facebook message. Christmas is such special time of the year, let’s keep it special. If you prefer something printed, there are also my printed calligraphy work available.

 Sound good: "What about the special Koivu Christmas card version?"

  + Thank you for asking, with a special version, you  can order me what you want to write on, either “Merry Christmas” in your language, or  receiver names. On the back of the card, I can also write a nice quote about Christmas for example ‘’ As long as we know in our hearts what Christmas ought to be Christmas is ‘’. You tell me the idea, I make sure that it’ll be written in the nicest way.

“What are the special blue package?”

+ I love blue, any kind of blue. I wonder why not making a Christmas card in elegant blue which is not so mainstream as red or green, yet unique. I know there are many fans of blue as well, so I design this special version. One is the same Koivu Christmas card but made by blue textile. The other is normal paper but painted with different range of blue pastels, and the silver Pentouch® extre fine point 0.7mm marker.

“You know what?That sounds interesting, but I still prefer design my own Christmas cards. “

+ That’s great! Designing a Christmas card itself is a hobby. I’m glad that you spare sometimes reading about this project, and hope that you got some inspiration from here to design your cards even better. But hei you can always check out my calligraphy work and tutorial clips from my channel at:

http://www.youtube.com/user/iannguyen203

Hope it'll be helpful !

2.Calligraphy.

It’s needless to say much. Calligraphy itself is an Art. There will be three perks for you to choose: A printed version, a script version, and your own design version.

Here are my works ( you order it either printed or script).

 Goodnight Helsinki - 14cmx14cm ,opaque white pen-touch 0.7mm extra fine point on blue paper.


Blue bird carries the sky on its back - Henry David Thoreau - 27cmx27cm

opaque white pen-touch 0.7mm extra fine point on blue pastel.

Be strong - 60cm x 70cm Indian black ink on paper.


Design your own version:

tell a quote, a sentence, a word. Pick a style, Asian or Western, script , Roman or Gothic, or a combination. You may use it to décor your room, your work office, give it to someone, or use it as a tattoo .



3. Private tutoring.


I provide private tutoring course one-to-one. The course will be carried base on agreements between us. The duration is intensive in one month ( 5 hours every week). The content will cover basic in Asian calligraphy (using black Chinese ink, and
brush, special paper for black Chinese ink, Japanese FUDE brush), basic in
western calligraphy (using different tools, from classic tools like flex nib
pens and ink to modern tools like Pilot parallel pens, quick-dry markers,
homemade pen, felt nib pens etc). I’ll provide the learning and practice
materials. Please pay for the train ticket
if you live far from Kouvola (I got 50% discount for student)
story_txt:
My story:  I’m 22 years old a product design student in Kymenlaakson University of Applied Sciences, Finland.  I am in a love affair with Calligraphy but the love story seems not so easy.I was not born with a magical hand. In fact, my handwriting in primary school was unreadable. When I was 12, I received one Christmas card from my cousin. She had such amazingly beautiful handwriting. Simply, I got jealous and just started to practice right away, at first by imitating her handwriting. So my very first calligraphy practice was writing “Merry Christmas” countless times.Since then, I began to develop my skill, and to learn more different styles through books and internet. I couldn’t help practicing it, especially when I was in class, taking note from lessons, or writing essays. Once I was caught by a teacher. I was taking note in Gothic style during her lesson . Of course, I didn’t follow the whole lesson, and the note was so empty enough for her to start telling me off in front of the class. I couldn’t recall all the bitter words, but something about “distracting and useless”. The best is yet to come, afterward she complained to my parent how distracted I was in her class, and that “the useless flowery writing habit is up to no good”. The young innocent love ended right there bitterly when I was 15.Until last month, when I was in “Basic in graphic design” class, my amazing teacher Sarah Jane-Leavey showed us a video clip of Seb Lester – a famous calligrapher in UK. ( that’s also how the word calligraphy, and the title calligrapher was added to my vocabulary ). I was thinking to myself “oh god, this is what I had been always doing, so It is an Art and people earn a living from it???” Sure, they do and at the end of the day it was not  “useless” AT ALL. After school, I went directly to stationery store, bought a couple of calligraphy pens, and a calligraphy sketchbook, then started practicing right on that night. I was quite not so satisfied, I came back to the stationery the following day, bought a bunch of nib pens, filt-nib pens, calligraphy markers, and brushes ( try not to think about the prices). Trying all the technique I used to do, with a proper pen and paper, surprisingly, the skill came back to me so naturally. A revenge-idea crossed my mind, " I must prove the world that Calligraphy is not useless-at-all" ( in case, some of them still think so or being forced to think so). Then, I almost immediately linked it with my handmade  greeting-cards making hobby, and came up with this project. I’ve been working non-stop in less than a month creating calligraphy, filming, telling my story, and editing the video ,just to get all of this ready before November. Therefore, the Christmas cards can reach everyone before Christmas.To conclude this, I do hope that this story means something to you, and that if you ever had a dream, a “love affair” with something/someone, keep making your dream comes true, keep fighting for love. It’s ways beyond satisfying, its fulfilling and rewarding. Cheers!The Impact:Thanks to your support, I can work more on my calligraphy which I couldn’t do much (because of the expensive cost of materials here). A package of 5 Sakura pens, and 10 pieces of calligraphy papers already cost over 50 euro. To have one calligraphy work done, I have to sketch a lot and usually have to use up a complete un-fillable pen with lots of paper. As practicing more, I’ll improve my skill, and hopefully no need to sketch that much anymore, hence I can save the materials.I’m eager to have my calligraphy exhibited in Helsinki Art and Craft fair 2014. I missed this year, because the cost of exhibition stand and delivery cost was out –of-student budget. Therefore, this fund will help me afford the expense for next exhibition in 2014. This will be a turning point in my life. Thanks to your supports, I step one step closer to be a professional calligrapher. The greater goal is to organize regular courses for people in town who are interested in calligraphy, especially children. In this digital age, it seems like no one care about their children handwriting anymore. However, writing is not only a way to communicate, research has shown that writing practice can improve children's idea composition and expression, and may aid fine motor-skill development. In additions,  handwriting could be a good cognitive exercise for adults working to keep their minds sharp as they age.I am counting on all of you to give me a hand ( either by supporting or spreading the word would be appreciated) and help me make this project possible.Why are you here?· You’re a big fan of Calligraphy? Good, Calligraphy is my passion. This project is to  bring Calligraphy to life· You’re a big fan of handmade? Sure, I only use my hands for most of  the perks you will earn here for supporting this projectSo what will you get out of here?1. Carefully designed UNIQUE handmade Christmas cards for your beloved, or simply some inspiration.   You may ask: “What so special about your KoivuChristmas cards?”+ Well, firstly there will be only 50 available, as compared to 6.5 billions Christmas cards mass produced every year that you can find easily from any nearby stationery store. If you think of a special gift for someone special, you are at the right place.  + The Koivu Christmas cards are carefully designed, inspired by nature and using high quality material. I use acid-free paper from England, gold, silver and opaque ink pens from Japan. The birch barks are meticulously peeled off the wood which takes lots of time and efforts. You may ask: “ How about a printed version which can be a bit more affordable ? “  + I have thought about it, yet I believe that the very first idea about Christmas card and calligraphy is the connection between people. Reading a letter is always different from reading an email or a facebook message. Christmas is such special time of the year, let’s keep it special. If you prefer something printed, there are also my printed calligraphy work available. Sound good: "What about the special Koivu Christmas card version?"  + Thank you for asking, with a special version, you  can order me what you want to write on, either “Merry Christmas” in your language, or  receiver names. On the back of the card, I can also write a nice quote about Christmas for example ‘’ As long as we know in our hearts what Christmas ought to be Christmas is ‘’. You tell me the idea, I make sure that it’ll be written in the nicest way.“What are the special blue package?”+ I love blue, any kind of blue. I wonder why not making a Christmas card in elegant blue which is not so mainstream as red or green, yet unique. I know there are many fans of blue as well, so I design this special version. One is the same Koivu Christmas card but made by blue textile. The other is normal paper but painted with different range of blue pastels, and the silver Pentouch® extre fine point 0.7mm marker.“You know what?That sounds interesting, but I still prefer design my own Christmas cards. “+ That’s great! Designing a Christmas card itself is a hobby. I’m glad that you spare sometimes reading about this project, and hope that you got some inspiration from here to design your cards even better. But hei you can always check out my calligraphy work and tutorial clips from my channel at:http://www.youtube.com/user/iannguyen203Hope it'll be helpful !
2.Calligraphy.
It’s needless to say much. Calligraphy itself is an Art. There will be three perks for you to choose: A printed version, a script version, and your own design version.Here are my works ( you order it either printed or script). Goodnight Helsinki - 14cmx14cm ,opaque white pen-touch 0.7mm extra fine point on blue paper.Blue bird carries the sky on its back - Henry David Thoreau - 27cmx27cmopaque white pen-touch 0.7mm extra fine point on blue pastel.Be strong - 60cm x 70cm Indian black ink on paper.Design your own version:tell a quote, a sentence, a word. Pick a style, Asian or Western, script , Roman or Gothic, or a combination. You may use it to décor your room, your work office, give it to someone, or use it as a tattoo .3. Private tutoring.I provide private tutoring course one-to-one. The course will be carried base on agreements between us. The duration is intensive in one month ( 5 hours every week). The content will cover basic in Asian calligraphy (using black Chinese ink, andbrush, special paper for black Chinese ink, Japanese FUDE brush), basic inwestern calligraphy (using different tools, from classic tools like flex nibpens and ink to modern tools like Pilot parallel pens, quick-dry markers,homemade pen, felt nib pens etc). I’ll provide the learning and practicematerials. Please pay for the train ticketif you live far from Kouvola (I got 50% discount for student)

story:
Who I Am & What I’m Doing


I’m Kristel Ouwehand and I want to open a multi-cultural non-political art school in Xiahe, China. We have the building picked out and half the money raised. The building is going to cost $150,000 U.S.D. total. I am asking for your help in raising the last $79,000 + fees from Indegogo.com for a total of $83,000. We need this money by March 18th. We're not just asking for hand-outs, we are excited and pleased to accept commissions of traditional and/or unique artwork to help reach our fund raising goals. For more information on commissions please contact Yeshi Dolma, Kristel's United States liason, at kiybubumo@hotmail.com.


Why This Is Important

With this school, I will be able to create an environment for young artists that come from areas where there are no opportunities for them to study art or culture. My school is going to train and empower these students to not only live their culture proudly, but to thrive and support themselves. We are and will continue to make these opportunities free to our students.

 In addition, students' time with us will be highlighted with exposure to new ideas, different styles and mediums, and different cultures. I know artists from all over the world, including within China, and intend to invite as many as I can to come here and exchange skills and techniques. Being fluent in my students’ language, I am able to act as a translator and help students and artists to have meaningful interactions.


This is Already a Reality

I currently teach 8 Tibetan students free of charge. The students learn how to create Tibetan religious paintings and other kinds of traditional artwork. All of us make a living by selling our works.

       


Once I get this building I will be able to take on 30-40 students and train them. They are not only going to be learning a new skill and broadening their horizons, but they will be taught to be responsible artists with ethics, determination, talent and skills. Each of those students will be trained to become teachers, some staying on with us at the school while others leave and start branches in their home towns.  

Even if we don’t make the deadline for this building, we are going to buy a building and within the next few months. The money won’t be used for anything else.

What You Can Do

We can’t do this without your support. We are grateful for any amount you give us. You can purchase tankas, paintings, or other art like these on commission. Please contact Yeshi Dolma at kiybubumo@hotmail.com.

                                         

                                             

           

Regardless of what you contribute, my students and I will send you a print of our artwork on a thank you card.

If you can’t contribute money, post our fundraiser on Twitter, Facebook, Instagram, Tumblr, and any other social media site you use. Just doing that is a HUGE help!

story:
Welcome to our Project for 2014!!

From the creator Alan Endorfun--  

"Imagine a technological structure worthy of any festivals main stage being able to pull up near you, without warning, while your in the midst of a dancing crowd . This structure is in motion and you perceive it as a massive mirror ball upon it's arrival. State of the art lighting and LED's power on and start to bring the mirrored structure to life adding visual stimulation. The area surrounding the vehicle swirls with light mimicking the effects of a disco ball. The difference is... This effect is on a MUCH LARGER scale!. The effect starts to create a sense of rotating motion like your on a mild carnival ride. You will be come copacetic with the structure believing that what you see is what you get... Until.... the energy in the air and the vibe is at it's peak! Then... and ONLY then... The show will begin. 

In a sudden flash, The massive mirror ball breaks open like a lotus flower while dramatic rolling fog and light escapes through the cracks. It continues to rotate and expand pushing smoke and light through it's mass. The structure has completely "transformed" before your eyes. Out of nowhere.... The flower stamen emits 30' fireballs into the sky along with cool cryogenic blasts into the crowd and a full spasm of lighting and lasers fill the air around you. You can feel the vibe and the crowd builds out of pure curiosity, excitement and amazement.... Then, without warning, the lotus transforms back into a mirror ball and drives away as if it was only an illusion!"

Ladies and Gentleman....    

Welcome to :DISKOPELLA::


This project is designed to unite groups from all over the world and bring them together to accomplish a piece of art that will stun and amaze. Everyone from the builders and artists, to the very people we are asking to donate, will have a feeling of accomplishment by making this project a reality. The real romance around it is to create a way for people to feel proud and be apart of something larger than life. So, the designers at Algorythym came up with a plan to get everyone involved and provide a project at next years burn.  

Algorythym is an event production group based out of Denver that has one soul purpose: To enlighten and amaze through interactive and immersive art. With that said, our mission with this project is to provide a visual piece to the Playa that can create a magical experience stretched all throughout the esplanade. Through all the years visiting this one-of-a-kind festival, we came to a conclusion to create a mutant vehicle. A mutant vehicle that provides a compliment to every element brought to the playa. That leaves us with our final, comprehensive goal: Build a moving structure of epic proportions, for the people and by the people; offering visual stimulation to all the other camps and art.

We have been in the process of developing this Mutant Vehicle for over a year. Our main focus was to have the vehicle feature a 20' Diameter Disco Ball that rotates... Blossoms like a lotus... And blows fire with Cryogenics! We have been working diligently to CAD the project in detail so we can sense what effects will be most effective to provide the optimum experience. 

Design Process...

The vehicle and frame will be constructed from of a gutted 6 axle M35a2 military vehicle we still need to purchase. We have chosen these vehicle due to the 6-axle wheel base and the suspension. The M35a2 is paramount for our vehicle base on those two characteristics alone! We have one available and need your help to purchase it.

M35a2 Military Vehicle will be the backbone of this build.

The comforts of the vehicle will feature plush seating, intelligent lighting and an LED package that can pretty much be seen from space.  It will play host to 600 sq ft of dance and lounge space on the main deck. The vehicle will also host a full color laser system and 10,000 watts of JBL sound fully equipped for rotating DJ's and artists. 

VERY IMPORTANT! We want to make clear that this piece is NOT a sound car. It's primary mission is to be utilized as a visual compliment to art and gatherings all over the city. The sound is merely a luxury to keep it's passengers entertained when not engaging with other art installations and sound camps. 

The deck itself will be very inviting and comfortable. The base of the mirror ball with play host to a wrap around bar and an LED brushed aluminum plaque for our handsome donors and contributors as a backdrop. Think of this back lit backdrop as a "mantle of unity" commemorating everyone who made it's existence a reality. We feel it is important to display this front and center!

Transportation Mode

 WHERE THE MONEY GOES:

Labor: No funds needed!!This project will be built by volunteers and donated labor. We have a team of ambitious artists and welders ready to go! Let us know if you would like to help too!

Effects: No funds Needed!! Algorythym Designs owns the lighting and special effects planned to feature on ::DISKOPELLA::. We will take all of our in house resources and add them to the vehicle. We are essentially donating $75,000 of our own equipment. This will include:

  • LED Visual screens, 
  • 5k Full Color Laser
  • 1000' of RGB Epistar Pixel Tape
  • 10,000 watt JBL Sound System 
  • F-500 Fog Effects
  • (6)  -  Clay Paky Sharpe Light Fixtures
  • (6)  -  Mac250 Moving Head Light Fixtures
  • (6)  -  Souce 4 Elipsoidal Light Fixtures

In other words... We already have everything. We may only need some of the donated funds to go towards additional lines and controllers for the propane effects. 

6 Axle M35a2 Base Vehicle: This will be the backbone of the build and ultimately be the perfect fit for the base. Your donations will help provide what will be the work horse for the whole project. 

DONATION ALTERNATIVES: If you have an M53a2 and want to donate it instead? ...Even better!

Materials: We need to purchase all the steel, wood and plastics, fabrics and hardware needed to complete the build. This includes the Flight Deck that will host all the lighting effects, seating, bar and amazing people. These materials will include the blossoming disco lotus (see below) as well. In an nutshell... A good portion of the donations will go towards materials. This is ultimately where you come in! 

DONATION ALTERNATIVES: Own a business that houses these materials and want to donate these elements? EVEN BETTER!!!

Blossoming Disco Sphere: I know... Amazing, right!? This is the biggest chunk of the pledged number. There are a lot of moving parts to this design and the mechanics needed to rotate and animate the piece are not cheap. The funds will go towards the aluminium needed to sheer weight and cut the fat. The base needs steel, actuators, custom bearings and a high power motor. The most expensive thing on the mirror ball is the mirror itself. We need to use a lexan mirror to lower the weight. We really need to "over-achieve" our goal to get the mirror we ultimately need. This will be the most stunning element to the vehicle and we appreciate your help making this thing a reality!

DONATION ALTERNATIVES: In a position to help or donate these elements? EVEN BETTER!!!

Power: It kind of goes without saying, but this puppy will draw a ton of power. Therefore a fairly large tow generator will be acquired with donated funds. This will most likely be a lengthy expensive rental item. 

DONATION ALTERNATIVES: Do you have a generator and want donate it? EVEN BETTER!!!

Storage/Warehouse Fees: Being that we will build this in Colorado, it's going to be cold! We need funds to house the build and keep the equipment out of the elements. We will eventually store ::DISKOPELLA:: in Reno for next years burn and chances are, we will need to Kickstart another campaign towards the end of the build to help with these post fees. That is unless we "over-achieve" our goal! 

DONATION ALTERNATIVES: In a position to help or donate these elements? EVEN BETTER!!!

Propane/gases: This vehicle will be equipped with (2) - 30' flame projectors and Liquid Nitrogen cannons. Your donations will help with the purchase of these effects and liquids to bring the effects to life! The more donations... The more FIRE and ICE!!!  

DONATION ALTERNATIVES: Do you have experience and a "puffer" laying around to donate? EVEN BETTER!!!

Transportation Costs: We will need to charter two flatbed trailers to get the vehicle to the playa and to the storage facility in Reno. Your donations will support these costs. 

DONATION ALTERNATIVES: Own a couple semi's and nothing to do labor day weekend? Feel like taking a drive and donating transportation? EVEN BETTER!!

Entry and Placement: NO DONATIONS NEEDED! Burning Man is an event that represents radical self reliance. Therefore... "What Guest List?". With that said we will secure our own entry individually. We do not need donations for this. However, ticket scenarios with this event get a bit fickle. We would need to secure our teams early entry passes and placement in the event. We would need to arrive to the Playa a week early to assemble the vehicle timely. Your donation will help cushion some of these costs in case of an emergency with the crew. 


WHAT ARE THE FINANCIAL GOALS?

The current goal of $35,000 is our bare bones budget and only covers the basic materials, transportation and build plan. We hope that we can "over-achieve" (a.k.a Double!) the goal to add more effects and propane and fire effects to the project to allow for a more surreal experience. Below is a rough financial breakdown of what our current costs will amount to:

  • $8,000  -  M35a2 Base Vehicle: 
  • $3,500  -  Main Deck and Outer Facade
  • $5,000  -  Steel and Lexan for the Flowered Mirror Ball
  • $2,500  -  Actuators, Control and Hardware
  • $4,000  -  Propane/Cryo Effects including Propane
  • $3,000  -  Storage/Warehouse facility
  • $5,500  -  Transportation/Freight
  • $1,500  -  Material Shipping and Material Pricing Cushion 
  • $2,000  -  55k Generator rental

Again, this is the initial basic projected numbers. We would love to campaign for more but feel very confident that the art and burner community will come together to make this happen in Spades!! This is a dream for many of us and we cannot do it without you. We really wish we can offer more on the rewards side of things and hope that what we are offering will be enough. Please let us know if there is more we can do!

Thank you in advance for your time and interest in this dream. We looking forward to meeting every donor in person in the very near future! Please feel free to leave any comments or concerns and we look forward to beating the dust with each and every one of you!!

In case you missed it... :)

From the creator Alan Endorfun-- 

"Imagine a technological structure worthy of any festivals main stage being able to pull up near without notice. This structure is in motion only to be recognized as a mirror ball upon it's arrival. State of the art lighting and LED's start to bring the mirrored structure to life adding visual stimulation. The area surrounding the vehicle swirls with light mimicking the effects of a disco ball. The difference is... This effect is on a MUCH LARGER scale!. The effect will create a sense of rotating motion like your on a mild carnival ride. You will be come copacetic with the structure believing that what you see is what you get... Until.... the energy in the air and the vibe is at it's peak! Then... and ONLY then... The show will begin.

In a sudden flash, The massive mirror ball breaks open like a lotus flower while dramatic rolling fog and light escapes through the cracks. It continues to rotate and expand pushing smoke and light through it's mass. The structure has completely "transformed" before your eyes. Out of nowhere.... The flower stamen emits 30' fireballs into the sky along with cool cryogenic blasts into the crowd and a full spasm of lighting and lasers fill the air around you. You can feel the vibe and the crowd builds out of pure curiosity, excitement and amazement.... Then, without warning, the lotus transforms back into a mirror ball and drives away as if it was only an illusion!"

 ... Welcome to ::DISKOPELLA!" Stay Tuned to this campaign for more updates and details. Most of all, THANK YOU for helping and becoming a part of this amazing project!!

These will be the stickers and Logos on the T-shirts and Hoodies!! ^^^

LED Visual screens, 
5k Full Color Laser
1000' of RGB Epistar Pixel Tape
10,000 watt JBL Sound System 
F-500 Fog Effects
(6)  -  Clay Paky Sharpe Light Fixtures
(6)  -  Mac250 Moving Head Light Fixtures
(6)  -  Souce 4 Elipsoidal Light Fixtures
In other words... We already have everything. We may only need some of the donated funds to go towards additional lines and controllers for the propane effects. 6 Axle M35a2 Base Vehicle: This will be the backbone of the build and ultimately be the perfect fit for the base. Your donations will help provide what will be the work horse for the whole project. DONATION ALTERNATIVES: If you have an M53a2 and want to donate it instead? ...Even better!Materials: We need to purchase all the steel, wood and plastics, fabrics and hardware needed to complete the build. This includes the Flight Deck that will host all the lighting effects, seating, bar and amazing people. These materials will include the blossoming disco lotus (see below) as well. In an nutshell... A good portion of the donations will go towards materials. This is ultimately where you come in! DONATION ALTERNATIVES: Own a business that houses these materials and want to donate these elements? EVEN BETTER!!!Blossoming Disco Sphere: I know... Amazing, right!? This is the biggest chunk of the pledged number. There are a lot of moving parts to this design and the mechanics needed to rotate and animate the piece are not cheap. The funds will go towards the aluminium needed to sheer weight and cut the fat. The base needs steel, actuators, custom bearings and a high power motor. The most expensive thing on the mirror ball is the mirror itself. We need to use a lexan mirror to lower the weight. We really need to "over-achieve" our goal to get the mirror we ultimately need. This will be the most stunning element to the vehicle and we appreciate your help making this thing a reality!DONATION ALTERNATIVES: In a position to help or donate these elements? EVEN BETTER!!!Power: It kind of goes without saying, but this puppy will draw a ton of power. Therefore a fairly large tow generator will be acquired with donated funds. This will most likely be a lengthy expensive rental item. DONATION ALTERNATIVES: Do you have a generator and want donate it? EVEN BETTER!!!Storage/Warehouse Fees: Being that we will build this in Colorado, it's going to be cold! We need funds to house the build and keep the equipment out of the elements. We will eventually store ::DISKOPELLA:: in Reno for next years burn and chances are, we will need to Kickstart another campaign towards the end of the build to help with these post fees. That is unless we "over-achieve" our goal! DONATION ALTERNATIVES: In a position to help or donate these elements? EVEN BETTER!!!Propane/gases: This vehicle will be equipped with (2) - 30' flame projectors and Liquid Nitrogen cannons. Your donations will help with the purchase of these effects and liquids to bring the effects to life! The more donations... The more FIRE and ICE!!!  DONATION ALTERNATIVES: Do you have experience and a "puffer" laying around to donate? EVEN BETTER!!!Transportation Costs: We will need to charter two flatbed trailers to get the vehicle to the playa and to the storage facility in Reno. Your donations will support these costs. DONATION ALTERNATIVES: Own a couple semi's and nothing to do labor day weekend? Feel like taking a drive and donating transportation? EVEN BETTER!!Entry and Placement: NO DONATIONS NEEDED! Burning Man is an event that represents radical self reliance. Therefore... "What Guest List?". With that said we will secure our own entry individually. We do not need donations for this. However, ticket scenarios with this event get a bit fickle. We would need to secure our teams early entry passes and placement in the event. We would need to arrive to the Playa a week early to assemble the vehicle timely. Your donation will help cushion some of these costs in case of an emergency with the crew. WHAT ARE THE FINANCIAL GOALS?The current goal of $35,000 is our bare bones budget and only covers the basic materials, transportation and build plan. We hope that we can "over-achieve" (a.k.a Double!) the goal to add more effects and propane and fire effects to the project to allow for a more surreal experience. Below is a rough financial breakdown of what our current costs will amount to:
$8,000  -  M35a2 Base Vehicle: 
$3,500  -  Main Deck and Outer Facade
$5,000  -  Steel and Lexan for the Flowered Mirror Ball
$2,500  -  Actuators, Control and Hardware
$4,000  -  Propane/Cryo Effects including Propane
$3,000  -  Storage/Warehouse facility
$5,500  -  Transportation/Freight
$1,500  -  Material Shipping and Material Pricing Cushion 
$2,000  -  55k Generator rental
Again, this is the initial basic projected numbers. We would love to campaign for more but feel very confident that the art and burner community will come together to make this happen in Spades!! This is a dream for many of us and we cannot do it without you. We really wish we can offer more on the rewards side of things and hope that what we are offering will be enough. Please let us know if there is more we can do!Thank you in advance for your time and interest in this dream. We looking forward to meeting every donor in person in the very near future! Please feel free to leave any comments or concerns and we look forward to beating the dust with each and every one of you!!In case you missed it... :)From the creator Alan Endorfun-- "Imagine a technological structure worthy of any festivals main stage being able to pull up near without notice. This structure is in motion only to be recognized as a mirror ball upon it's arrival. State of the art lighting and LED's start to bring the mirrored structure to life adding visual stimulation. The area surrounding the vehicle swirls with light mimicking the effects of a disco ball. The difference is... This effect is on a MUCH LARGER scale!. The effect will create a sense of rotating motion like your on a mild carnival ride. You will be come copacetic with the structure believing that what you see is what you get... Until.... the energy in the air and the vibe is at it's peak! Then... and ONLY then... The show will begin.In a sudden flash, The massive mirror ball breaks open like a lotus flower while dramatic rolling fog and light escapes through the cracks. It continues to rotate and expand pushing smoke and light through it's mass. The structure has completely "transformed" before your eyes. Out of nowhere.... The flower stamen emits 30' fireballs into the sky along with cool cryogenic blasts into the crowd and a full spasm of lighting and lasers fill the air around you. You can feel the vibe and the crowd builds out of pure curiosity, excitement and amazement.... Then, without warning, the lotus transforms back into a mirror ball and drives away as if it was only an illusion!" ... Welcome to ::DISKOPELLA!" Stay Tuned to this campaign for more updates and details. Most of all, THANK YOU for helping and becoming a part of this amazing project!!These will be the stickers and Logos on the T-shirts and Hoodies!! ^^^

story:
HELP BRING "SONIC RINGS" TO THE UK OLYMPICS

The Institute for Performance Sculpture, Inc. is a tax-exempt non-profit corporation devoted to exploring the boundaries between art and technology within public space. To that end, "Sonic Rings" is an excellent example of just such goals.

The project has received an invitation to participate in the 2012 UK Olympics Festivities, being a part of the 2012 Maritime Olympic environment in the southern coast of England in Weymouth. As with many cultural events associated with the Olympics, organizations are required to be sponsored by interested funders and/or raise funds privately. To that end, the Institute is interested make a proposal to the US public through Indigogo to raise $15,000 to help offset the expenses of shipping the equipment and crew from the US to the UK and back during the summer of 2012.

We need $10,000 to make this project a reality. These funds will go towards covering the shipping costs of the equipment, as well as the transportation expenses for the crew to travel to the UK.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to support us financially - consider using the share tools here on indiegogo to spread the word about this project. the URL for this indiegogo campaign is indiegogo.com/sonicrings

You can contact the Institute for Performance Sculpture at info@performancesculpture.com

story:
Who we are and what we are up to...

A little bit about me… I am Katie Chalcraft. I work within the human development space where international development, human rights and the role of the individual in bringing about social change are pivotal to my work. With a background in Social Anthropology, Human Rights, HIV work and a Winston Churchill Fellowship (2011) in Tackling HIV-related stigma through visual and performing arts I am passionate about addressing inequality. Together with a group of thoroughly inspiring change makers we are putting together an exhibition entitled ‘the art of discrimination: personal stories of triumph over stigma’. The exhibition will be held at the Brighton Unitarian Church, New Road, Brighton on Saturday September 29th 2012.

To find out more about me please see my online profile

the art of discrimination shares the narratives of people who have experienced and overcome stigma and discrimination in their lives. The exhibition will include photographic, oral, performance and film documentation to communicate personal stories of triumph over stigmatisation.

The series of photos, live speakers, performances and short films that form the art of discrimination aim to:

  • Deepen the understanding of the impact discrimination has on others.
  • Inspire people to find the courage they need to challenge discrimination and empower them with the tools to overcome it.
  • Challenge people's perceptions about difference - highlighting the more subtle ways we may discriminate against each other

Currently we have live stories from:

  • Winnie Sseruma – HIV activist and Advocacy and Networks Officer for the Community Health and HIV team at Christian Aid
  • Emma Hurst  – a woman with cerebral palsy working to support inclusion of disabled children within mainstream activities
  • Sam Thomas - Founder and Director of Men Get Eating Disorders Too

Video and still narratives from:

  • Dr Alice Welbourn – HIV activist (Founding Director of the Salamander Trust)
  • Canon Gideon Byamugisha – first religious leader to be publicly open about his HIV status (International Network of Religious Leaders living with, or personally affected by, HIV (INERELA+) and Friends of Canon Gideon Foundation (FOCAGIFO))

Full biographies of each of the people sharing their stories are available on our blog (the art of discrimination).

Images from:

  • Through Positive Eyes: A global photographic collaboration with Gideon Mendel and the UCLA Art & Global Health Center http://throughpositiveeyes.org/
  • Through Positive Eyes is an attempt to address key themes of the AIDS epidemic: widespread stigma, extreme social inequality, and limited access to lifesaving medication. The project is based on the belief that challenging stigma against people living with HIV is the most effective method for combating the epidemic—and that art is a powerful way to do this. Through Positive Eyes will be coming to the UK next year so please get involved.
  • Changing the Face of Human Rights: A collection from Nadia Bettega

Performances from:

  • Signdance Collective perform live with Alex Ward from Dead Days Beyond Help: a performance of ‘Half a Penny’ a 35 minute play on discrimination: Signdance Collective
  • Unified Rhythm: a mixed ability carnival percussion band

We hope to have some additional stories of how other people have overcome stigma and discrimination in their lives. Other examples of the ways in which people have been discriminated may also include sexuality, mental health, ethnicity, religious or political opinion. We aim to have a variety of stories from a wide cross-section of society to challenge public perceptions of identity and the grounds upon which people are so often stigmatised.

With your support we will be able to coordinate the exhibition to ensure it touches and inspires as many people as possible. We have some incredibly powerful stories from individuals around the world who have experienced and overcome discrimination. This exhibition is the opportunity for those stories to be heard to inspire hope to others who may be facing discrimination and other difficulties in their lives.

What We Need

Most of the costs are to coordinate the exhibition, below is an accurate breakdown of the costs involved in putting it together:

Printing costs (flyers, posters, photos and text stories)

£700
   

Performers (Signdance Collective and another group TBC)

£400

Travel expenses

£250

Equipment hire for performances

£200

Food for participants

£100

Contingencies

£200
 

£1,850

There will be an auction of the photographs from Through Positive Eyes. The proceeds of this will go towards bringing the project Through Positive Eyes to the UK next year.  In the UK Through Positive Eyes will work closely with of a group people living with HIV committed to sharing their status publicly to fight stigma. The group will participate in an intensive photographic workshop. The result of the project will be a set of sensitive, dynamic, colourful images and video clips that reveal a great deal about each person’s life.

The Impact

Discrimination is a global concern and is a catalyst to many of the societal indecencies that plague the world. Most of the wars and civil outcries are on the basis of a fundamental discrimination, from the Holocaust to the Rwandan genocide. Think of the last time that you were treated differently because of your gender, religion, race or ability. Through the art of discrimination project we hope to showcase the triumphs of the people who have overcome their situation, to inspire others to have the courage and the tools to challenge discrimination and as a voice for each of us to be aware of our behaviour and the way we treat others and to create the space for others to do the same.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

If you know of anyone who is willing to share their story, please email me: katiechalcraft@yahoo.co.uk.

All the costs of the project are for the on-the-day expense of the exhibition. To keep our costs as low as possible:

  • If you are part of an organisation that is willing to assist us with the printing flyers, posters, photos and text stories
  • If you know of anything who can assist us with the catering on the day
  • If there is anyone who is willing to cover the traveling expenses to get the speakers to the event
  • If you know of anyone who would be interested in attending, please invite them
  • If you have anyone in your circle who could contribute to our cause, please can you spread the art of discrimination via the Indiegogo share tool

NB - This website is in US dollars - the equivalent to £1,850 is $2,950

To figure out what the equivalent of your donation from GBP (£) to USD ($) when donating please click here for the latest converstion calculator: http://www.xe.com/

THANK YOU SO MUCH FOR YOUR SUPPORT!

story:
The Class Diamond

Any time Stanford students or alumni meet for the first time the first question they ask is ‘what year are you?’  Stanford students in the same class year share a special bond, more so than at most schools, and that class year pride lasts a lifetime.

The Class Diamond is one of the most cherished images of the Stanford experience because it is your identity at Stanford social events, reunions and tailgates, and it indicates the best part of the Stanford Magazine: the Class Notes. Now, for the first time ever, you can represent your class with your very own hand made sterling silver Class Diamond collectible from Collegiate Silver.

All Class Diamond products are designed and hand made by Waddie CrazyHorse, Stanford '10.  Waddie uses a blend of modern technological and “old school” hand-wrought techniques. Being a 3rd-generation Native American silversmith, jewelry design runs in Waddie’s family history, and he enjoys honoring the heritage he has been blessed with. The quality of hand made jewelry and the attention to detail distinguishes Collegiate Silver’s jewelry line as not just another logo product, but one that is appropriate for the Stanford University community. Collegiate Silver’s class diamond products look just like the class diamonds lining the walkway of the Quad at Stanford University. The Class Diamond will be instantly recognizable by any student or alumnus.

When you pre-order your Class Diamond, your money goes directly to the production costs that will make this project happen: purchasing special tooling to make the class diamonds and materials like injectable wax, high-quality plaster, oxy-acetylene and of course, sterling silver casting grain. A successful fundraising campaign will help Collegiate Silver achieve so much in 2013, including the debut of Stanford graduation rings and a successful expansion to similar products for Cal, USC, and UCLA. Please remember that every dollar helps, and that even if you cannot pledge, please share this page with friends, family and any Stanford supporters you may know.

Learn more about the Collegiate Silver journey here: Peninsula Press Article

Thank you for your support!

 

Personalization | Final Details

After the end of the campaign, Waddie will send you a follow-up email confirming your:

  • Style (Pin/ Pendant/ Earrings)
  • Initials (if applicable)
  • Shipping address
  • website URL hyperlink (optional)

 

Class Diamond Clutch Pin | appx .75" x .75" 

 

Class Diamond Lapel Pin | appx 1.25" x 1.25" 

 

Class Diamond Pendant | Hung on 30" leather cord | appx 1.25" x 1.5" 

 

Class Diamond Earrings | appx .75" x .75"  

 

 

About the artist: Red Dakota "Waddie" CrazyHorse

Red Dakota “Waddie” CrazyHorse hails from Cochiti Pueblo, NM. 

Waddie pursued a B.A. in Native American Studies at Stanford University in June 2011. Upon graduating, Waddie was unsure what direction he should take in life: pursue the Native American art industry and work out of his father’s NM studio, or find employment in the Bay Area--the place he grew to love. Waddie realized that he could get the best of both worlds and decided to 'wing it' and start a silversmithing (ad)venture in the San Francisco Bay Area.

Waddie will continue to cultivate his own jewelry line while running Collegiate Silver. For more information on Waddie’s silver jewelry, visit his website and Facebook Page.

story:
Project Description

In November 2012 independent curator Zeina Assaf will be presenting a two-person exhibition entitled Lithic Habitats, created by emerging artists, Rose Nestler and Robin Stein, at the nonprofit CUCHIFRITOS Gallery and Project Space in Manhattan.

Lithic Habitats explores the landscape of the American West, as well as the intersection of natural architectural forms with man-made structures. Humans have long elevated natural rock formations to iconic status; they have become our sacred destinations for pilgrimage and exploration, at times even symbols of national and state identity. Yet in our modern times these awe-inspiring, natural landscapes are often contrasted with the weathered, man-made buildings that now seem to interrupt them. Lithic Habitats encourages its viewers to reconsider their relationship to traditionally American landscapes and opens a dialog about the reverence, adventure, and refuge that can be found in natural land.

Rose Nestler’s installation emulates the hue surface similarities between lavishly upholstered objects and smooth undulating rock forms. She has re-interpreted these sublime spaces on an intimate scale, and through her choice of materials, comments on the idea of the feminine and mysterious in nature. Constructed with hand-upholstered cushions in luxurious fabrics, referencing 19th century aesthetic style and craftsmanship of decorative objects the installation fills the gallery space forcing viewers to explore and touch their crowded expanses and cavernous corners, creating a small maze not unlike the Essex Street market itself. This uncharted landscape inside the gallery would be in contrast to the well-known Lower East Side and within the sanctity of the installation, participants experience an immersive, tactile and momentary respite from the outside urban environment.

In contrast to Nestler’s installation are Robin Stein’s photographs of stark dwellings dotting the desert landscape, whose residents are utilizing the land as a habitat, albeit its hostile and unyielding characteristics. This series examines the idea of frontier and changing landscapes, interrupted by man. Taken predominantly in largely isolated towns in the West, these images examine a different kind of exploration and haven within the land itself.

Nestler and Stein have collaborated on the installation’s audio: a collection of contrasting environmental sounds sourced from both the rural west and the streets of Manhattan’s Lower East Side. The audio will be be mounted inside a cavernous stack of Nestler’s cushions, causing viewers to stop and investigate the source of sound.

Artist and Curator Bios

Rose Nestler currently lives and works in Brooklyn, New York where she is a residing artist at a Chashama Studio Program in the Brooklyn Army Terminal. Through installation, drawing, and sculpture Nestler develops spaces that are illusionary yet familiar.  Themes of historical architecture, ornamental objects and untamed natural landscapes create the formal basis for her works.  Nestler received a BA in Fine Arts and Art History from Mt. Holyoke College in 2005 and now works as a Teaching Artist. Her work has been exhibited in the New York area at a variety of galleries and community organizations including, NY Studio Gallery, Arts @ Renaissance, International Studio and Curatorial Program, Proteus Gowanus and the NARS Foundation.  Nestler has been an artist-in-residence at Vermont Studio Center, Supporting Women Artists Project and Byrdcliffe Artists Colony.

Robin Stein is a multi-disciplinary artist based in Seattle, WA.  Primarily working with photography, moving images and sound, his work is rooted in an inquisitive and adventurous exploration of geography, history, and human interactions with the built and natural landscape.  His photography, installations and music have been recognized and exhibited widely, having shown in venues in New York City, Los Angeles, Chicago, Mexico City, Seattle, and Portland.

Zeina Assaf is an arts administrator, independent curator and artist living and working in Beirut, Lebanon. Curating emerging to mid-career artists since 2006 at both non-profit and commercial spaces such as Cuchifritos Gallery/Project Space, artHARLEM, and NY Studio Gallery. She is currently working at 98weeks Research/ Project space.  


What We Need

Lithic Habitats is scheduled to open on November 10th and run through December 9th, 2012.  At this time CUCHIFRITOS is unable to offer a stipend to artists. Funds are needed in order to complete Nestler’s hand-upholstered sculptural forms consisting of 6 stacks of cushions ranging from 4-9' tall.  Funds raised will also go toward the framing/printing of Stein’s photographs, as well as, the audio equipment for the installation. The execution of Nestler’s sculptural forms requires many steps, including: screenprinting the fabric, cutting out the foam and wooden shapes, sewing the slipcovers, and upholstering the cushions.  Additional funds will be needed during installation of the exhibit to transport the sculptures from Nestler’s studio to the gallery.

We are requesting $2,750, which is approximately half the cost of the total budget for the project.  100% of the funds that we raise will go to this project and will help pay for, the fabric, fabric printing, wood, foam, tools, transportation, as well as the framing and printing of the photographs.  

How Your Contribution Helps

Receiving funds from supporting donors would be an invaluable addition toward achieving our project goals. This exhibition marks a pivotal point in both Nestler and Stein’s artistic careers; it is their first solo show following numerous prior group shows. It provides the opportunity for recognition and to showcase a seminal body of work in a gallery setting.

In return we are offering many perks toward your generosity and support.  Some perks include, prints of the fabric design, Stein’s framed photographs from the show, a private screenprinting lesson, a wall drawing in your home or business, homemade pies, and a basket of wild mushrooms!   

Other Ways You Can Help

Please spread the word about Lithic Habitats and our indiegogo campaign via email, facebook or twitter.  Thank you for your support!  

Come check out our show while it’s up!  
LITHIC HABITATS
Featuring Rose Nestler & Robin Stein
Curated by Zeina Assaf

Exhibition Dates: November 10 – December 9, 2012
Gallery Hours: Tuesday – Sunday, 12-6pm
Cuchifritos Gallery/Project Space

http://artistsallianceinc.org/cuchifritos

120 Essex Street (Inside the Essex Street Market)
New York, NY
story_txt:
Project Description
In November 2012 independent curator Zeina Assaf will be presenting a two-person exhibition entitled Lithic Habitats, created by emerging artists, Rose Nestler and Robin Stein, at the nonprofit CUCHIFRITOS Gallery and Project Space in Manhattan.Lithic Habitats explores the landscape of the American West, as well as the intersection of natural architectural forms with man-made structures. Humans have long elevated natural rock formations to iconic status; they have become our sacred destinations for pilgrimage and exploration, at times even symbols of national and state identity. Yet in our modern times these awe-inspiring, natural landscapes are often contrasted with the weathered, man-made buildings that now seem to interrupt them. Lithic Habitats encourages its viewers to reconsider their relationship to traditionally American landscapes and opens a dialog about the reverence, adventure, and refuge that can be found in natural land.Rose Nestler’s installation emulates the hue surface similarities between lavishly upholstered objects and smooth undulating rock forms. She has re-interpreted these sublime spaces on an intimate scale, and through her choice of materials, comments on the idea of the feminine and mysterious in nature. Constructed with hand-upholstered cushions in luxurious fabrics, referencing 19th century aesthetic style and craftsmanship of decorative objects the installation fills the gallery space forcing viewers to explore and touch their crowded expanses and cavernous corners, creating a small maze not unlike the Essex Street market itself. This uncharted landscape inside the gallery would be in contrast to the well-known Lower East Side and within the sanctity of the installation, participants experience an immersive, tactile and momentary respite from the outside urban environment.In contrast to Nestler’s installation are Robin Stein’s photographs of stark dwellings dotting the desert landscape, whose residents are utilizing the land as a habitat, albeit its hostile and unyielding characteristics. This series examines the idea of frontier and changing landscapes, interrupted by man. Taken predominantly in largely isolated towns in the West, these images examine a different kind of exploration and haven within the land itself.Nestler and Stein have collaborated on the installation’s audio: a collection of contrasting environmental sounds sourced from both the rural west and the streets of Manhattan’s Lower East Side. The audio will be be mounted inside a cavernous stack of Nestler’s cushions, causing viewers to stop and investigate the source of sound.
Artist and Curator Bios
Rose Nestler currently lives and works in Brooklyn, New York where she is a residing artist at a Chashama Studio Program in the Brooklyn Army Terminal. Through installation, drawing, and sculpture Nestler develops spaces that are illusionary yet familiar.  Themes of historical architecture, ornamental objects and untamed natural landscapes create the formal basis for her works.  Nestler received a BA in Fine Arts and Art History from Mt. Holyoke College in 2005 and now works as a Teaching Artist. Her work has been exhibited in the New York area at a variety of galleries and community organizations including, NY Studio Gallery, Arts @ Renaissance, International Studio and Curatorial Program, Proteus Gowanus and the NARS Foundation.  Nestler has been an artist-in-residence at Vermont Studio Center, Supporting Women Artists Project and Byrdcliffe Artists Colony.Robin Stein is a multi-disciplinary artist based in Seattle, WA.  Primarily working with photography, moving images and sound, his work is rooted in an inquisitive and adventurous exploration of geography, history, and human interactions with the built and natural landscape.  His photography, installations and music have been recognized and exhibited widely, having shown in venues in New York City, Los Angeles, Chicago, Mexico City, Seattle, and Portland.Zeina Assaf is an arts administrator, independent curator and artist living and working in Beirut, Lebanon. Curating emerging to mid-career artists since 2006 at both non-profit and commercial spaces such as Cuchifritos Gallery/Project Space, artHARLEM, and NY Studio Gallery. She is currently working at 98weeks Research/ Project space.  
What We Need
Lithic Habitats is scheduled to open on November 10th and run through December 9th, 2012.  At this time CUCHIFRITOS is unable to offer a stipend to artists. Funds are needed in order to complete Nestler’s hand-upholstered sculptural forms consisting of 6 stacks of cushions ranging from 4-9' tall.  Funds raised will also go toward the framing/printing of Stein’s photographs, as well as, the audio equipment for the installation. The execution of Nestler’s sculptural forms requires many steps, including: screenprinting the fabric, cutting out the foam and wooden shapes, sewing the slipcovers, and upholstering the cushions.  Additional funds will be needed during installation of the exhibit to transport the sculptures from Nestler’s studio to the gallery. We are requesting $2,750, which is approximately half the cost of the total budget for the project.  100% of the funds that we raise will go to this project and will help pay for, the fabric, fabric printing, wood, foam, tools, transportation, as well as the framing and printing of the photographs.  
How Your Contribution Helps
Receiving funds from supporting donors would be an invaluable addition toward achieving our project goals. This exhibition marks a pivotal point in both Nestler and Stein’s artistic careers; it is their first solo show following numerous prior group shows. It provides the opportunity for recognition and to showcase a seminal body of work in a gallery setting. In return we are offering many perks toward your generosity and support.  Some perks include, prints of the fabric design, Stein’s framed photographs from the show, a private screenprinting lesson, a wall drawing in your home or business, homemade pies, and a basket of wild mushrooms!   
Other Ways You Can Help
Please spread the word about Lithic Habitats and our indiegogo campaign via email, facebook or twitter.  Thank you for your support!  Come check out our show while it’s up!  LITHIC HABITATSFeaturing Rose Nestler & Robin SteinCurated by Zeina AssafExhibition Dates: November 10 – December 9, 2012Gallery Hours: Tuesday – Sunday, 12-6pmCuchifritos Gallery/Project Space

120 Essex Street (Inside the Essex Street Market)New York, NY

story:
The art community in Calgary is alive and well...

You just have to know where to look!!

Classes, meetings, celebrations and group projects happen at Motion Gallery each week and our doors are open to everyone!

This campaign is to help keep our artist collective operating, to let people know about our wonderful space and all we have to offer!

As a non-profit gallery, we provide artists of all mediums and genres to come share their talents with the general public. Musicians, dancers, visual artists and theatre groups have used our space to showcase their work.

By making a contribution to our space, you'll be helping us continue to promote and encourage art, music and creativity within our community. All contibutions receive a minimum 1 year membership to the gallery which gives you admission to Member's Only events where you can meet some of our amazing artists and volunteers.

As a thank-you (and for your personal bragging purposes)... we will make a custom piece of artwork from your name to be displayed in our gallery!

Visit us on Facebook to find out about events, our artists and how you can get involved.

 

Story of Motion Gallery

It all started back on the 26th of November 2011...

After having dinner at Sumo Lounge with friends, Rob Dodds walked through the Eau Claire Mall noticed a large (and empty) potential gallery space.

Rob had been doing one night art shows and was looking for long term exposure. In the back of his mind he was constantly looking for a gallery space that could offer him just that. This space sparked an interest and seemed like it might be the perfect place!

After contemplating the price to rent the gallery space at Eau Claire and realizing that he had nothing to lose in just asking, he finally arranged to meet with Eau Claire's property Management 2 days later.

Harvard Management loved the idea and gave Rob an amazing deal.

The name Motion Gallery was created with the idea of Newton's theory of motion where "Objects in motion stay in motion", the Gallery's motto is not far off "Artists in motion stay in motion".

In realizing the massive space of the gallery and the amount of artwork it would need to fill the space, Rob invited all his artist friends and additionally put out the question on Facebook. "Anyone got artwork they want to hang in a new gallery in Eau Claire?Bring your artwork down".

The overwhelming response was astonishing!!! Everyone loved the idea. He was getting +50 messages and comments on Facebook daily.

When it came to the deadline, 21 Artists brought in artwork and committed to displaying their works that first month. 

The popularity of the gallery was not foreseen and Rob decided he would 'see how it goes'.

The opening day party was on the 9th December 2011.　

With the great response from all the Artists and visitors to the gallery in that first month, Rob decided to continue having the gallery opened into January 2012. Then February, then March …and so on.

With a buy-in of only $50 per month and a 15% commission taken by the gallery for artwork sold the popularity of the gallery for artists of all mediums has only increased. After 10 months, the gallery was holding works from 44 artists and boasts a waiting list of over 50 artists wanting to get their work displayed.

Being able to show how many members/supporters we have behind us helps us have a better chance of getting grant money which will help the gallery be able to promote more events, pay people working in the gallery for the time they put into making it run smoothly and eventually expand in many other directions.

　

Gallery's Intentions

Most of all, Motion Gallery is a community space. We love having artists painting, playing musical instruments, socializing and creating a fun and friendly environment for everyone. We want the gallery to be a resourceful base ground of creativity where great things happen.

We offer art classes to kids of all ages... we've hosted yoga classes, salsa classes, artist shows, musical events and have showcased artists of all mediums. We have also hosted a number of charitable fundraisers, international and national music events, birthday parties and more!

Volunteers are a very important part of the gallery. Having the support and help of our artists has made us what we are.

Hours of Operation

Wednesdays to Sundays, 12:00pm to 8:00pm - Closed Mondays and Tuesdays

story:
Pode ler a descrição deste projecto em português. Faça download do .pdf aqui.

 

***** This campaign has successfully ended. If you wish to purchase a book copy, please contact me: info@ruiromao.com ******

 

THE PROJECT AND THE CONCEPT 

At home is a series of photographies exploring places where I feel at home.

I choose to photograph this places because they make me feel well, safe, comfortable and protected. Usually they are known places where a strong emotional connection has been established through the experiences lived there.

The framing is done in the direction to the house where I was born and raised. This orientation is found with the support of maps, GPS and compass.

This process creates a dialog in between the images. They share the common idea of “home” or “being at home” and gets a double meaning: the tender “home” where the image is captured and the physical “home” where I grew up that is at the far end in the direction expressed by the framing of the image.

The title of each image correspond to the values of the azimuth and distance from the photographed place to the house where I was born.

If you wish to read more about this concept please go here.


AWARDS

This project was selected to the shortlist of Fotolibro Iberoamericano 2012 by the prestigious publisher of art and photography books Editorial RM.

 

THE BOOK

This art project comes into reality in a limited edition of a photobook.
100 copies will be printed, all signed and numbered by the author.

The book with 15.5 x 19.5 cm has 20 images, 1 geographical-conceptual map and 2 text pages in english and portuguese.
The images, printed in 200 gr. paper, have the particularity of being detachable so they can live outside the book according to the owners wish (for example to frame individually, to give to a friend, to cover a wall with a visual map, etc.).

The book has the collaboration of the design collective Vivóeusébio in the creation of the visual layout and a prolog by the writer Wolf Schmid.

 

HOW CAN YOU HELP

Giving and sharing. 

Your donation is of great value for my work, I am very grateful for it.  

Anyone can support this publishing with a donation starting from 1 €. No matter how much you give, the value of your donation will always offer you access to an active participation on this project.

You can also help by sharing this project through out the social networks and your friends.

The goal of this crowdfunding campaign is exclusively to finance the printing of this photobook.

 

WHAT YOU GET (PERKS) 

Anyone making a contribution starting from 1 € will get a really big “thank you” and his name will be printed in the thanks to section of the book credits.

With a contribution starting from 14 € or 16 € you will get a book copy signed and numbered by the author. There is the possibility for you to obtain the book copy number 1, 2, 3, 4, 5 or 100 with a contribution from 30 € to 99 €.

Besides the book you can also get a photography gallery print, 32 x 24 cm, high quality print of a limited edition of 3 copies (per photography), with a 100 € contribution or more.

If you want to make a more expressive contribution you can become the PATRON of this publishing. With a contribution starting from 1200 € your name will always be associated with this project as the PATRON and main sponsor.
You will get the artist’s signed copy of the book. That is, the extra copy of the book intended for the artist’s personal archive.
You will also get a gallery print of a unique photography from a place of your choice in Portugal (excluding the portuguese islands). 
You’ll need to give me the address or the geographical coordinates of the chosen place and I’ll go there myself to photograph it specially for you, following the same principles of the other images in this book. This photography will be included in the exhibition along with the others.
And there is more, I’ll invite you to dinner in Lisbon in a place and day agreed between us. I will cook you dinner myself as a way of showing you my deepest gratefulness.

You can read more details of the perks for each contribution on the right sided column.

For more information on how you can get your perks (book or photographies) please read the following chapter: HOW TO GET YOUR PERKS and POSTAGE FEES.

 

BOOK RELEASE

There will be a vernissage on Feb. 28th, 07.30 p.m. at Primeiro Andar in Lisbon. It will be the official release of the project and everyone is invited to come and share this special moment with me.

If your contribution gives you the right to own a book this can be the moment for you to receive it.

For more information on how you can get your perks (book or photographies) please read the following chapter: HOW TO GET YOUR PERKS and POSTAGE FEES.

 

AFTER THE BOOK: THE EXHIBITION 

In a second stage this project will become an exhibition.
It will be held in April at the gallery: Round The Corner in Teatro da Trindade, Lisbon. Soon I’ll have more information on this issue to share with you.

If you made a contribution that also gives you the right to obtain one or more photography gallery prints, you will be receiving them from the day after the end of the exhibition.

For more information on how you can get your perks (book or photographies) please read the following chapter: HOW TO GET YOUR PERKS and POSTAGE FEES.

 

HOW TO GET YOUR PERKS and POSTAGE FEES 

Your signed and numbered book copy can be pick up in the book release vernissage on Feb. 28th, 07.30 p.m. at Primeiro Andar in Lisbon. For more information please read from above: BOOK RELEASE.

Your photography gallery print (32 x 24 cm high quality print, limited edition of 3 per photography), will be delivered to you from the following day of the end of the exhibition (at end of April, specific day yet to be confirmed). I will personally deliver it to you if the shipping address is in the Lisbon area.

In case you cannot attend to the book release and pick up your book copy or your shipping address for the photography gallery print is outside Lisbon, you will be able to get your perks in your mailbox.
In order to do so you’ll need to add to your contribution the packaging and shipping fee listed below.

Book postage:
Portugal 4 €, Europe 6 €, World 7 €
Estimated delivery: March

Book and photography (1 or 3) postage:
Portugal 8 €, Europe 13 €, World 15,50 €
Estimated delivery: May

 

RISKS

The risks in this project are almost none.
The book will always be published, even if the goal value is not reached.

In that case, the book edition will be limited to 50 copies. So the supporter that claimed the copy number 100 will get the number 50 instead. All other supporters and contributions will still get what they originally claimed.

 

MORE INFORMATION

In case you feel like you want to know more about the project please visit the project facebook page here.

You can also visit my portfolio and my personal blog.

In addition you can visit the designers portfolio here.

 

I’m always available through my email in case you have any questions, enquires or just to say hello!

story:
Short Summary

I have been fortunate enough to be asked to exhibit in July, at the wonderful gallery, Lallihome, on the shores of Lake Como, in north Italy.

I believe art knows no boundries or limits and an artist must be prepared to travel, to reach their audience.

With your help I will be able to make my first solo show at Lallihome Gallery, in Varenna, everything it should be. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

Fundraising breakdown:

My €3000 budget will cover:

Gallery fees/lodging €1600 - Transport/travel costs €500 - Invites, posters, etc €200 - Vernissage costs €150 - Materials €350 - Indiegogo/Paypal fees €200

If we don't reach our goal, all the money raised will still go towards the costs with the hope that sales at the exhibition would cover the rest.

For your kind patronage to the arts, you will recieve one of a wide range of unique gifts handmade by ME, the artist, in order to show my deep appreciation for your support.

From a handpainted bookmarker, to a small, medium or large-sized painting, a touch of abstract art will find its way into your life for contributing to my cause.

The Impact

I will use every cent of this campaign diligently in order to get myself and my work to the shores of Lake Como. This show, at Lallihome Gallery, will attract daily up to a hundred plus visitors from the thousands that pass by the gallery and thus, help my art visability to a higher level. This is also new territory for me and will undoubtedly be a launching point for future opportunities. Be a part of it.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute today, please take a moment to pass this campaign on to your friends, colleagues or anyone else who might be interested.

So please spread the word, post it on facebook, twitter, etc and I'm bound to be on my way. You can also use Indiegogo share tools for this.

Thank you for your support.
