If we don't reach our goal, all the money raised will still go towards the costs with the hope that sales at the exhibition would cover the rest.
For your kind patronage to the arts, you will recieve one of a wide range of unique gifts handmade by ME, the artist, in order to show my deep appreciation for your support.
From a handpainted bookmarker, to a small, medium or large-sized painting, a touch of abstract art will find its way into your life for contributing to my cause.


The Impact
I will use every cent of this campaign diligently in order to get myself and my work to the shores of Lake Como. This show, at Lallihome Gallery, will attract daily up to a hundred plus visitors from the thousands that pass by the gallery and thus, help my art visability to a higher level. This is also new territory for me and will undoubtedly be a launching point for future opportunities. Be a part of it.


Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't contribute today, please take a moment to pass this campaign on to your friends, colleagues or anyone else who might be interested.
So please spread the word, post it on facebook, twitter, etc and I'm bound to be on my way. You can also use Indiegogo share tools for this.
Thank you for your support.

story:
I am an artist living and working in San Francisco. I just completed my MFA at the California College of the Arts and find myself in a bit of financial difficulty. I am making my work available in several budget-friendly ways (see: Perks) to help me bridge the gap between graduate school and finding employment in the real world. In order to remain alive and a part of the San Francisco arts community, I need to raise $800 by June 30. This money will go toward July's bills; any funding over the $800 goal will be used to purchase supplies and materials for future projects.  

You may visit jonathanwallraven.com to see the kind of work I am creating.

All contributors will have their names permanently listed on a special Thank You page on my website.

If you can't contribute financially, you can still help! Please, spread word of this campaign amongst your friends and social networks. 

We're all in this together.

I love you.

story:
The 402 Arts Collective is on a mission "to create and cultivate a vibrant network of artists who are committed to impacting the culture and serving the community."

We have spent the past three years offering music lessons at various locations and supplementing public school curriculum and budgets with our instructors.  There were classes scattered about the city with smatterings of students, artists, and musicians here and there.  

But we have discovered that a physical building matters.  It’s not just the concept of art.  It’s not just the creation of music, but a place for this to happen.  

Consequently, the 402 is renovating a historic building in the Benson neighborhood in the heart of Omaha’s music scene.  The upstairs restoration of this beautiful space is almost complete with lesson studios, meeting room, and a recording studio.

The construction of the main level has also begun for an all-ages music venue nestled alongside Aromas Coffeehouse.  The building will provide space for local musicians to perform, artists to display their work, and the community to gather.  It turns out, however, that old buildings have surprises.  

Not just the good kind, but also the sagging-ceilings-with-fire-and-accessibility-codes-that-are-sorely-outdated-kind.

So here we are, asking the community to help us finish a space that we will gladly return to you.  Because, you see, the 402 is driven by the affiliation of artists that both instruct and learn in the collective, but it is also invested in the community of Benson as a whole.  It will be a space to meet the neighbors, and have business meetings and study groups, and attend art showings, and support local bands.  The 402 will not just foster the arts but expose the the broader community to them.     

The need is still great.                                                                        

We can meet it together.  

-----

The price tag of renovating the Benson venue/coffeehouse/lesson studio/art gallery space is $250,000.            

Jaw-dropping, right?  

The good news is that over half of that money has already been donated by some wildly generous people.  It is because of them that construction has already begun on this building on the corner of 60th Avenue and Maple.  Those funds have gone to reinforce the ceiling and floor, install a fire suppression system, wheelchair ramps, electrical, plumbing, and drywall as well as restore the storefront to its former glory. 

We have multiple fundraisers planned to help finish the space.

This is one of them.

Your donation will go toward things like refinishing the 100-year-old hardwood floors, installing the updated tin ceiling tiles that were pain-stakingly removed by volunteers, painting and tiling and adding luxuries like toilets and an HVAC system.  Your generosity will make this space ready to be occupied by the end of September.  

That's right.  This is the final stretch, folks.  We promise.  This isn't one of those projects that you pour into while wishing upon a star that your money multiplies or the end goal will be met by the time your children's children's children come along.  We just need your help to finish the space.  We're so close.   

To show our gratitude (and because this is kind of just how Indiegogo works), we would like to offer some thank you notes of sort for you donations.  Listed to the right are some perks that we would like to offer for your generosity.  The beauty of operating an art house is that we can provide some really incredible incentives.  Original music and one-of-a-kind drawings and lessons and concerts and whatnot.  Take a look!

-----

The 402 is already doing so many great things including the following programs:

Lesson Studios: The lesson studios are dedicated to providing high quality music and art education in many disciplines. Because The 402 is a non-profit 501(c)3 organization, it can operate in a charitable sense to the community. The goal is to provide affordable lessons to as many people as possible, providing scholarships to the under-served as the organization continues to grow.

402 Rock Academy: This eight-week program combines students that are already proficient on an instrument with other musicians.  With the help of a mentor, these students learn to play as part of a band, develop their musicianship, and perform at the end of each semester at a concert that is open to the public.

Arts Education Connection: This process provides arts education to public, private, and home schools across the Omaha area to supplement the consistently downsized curriculum. The 402 is currently serving Norris Middle School, Morton Middle School, and Elkhorn South High School.

 Performance Venue (coming soon): Having an actual performance venue will expand the type of education and exposure that The 402 can currently administer to students.  An all-ages performance venue and coffeehouse will provide a stage and gallery space for developing artists to begin displaying their craft.  This honor will only be available to students of an excellent caliber which also provides incentive to grow and improve.  

-----

Please know that even $5 at a time will really add up over the next 30 days, but we also realize that not everyone will be able to contribute financially to this campaign.  News about our little nonprofit is still getting out, so if you could help by championing our efforts and talking about the 402 project and spreading the word, that would be incredibly helpful as well.  There is even a handy "share" option on this very campaign.  If you could spread the word through social media, we would really like that.  Facebook, Twitter, Instragram, Google+, LinkedIn, MySpace, digital carrier pigeons, etc...

We hope to meet you in the real life very soon.

Thank you.

story:
! 2ND PHASE !

We have been able to raise part of the funds privately and can now lower the support required on Indiegogo considerably. We are closer to the release and will be ready to deliver by February already!

What a better release date for us than the Valentine's day!?

Secure your unique present for your loved ones, have fun !

What's Perphone?

Perphone is a fashion and fragrance accessory, designed around the only object that we carry always: our smartphones. Not only is it fashionable, but it also comes to one’s rescue in daily situations.

Perphone is the perfect gadget- it can be paired and matched with whatever you are wearing, can be used by everyone in all situations, and it is ideal whenever a quick refreshment is needed before a business meeting, a date, when traveling, or simply to regain a comfortable feeling. We all need to be continuously refreshed throughout the day, every day.

We aim to replace the old-fashioned, rarely used 2-ml. testers we are given by famous brands with our new containers. They are small, light, and attached to your phone, which ensures that they will always be with you when needed. Moreover, they give a new look to the smartphones, with a large variety of colors and designs. Most people already buy covers and casings to protect and accessorize their smartphones- why not buy one that is practical as well as fashionable?

 

 

The Patent

We registered a patent in Germany and filed an international application with the Patent Cooperation Treaty (aka PCT) back in 2011 (see below), to protect our idea and its investors, as well as to reserve potential developments of it in other fields of applications that we are yet studying, like self defense with pepper spray, bad breath remedies, etc.

PCT-EP2011-063741 – German Patent Office DEGD-112092.9

Market

We have already been testing Perphone with renowned luxury and fashion brands in Milan, Paris, Düsseldorf, etc. We were delighted to witness their initial surprise, pleasure, and interest while trying out the product and going through a brain storming on its potential application fields. One of the most recurring questions was, “How did you guys come up with that?”

Why you need it…

The most striking thing about Perphone is its simple necessity. While going about your day, be it at work or university, after a meal, or moving from place to place running errands, don’t you ever feel the need to get refreshed? What if you feel the need to refresh yourself before an important meeting or date, and you don’t have time, or you forgot your perfume or breath freshener? What if you have a small purse, or simply don’t want to carry around a bulky, heavy perfume bottle? What if you are traveling and cannot carry liquids with you? Not only can Perphone refresh you throughout the flight, but you can also carry enough small, light refill containers for the entirety of your trip! And since the liquid is contained in your phone cover, you will always have it with you!

Project's Current Status and Next Steps:

We are working extensively on the designs while testing our prototypes. We aim to release 10-ml. containers. Our next step will be developing the PVC (full product) and Carbon Fiber (cases only).

The already- defined prototypes will reach the market this April, if we are able to complete the tooling process and packaging on time.

 

Our 1st prototype:

 

Release date for Indiegogo Perks : February the 14th

 

  

What we need the money for?

Tooling and packaging are the most expensive stages. We need help in building the molds for the product parts and the different packages we have enlisted in our catalogue and on the offered perks options.

About Us

Maria Del Padre is our Product Manager. She has experience in the fashion industry, and ran a wide "demand campaign" from which we received exciting results. She is responsible for market segmentation, and, together with our designer, they are actively looking into a 360 exploitation of our patents.

Our designer, Sergio Mattia, is currently residing in Italy. He has been working with 3D CAD/CAM software for about 20 years, and enjoys playing the guitar. His motto is “if after a good glass of red wine, and a homemade “antipasto” (appetizer), you still think the same, stop thinking (finish your wine) and make it real!”

Sergio Milstein is an organized computer freak with a passion for smartphones. His family is comprised of IT folks, with roots in both the former USSR and Italy. He is an extensive shopper in all northern and central Italian outlets. He is creative, innovative, and comes up with brilliant new ideas every day.

Kirill Kapranov is a young, talented, Moscow-born PR and Sales Manager that received his secondary education at Munich International School, and has studied at the university-level at Sciences Po Paris in France, as well as in the Middle East. He is an extensive traveler who speaks English, Russian, German, French, and Arabic, and is focusing on our sales pipeline execution.

We would like to thank everyone who has helped us! Our virtual team is quite large, young, experienced, and altogether is fluent in 6 languages (English, Italian, German, French, Russian, Arabic), because we understand the importance of communication, and wish our product to succeed internationally.

Risks and Challenges

-financial capacity vs. high demand -potential delay in production

 

 

Quick Runway

 

Perphone Violet

 

 

 

Perphone Maranello

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Assalaam ualaikum brothers and sisters,

Here's an opportunity to support the Dawah here at LDM this Ramadan. Our main focus is to take the dawah online; build a sound & factual resource for Muslims and non-Muslims alike and to share the intellectual foundations of Islam with the masses. Alhumdulillah with the help of Allah we have been able to achieve great things already in the 6 short months we have been active and look to take things much further. Our work can be seen here>   www.youtube.com/user/LondonDawahMovement

Brothers and sisters help us continue to do the work which will in shaa Allah bring benefit to millions of people including our self's, not to mention also our children for generations to come. Donate what ever you can for the sake of Allah this Ramadan and attain your share of the reward for this work. Spread the word, SHARE!

"Anyone who acquires it [wealth] lawfully and spends it lawfully, for him it is the best helper." (Muslim.)

story:
Through this project we want to launch a 75mm figure inspired by the Green Knight, a character of an arthurian tale: Sir Gawain and the Green Knight, contained in an english manuscript of the XIV century.

After many months of work the figure of the Green Knight is ready thanks to the help of an extremely talented sculptor and regular collaborator of Aradia Miniatures: Benoit Cauchies.

The Green Knight is the first of several figures that will be unlocked during this campaign as stretch additional goals. 
Through this campaign you have the possibility to have every figure that will be unlocked at a reduced price compared to the future sale price. (for example when The Green Knight  will be available by our website the sale price is estimated for 95 EUR + shipping costs)

         

When the main goal will be funded (1.800 €), 2 new Add-on figures will be available at a special price expanding the campaign itself!

A new Aradia line is beginning. 

But to realize this WE NEED YOUR HELP!

                             WHAT DO YOU GET BACKING US?

What you see up in the pictures is the cast quality guaranteed for every backer.

As you can see we have already casted some copies of the figure in high quality resin to test the final result, the product that you will have in your hands backing this project. We wanted to start the campaign when everything was finished so that our supporters do not have to wait a long time. 

Check the point named “Timeline” under the page to have more informations about the time of delivery!

         

Well, as you know, the campaign doesn’t stop at the achievement of the first goal: we have planned some stretch goals for you. 

* * * *

After the achievement of the main Goal 2 new Add-on figures will be unlocked at the same time! Krampus, 75mm, sculpted by Joaquin Palacios and Mawhi - the whale man, 80mm, sculpted by Allan Carrasco.

    

               
                  Baby Sad Satyr in 32mm sculpted by Christian Hardy 
  will be added FREE for every backer after the achievement of 50 supporters!  



IMPORTANT INFO:

The figures of this campaign will not be available in stores until the last reward will be shipped to the last backer.     

By helping us you will get greatly reduced prices before the official release of these figures and, of course, you'll have free shipping! 


We need a bit of your help to realize our new project and to start with the production of the castings. If you appreciate our new project, share the campaign to all your contacts and select the perk that you prefer! 

So get the word out and make some noise about our campaign! And don't forget to Like our page: https://www.facebook.com/pages/Aradia-Miniatures/180743868777695

Aradia is a company that is growing up very fastly, as a tree washed down with a tropical rain, thanks to the support of a lot of people.

Stefano and Federico Moggio are the brothers developers of the company (maybe you have already met them at World Model Expo 2014 in Stresa),

Stefano Moroni is the ingenious concept artist who has designed all the subjects,

Mirko Cavalloni is the official Aradia painter, a real alchemyst of the colors,

Benoit Cauchies is a regular collaborator of Aradia, who has already sculpted the successful figures of Diana and Yarish. With more than 20 years of experience in the world of sculpture his ability is outstanding,

Christian Hardy is a collaborator extremely talented with a unique and irresistible style,

Joaquin Palacios does not need any introduction: everyone knows his splendid works and from April 2015 he started to collaborate with Aradia,

Allan Carrasco is an authority in matter of big monsters and creatures, we are sure that you have already thrown your brushes on his works.

Since the original sculptures are already in our hands, the time of delivery will be very quick: the shippings will start a couple of months after the end of the campaign, just the time to cast the figures!

SHIPPING COSTS FOR WORLDWIDE ARE FREE FOR EVERY PERK!

RISKS & CHALLENGES

We have calculated that the rewards will be ready in 1-2 months after the end of the campaign, anyway, some potential issues could be happened:

- unexpected success of this campaign: it is unpredictable and it may cause a bit of delay having to produce many more copies that our current forecast.

- shipping delays: sometimes they could be, but we will do everything we can to help ensure the product arrives safely and in a reasonable time.

   *  *  *  *  *  *  *  *  * *  *  *  *  *  *  *  *  * *  *  *  *  *  *  *  *  * *  *  *  *  *  *  *  *  *

   *  *  *  *  *  *  *  *  * *  *  *  *  *  *  *  *  * *  *  *  *  *  *  *  *  * *  *  *  *  *  *  *  *  *

THANK YOU guys! The campaign has been funded in 3 days! The Green Knight will be on your painting desk in few months!!

Now additional figures and stretch goals for you!

By now you can add at your perk Krampus, sculpted by Joaquin Palacios, andMawhi, sculpted by Allan Carrasco. How to get them? You will have just to add the corresponding prices at your pledge!

Attention:

* If in your pledge there is the Green Knight, the price of the other figures will be cheaper: 39 € for the Krampus and 40€ for Mawhi.

* If you want just the additional figures without the Green Knight select the perk "Many Thanks" and add 45€ for the Krampus and 50€ for Mawhi.  In any case you'll get free shipments. 

   New stretch goals will be revealed soon, now enjoy the new masters!!

    *  *  *  *  *  *  *  *  * *  *  *  *  *  *  *  *  * *  *  *  *  *  *  *  *  * *  *  *  *  *  *  *  *  *
story_txt:
Through this project we want to launch a 75mm figure inspired by the Green Knight, a character of an arthurian tale: Sir Gawain and the Green Knight, contained in an english manuscript of the XIV century.

After many months of work the figure of the Green Knight is ready thanks to
the help of an extremely talented sculptor and regular collaborator of Aradia
Miniatures: Benoit Cauchies.






The Green Knight is the first of several figures that will be unlocked during this campaign as stretch additional goals. Through this campaign you have the possibility to have every figure that will be unlocked at a reduced price compared to the future sale price. (for example when The Green Knight  will be available by our website the sale price is estimated for 95 EUR + shipping costs)


         



When the main goal will be funded (1.800 €), 2 new Add-on figures will be available at a special
price expanding the campaign itself!

A new Aradia line is beginning. 
But to realize this WE NEED YOUR HELP!






                             WHAT DO YOU GET BACKING US?





What you see up in the pictures is the cast quality guaranteed for every backer.

As you can see we have already casted some copies of the figure in high
quality resin to test the final result, the product that you will have in your
hands backing this project. We wanted to start the campaign when
everything was finished so that our supporters do not have to wait a long
time. 
Check the
point named “Timeline” under the page to have more informations about the time
of delivery!





         



Well, as you know, the campaign doesn’t stop at the achievement of
the first goal: we have planned some stretch goals for you. 
* * * *
After the achievement of the main Goal 2 new Add-on figures will be unlocked at the same time! Krampus, 75mm, sculpted by Joaquin Palacios and Mawhi - the whale man, 80mm, sculpted by Allan Carrasco.



    
               
                  Baby Sad Satyr in 32mm sculpted by Christian Hardy 

  will be added FREE for every backer after the achievement of 50 supporters!  
















IMPORTANT INFO:
The figures of this campaign will not be available in stores until the last
reward will be shipped to the last backer.     
By helping us you will get greatly reduced prices before the official release of these figures and, of course, you'll have free shipping! 





We need a bit of your help to realize our new project and to start with the production of the castings. If you appreciate our new project, share the campaign to all your contacts and select the perk that you prefer! 



So get the word out and make some noise about our campaign! And
don't forget to Like our page: https://www.facebook.com/pages/Aradia-Miniatures/180743868777695




Aradia is a company that is growing up very fastly, as a tree washed down with a tropical rain, thanks to the support of a lot of people.
Stefano and Federico Moggio are the brothers developers of the company (maybe you have already met them at World Model Expo 2014 in Stresa),
Stefano Moroni is the ingenious concept artist who has designed all the subjects,
Mirko Cavalloni is the official Aradia painter, a real alchemyst of the colors,

Benoit Cauchies is a regular collaborator of Aradia, who has already sculpted the successful figures of Diana and Yarish. With more than 20 years of experience in the world of sculpture his ability is outstanding,
Christian Hardy is a collaborator extremely talented with a unique and irresistible style,
Joaquin Palacios does not need any introduction: everyone knows his splendid works and from April 2015 he started to collaborate with Aradia,

Allan Carrasco is an authority in matter of big monsters and creatures, we are sure that you have already thrown your brushes on his works.


Since the original sculptures are already in our
hands, the time of delivery will be very quick: the shippings will start a couple of months after the end of the campaign, just the time to cast the figures!
SHIPPING COSTS FOR WORLDWIDE ARE FREE FOR EVERY PERK!
RISKS & CHALLENGES

We have calculated that the rewards will be ready in 1-2 months after the end
of the campaign, anyway, some potential issues could be happened:
- unexpected success of this campaign: it is unpredictable and it may
cause a bit of delay having to produce many more copies that our current
forecast.
- shipping delays: sometimes they could be, but we will do everything
we can to help ensure the product arrives safely and in a reasonable time.
   *  *  *  *  *  *  *  *  * *  *  *  *  *  *  *  *  * *  *  *  *  *  *  *  *  * *  *  *  *  *  *  *  *  *   *  *  *  *  *  *  *  *  * *  *  *  *  *  *  *  *  * *  *  *  *  *  *  *  *  * *  *  *  *  *  *  *  *  *THANK YOU guys! story:
WHO ARE WE?

VAIKRA is an art lab consisting of three people. VAIKRA creates  visual and sound installation pieces - "Actums".  An actum represents a single visual soundscape and includes  elements of light painting performance, music and stage design. An actum engages to create an audible and visual associative live atmosphere. An audio-visual series of events created directly during unique live performances. While taking into consideration the classical parallels already developed between music and the arts, VAIKRA  seeks fresh forms of exhibition for artistic ideas. By contributing to the existing modular of abstractionism and figurativism, VAIKRA is paving the path for the development of new ways of expression in painting, light and sound presentation.  VAIKRA has many points of contact with Rayonism and neo-futurism, while remaining in line with classical philosophical concepts. VAIKRA is a group of independent artists. We are receives no funding from any of the official or state organizations.  Our projects do not carry any political connotations; it is art in its original sense.  Music and pictorial art in VAIKRA is deeply associative, and visualisation exists within the audio series. Music, art and philosophy always remain inseparable when presented by VAIKRA.

WHAT DID WE DECIDE?

It is time to take VAIKRA to the next level. In order for our work to reach  as many people as possible, we plan to organize our first tour which will focus on public discussion about neoteric art and it's position in a contemporary society. We intend to show our performances in Tel Aviv, New York, Boston, Berlin and Vienna. The list of cities can definitely be expanded. We would like to show our live light paintings in crowded outdoor  spaces. After each performance we would start the discussion.  Frequently, we film our discussions and interview those who want to express their opinions. The  debates are constantly  documented by three cameras simultaneously. We believe in the importance of social discussions, because through discussions and debates, we can try to expand our expression of pure art. Crowd art in other words.  

WHY DO WE NEED YOUR HELP?

Although we already received wonderful support from our friends, families and critics who collaborate on this production, to get a greater exposure and ensure, we can keep on making new project, we now ask for your help in order to have access to a professional rehearsal space, make some additions to the set and invest in technical equipment. VAIKRA now is in it's pre-production process: its the rehearsal period.  Please pledge what you can, so that the show can be seen by as many people as we can fit into the various venues we would like to participate in. Without these budget points the project cannot be realized. With your help, we hope to acquire the necessary means to continue functioning as VAIKRA, a unique art lab for light and sound performances.

WHY CROWD-FUNDING?

We work as freelance artists reliant on casual funding for each new endeavor. we’re appealing to our audiences. This is our first experiment with crowd-funding, which we see as an opportunity to directly involve the people who care about this kind of practice. It is a chance to empower the project and augment its possibilities.

WHAT DO WE EXACTLY NEED?

We’ve set our campaign at raising 10000 US dollars because we believe that amount to be an achievable minimum target.  The full amount that we need to get to start our tour is about 21000 USD. We have already collected approximately  11000 dollars   from other sources - private donations and personal savings. We also  applied for funding  from the Department of Culture of the municipality of Tel Aviv.  We have already acquired  part of the equipment we need, such as an iPad, MacBook Pro, an indoor low lumen projector, two musical synthesizers, a camera and etc.

Here's a detailed breakdown of what we exactly need:

3800 USD –  this sum will allow us to rent the necessary equipment for public performances, such as: amplifiers, speakers, generators, microphones etc.  

1500 USD - advertising and promotion expenses for the project

4700 USD –  necessary devices with which  we work day by day. those include: a digital sound Recorder, two iPads for live light painting that is possible with the "Tagtool" iPad app, iPad stylus pen, VGA and HDMI cables, adapters, audio mixer and special audio consoles.

Upon request, we are able to provide full budget-management reports.

WHAT YOU GET 

Your donations will help a community of VAIKRA art lab artists thrive. Performances will be created, discussions will be opened, sets will be built, and many visions will be brought to fruition. Contributing to our campaign is a way to support art in a very direct way. And, even more, maybe with your support we will be able to convert contemporary art from ostentation to discussion.

Also you get digital file ready for printing. You can print picture on paper, silk, canvas or any other suitable surface and also on cups, t-shirts and etc.

 20 dollars  - we send you the piece of digital art based on your own image, icon or photography.  For print size A4 (210х297 mm).

 50 dollars   - we send you the piece of digital art from limited VAIKRA art lab collections list. For print size A3 (297х420mm)

 100 dollars  -  our artist will draw your sketch during hour live Skype session.  For print size A0 (841х1189mm).  

Starting with 200 dollars  and more we invite you to contact us directly to discuss the details of your sponsorship.


Thanks for your support! We can't do it without you ;)

MORE INFO:

Site: vaikralight.com

Fb: VAIKRA art lab

Vimeo: VAIKRA

You Tube: VAIKRA art lab

Twitter: @VAIKRAartlab

Email: vaikramail@gmail.com

Phone: +972547472577

Keep in touch, VAIKRA art lab.

story:
Short Summary

Monmouth Arts is our county’s official agency dedicated to fostering the arts. Our work ranges from arts education, support of the arts community, grants, creative place-making, marketing, special events and more. We connect artists, arts organization and art lovers across the county for enriching experiences – for all ages.  If you love the arts and love Monmouth County, this is where they come together.

In just a few short weeks, we will be opening the doors to an exciting storefront space next to Count Basie Theater. This will make it that much easier for us to connect arts and the community... because we will be open to the community and so much easier to find!

What We Need & What You Get

Our biggest challenge? MOVING IS EXPENSIVE! Between wiring an office, paying for the labor involved in painting, boxing up 40 years of work and the move itself, we will need funds to cover our move downstairs. We want to be as efficient as possible, so we can still spend our money where it's needed most-on fostering and supporting artists and arts groups. 

This is where YOU come in! Are you an artist yourself, or a part of an arts group? Have you enjoyed some of the amazing arts programming we have available here in Monmouth County? Maybe you've worked with us at our Monmouth Teen Arts Festival, or the annual ArtEd Awards (impacting 2,000 + students around the county).

Last year, Monmouth Arts contributed to 2,550 arts activities that involved 762,400 individuals and artists from Monmouth County and beyond.  With our new, more public space, we are hoping to get even more people involved! Will you help us get there?

We have some fun perks planned to welcome you into our great new space. From a continental breakfast, to a special VIP reception and free tickets to our events... our perks are all there to thank our supporters and welcome you as friends!

The Impact

Your donation will go even further with an incredible opportunity we have been presented with. A generous board member is willing to match up to $2,500 in donations for this campaign. This is exciting, because it will double your gift! $5 becomes $10, $20 becomes $40 and $500 becomes $1,000.

Risks & Challenges

As we said above, our main challenge is that moving is expensive! Well... that, and decluttering 40 years of work before packing it (but you can't help us much there)! Every dollar given to this campaign will help us with the end goal of being able to welcome you to our new space... where community and arts connect. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this with your circle of friends and colleagues. You know us from our years of work in the community, and now we really need your help in spreading the word! 

Thank you from your friends at Monmouth Arts,

Mary Eileen, Pat, Sandy, Danielle, Tammy & Heather

story:
About Me...

My name is Tia Mushka.  I am an artist, illustrator, writer and mapmaker living in Nova Scotia, Canada, a picturesque corner of the world.

I have recently been handed a golden opportunity for change. A job loss.  My day job loss that is.   My other job (besides being a mother) for the past three years has been writing and illustrating for children and young adults.  I've been perfecting my skills and techniques, building a quality portfolio and I'm ready to launch a professional illustration studio.  I even recently completed the prestigious SCBWI (Society of Children's Book Writers and Illustrators) mentorship program where I was paired with the amazing author/illustrator Jim Averbeck.  I couldn't have chosen a better path than learning from him.  
With your help, I can embark on a promotional campaign, sending postcards of my portfolio to agents and art directors all over North America and Europe.  I am also seeking to attend an important conference coming up in New  York City, where editors and art directors of the publishing world will be gathered.

Where the funds will go...

I am looking for $3300 to launch a promotional campaign for my new illustration studio, attend an illustration and writing conference in New York City, and basic supplies, fees and learning opportunities for the profession.

  • Promotional Campaign includes printing 300 postcard mailers, envelopes, postage, and scanning costs
  • SCBWI Conference includes flight, hotel and attendance at the conference where I will meet professional illustrators, writers, editors, agents and art directors.
  • Supplies and fees includes an upgrade to Photoshop CC (industry standard)($100), art supplies ($320), Website fees and maintenance ($100) SCBWI membership renewal ($80) and Two online writing  courses ($150)
I have some fun perks for you, including
  • postcards
  • greeting cards
  • prints
  • commissioned maps
  • lots of stickers!
A big thank you to everyone watching, sharing, reading and hoping with me!
You can view my online portfolio at  www.tiamushka.com

story:
The purpose of this fundraiser is to improve the equipment I have for taking pictures at events, parties, concerts, and other happenings where a portable flash is required. Recent events led to the demise of my previous flash, which was older than many of my subjects anyway. This represents both a crisis and opportunity.

Funding will go directly to obtaining a new flash unit, remote triggers, increased computer storage for image libraries, and other small equipment purchases that will aid in taking low-light photos at a higher level of quality.

Motivation is always a serious issue, so here is why you should help:

  1. I don’t really make any money doing this: most of my efforts fall under the rubric of “gifts to the community”.
  2. Most people like their photos to look, y’know, good: hey, skill helps, but occasionally it must be supplemented with equipment.
  3. My most popular work occurs at night, in dark clubs, backyards, or in vast fields filled with freaks: basically low-light situations where flash is compulsory.
  4. Those poor creatures who spin poi, staff, rope dart, and other low-intensity fire tools always get shorted compared to the fire-breathers, pyrobubblers, and people who have multiple poofers to provide high-intensity light sources for their photos: don’t leave the former in the dark!
  5. Because crowd-sourced funding is a great way to support a local artist without having to dip too deeply into any one pocket.

Now this is part of the plea that points out that if everyone who liked a photo, copped a profile pic, shared an album, or allowed their mom to comment on a non-embarrassing, professional style photo donated $1-5, I could be out of your e-hair and back shooting glorious nighttime photos in no time flat. I shan’t belabor this point.
story_txt:
The purpose of this fundraiser is to improve the equipment I
have for taking pictures at events, parties, concerts, and other happenings
where a portable flash is required. Recent events led to the demise of my
previous flash, which was older than many of my subjects anyway. This
represents both a crisis and opportunity. 
Funding will go directly to obtaining a new flash unit,
remote triggers, increased computer storage for image libraries, and other
small equipment purchases that will aid in taking low-light photos at a higher
level of quality.
Motivation is always a serious issue, so here is why you
should help:


I don’t really make any money doing this: most
of my efforts fall under the rubric of “gifts to the community”.


Most people like their photos to look, y’know,
good: hey, skill helps, but occasionally it must be supplemented with
equipment.


My most popular work occurs at night, in dark
clubs, backyards, or in vast fields filled with freaks: basically low-light
situations where flash is compulsory.


Those poor creatures who spin poi, staff, rope
dart, and other low-intensity fire tools always get shorted compared to the
fire-breathers, pyrobubblers, and people who have multiple poofers to provide
high-intensity light sources for their photos: don’t leave the former in the
dark!


Because crowd-sourced funding is a great way to
support a local artist without having to dip too deeply into any one pocket.

Now this is part of the plea that points out that if everyone
who liked a photo, copped a profile pic, shared an album, or allowed their mom
to comment on a non-embarrassing, professional style photo donated $1-5, I
could be out of your e-hair and back shooting glorious nighttime photos in no
time flat. I shan’t belabor this point.

story:
Thank you for making 'Walls of Freedom' a reality. In case you missed the Indiegogo campaign, you can click here and order the book!


We are Basma Hamdy & Don Karl, the curators of Walls of Freedom. For the past one and a half years we have been working on this project collaborating with 50 photographers, 30 artists and 20 authors. Since the beginning of the revolution, we have been involved in Egypt’s thriving urban art scene. We worked closely with a network of its leading artists on mural projects, events and exhibitions. We started to work on this book in order to professionally document the Egyptian Street Art explosion. The amazing artworks of the two and a half years pieced together, tell the whole story of the Egyptian revolution.

We have worked with many artists, capturing their art, their vision and their stories. We collaborated with Activists, Egyptologists and Historians to accurately tell the story of the changing role of expression in public space.

It has been an amazing journey...

We have put our heart and soul and a staggering amount of work into this book. In order to complete it – and truly do justice to the artists and the story of the revolution- we now need financial support. This will cover parts of the essential costs of production such as printing, and further editing & design.

Check our diagram below for more info:

 

We have knocked on all doors and windows and managed to get you some mind blowing and exclusive perks. We are offering some very special deals and even original artworks from some of the most influential artists in the region. Check out the list on the right or look in the perk section below for a clear breakdown. We will be adding more perks and updating our page so check back often!

 

 

Why you should support us!

The impact of getting this project funded is huge. We believe that what we have is something much more than a graffiti book. This book captures the art, thoughts, dreams and beauty of the revolution. We have collected everything from newspaper clippings to hand-drawn sketches. We have sourced photographs from amateur and professional photographers. The essays range from expert commentary to personal accounts. We honestly did not leave a stone unturned, we dug deep into context, meaning and analysis.

There are many giant publishers our there who may value commercial content over depth, isn't that what sells after all? NO! Lets prove them wrong. Lets make this book epic! Because if we do we are changing the way publishing works, we are prioritizing content, we are proving that people want something beautiful AND meaningful! Everyone who agreed to work with us on this project believed in it, and we know you will believe in it too! Some photographers have risked their lives to get some of the shots that will be published in this book. Artists have been arrested and harassed and continued to paint walls through tear gas and battles. These people deserve to have their voices heard.

Egyptians have been fighting for freedom and social justice, and they continue to do so, this book tells their story but its really everyone's story. Anyone who values freedom will relate to this book and the stories in it and will be inspired.

 

 

Don Karl is a cultural activist, graffiti artist, author and publisher from Berlin. He started to paint graffiti in 1983 and runs the publishing house From Here To Fame. He co-wrote the book Arabic Graffiti and curated numerous international urban art projects. Check his Arabic Graffiti Blog for more info on his many projects!

Basma Hamdy is an Egyptian artist, designer & professor who graduated from the American University in Cairo in 1998 and obtained a Master of Fine Arts from MICA (the Maryland Institute College of Art in 2003). Her research interests include cultural preservation, Arabic Type Design and Egyptian Pop Culture. Her work was recently featured in the book "Arabic Type Design for Beginners" by the Khatt Foundation. She has been teaching Art & Design in the Middle East for over 9 years.

“This book, is an act within our revolution – our continuing revolution.”
Ahdaf Soueif, Booker prize finalist, Egyptian Novelist, political & Cultural commentator

"Walls of Freedom shows what we as Egyptians have accomplished until today, something we need to appreciate, to know how we should continue.” Hanaa el Degham, Artist

"How many books have been published about Egypt's revolutionary Streetart? This is the only one I wanna read!" Ganzeer, Artist

"We will not understand the Egyptian revolution unless we delve deep into the Graffiti that covers the walls of the country. It is the true chronicle of the revolution. I am certain that "Walls of Freedom"will be an exquisite combination of Art & Intellect that reflects the true spirit of what is unravelling in our nation. Personally I cannot wait to get my copy of this book"- Magdy El-Shafee Author of Metro, the first Arabic Graphic Novel

“Walls of Freedom is the real voice of the Egyptian revolution graffiti scene. It is not the documentation of a solitary point of view on the phenomena but a crowd-sourced collection of testimonies by actual artists who were and are still present daily in the battlefield with nothing but their spray cans. The world finally has a chance to hear our stories and see us through our own lenses.” Bahia Shehab-Ted Fellow, Islamic Art Historian and Artist

“Walls of freedom is a reminder of people's ability to take their destiny into their own hands!” Sondos Shabayek, founder of Tahrir Monologues, political activist

 “I met Don Karl for the first time when I was bombing Alexandria with MaClaim, I was thrilled when he signed me a copy of his book 'Arabic Graffiti' which was a fusion of different styles, concepts and techniques which was carefully chosen and professionally introduced in one of the best graffiti books out there. Now I am honored to be featured in 'Walls of Freedom' which in my opinion is going to be the most honest and professional documentation of the Egyptian graffiti movement in our time.” Aya Tarek, Egyptian graffiti artist

 

 

Below are the perks we are offering to contributors, please select a category from below, if your category includes a "CHOICE" please read the instructions after this table. If you are not interested in perks, you can simply select any category from the right then "change perks" and pick the "no perk" option. 

 

HOW TO CHOOSE YOUR PERK:(only applicable to perks that include choices we've marked those with an ORANGE STAR): 

If you choose a perk with a poster, print, artwork, t-shirt /tote or graffiti panel you may select from below:

  1. Choose your perk category from the list above.
  2. Look at the list below and check for the CODE that corresponds with your choice.
  3. After you select your perk and enter your details, type the CODE corresponding to your choice in between brackets following your STREET ADDRESS. 
  4. Please do not forget to add the shipping amount manually to the total BEFORE you pay otherwise we will not be able to ship your perks.
  5. PLEASE NOTE: if you do not enter a CODE we cannot guarantee your choices. Please email us the code if you forget to include it.
  6. We will be updating this page marking sold-out perks and adding new ones so check back!

For questions check the FAQ or send us an email at info@wallsoffreedom.com

 

 

Below are more detailed images of each individual perk with a clearer description. Please visist www.wallsoffreedom.com for more background stories on each perk and details on the artists.

Posters: 

Type Specimen for SALAM FONT:

Please see the translation of the poem here.

 

 

  

 

 

 

  

You can see details of the totes here.

 

ARTISTS PRINTS:

 


ORIGINAL ARTWORK:

 

 

 

Why do you need money if the book is finished and why isn't the publisher paying the costs?

The book is not finished, we still need to complete the writing, editing, design, final layout and the bulk of the money we are asking for will go to printing. Our publisher is an independent pubishing house who has always been passionate about creating projects that have a meaningful impact. They are not a giant publisher focused on commercial aspects. This project has a limited budget and in order to complete it we need to raise the money. 

How will you know my size for the T-shirts?

if you picked a perk that includes a T-shirt, sizes available are S, M, L, XL. We will be in touch to get your tshirt sizes.

Can I pick more than one perk?

Yes but you must pay for them separately so that we can keep track of what you chose.

Can I contribute more money than a particular category?

Sure, if you chose a perk that is $130 and you want to give $200 go ahead and enter the number manually upon checkout.

If you raise more than you need what will you do with the money?

We have created some amazing projects like: White Wall Beirut, Khaled Said on the Berlin Wall, and Arabic Graffiti & Street Art in Frabkfurt. If we raise more than we need we plan to create graffiti events & exhibitions in Egypt to help promote the artists and the medium.

We also plan to expand the book and include foldout pages to create a more interactive book (similar to the foldout above). The more money we raise the better the book will be and the more events and artists we can support.

Why are there similar designs in the Artwork & Print Perks?

Some artists like ElSeed & Mohamed Gaber are offering original artworks, but we are also offering prints of their work that are more affordable. The Artworks are orginial, meaning they were created by the artist & signed. The prints are copies of the artwork but are high-quality on heavyweight paper suitable for framing.

I don't want a perk, can I still donate?

Sue just click the "contribute" button, enter the sum you want to donate and choose "No perk I just want to donate".

I chose my perk, now what?

Please refer to the REFERENCE DIAGRAM and then choose the perk from the indiegogo menu on the right, check out and enter the code next to your shipping address.

Have more questions?

Info@wallsoffreedom.com

If you feel you cannot give money to our project there are many other ways you can help us! Get the noise around, tell people about this project and how they can help! Tweet, share on facebook, take a snapshot and instagram it, shout it out from the rooftops! You get the drift! Do you know someone who would be interested to give to our project or help in anyway? Let us know! Thank you!

Here's our shortlink again: igg.me/at/wallsoffreedom

Here's our website: www.wallsoffreedom.com

You can also use the links below the video to share!

story:
Hello my name is Tomas Stanton and I am the Director of Phonetic Spit. Our mission is to create safe spaces to empower our next generation of leaders to develop their voice through the Art of Spoken Word Poetry and use it to become driven and contributing citizens of the world. In addition to empowering voice our youth development programs have become an agent for change in our nation’s battle against illitercy. Furthermore, our littercy goals are not only to develop more efficient readers and writer, we also aim to develop very critical life skills in addressing 3 additional forms of literacy.

Emotional Literacy: The ability to recognize, understand, and appropriately express our emotions. Emotional literacy is the basis for perceiving and communicating emotions.

 

Oral Literacy: The ability to effectively communication orally with an audience.

 

Cultural Literacy: Knowledge of history, contributions, and perspectives of diverse cultural groups, including one’s own group. Cultural literacy is a fundamental aspect of one’s ability to comprehend reading, writing and other media sources.

 

SPOKEN WORD:

                A YOUTH MOVEMENT

 

 Through its dynamic performance and explosive content, Spoken Word has the ability to engage the listener in an intimate and emotional dialogue that makes for the ideal learning environment, one which decodes complex issues, ethical controversies, pedagogical conflicts, and historical events through performance art.

Poetry and spoken word in particular have become strong and accessible teaching tools requiring teens to develop an in-depth focus on language, identity, and literacy development. The critical thinking and cultural literacy skills young writers develop lay the crucial foundation for active civic, community, and educational involvement.

 

BRAVE NEW VOICES

INTERNATIONAL YOUTH POETRY FESTIVAL:

In addition to our in-school residencies where we visit over 25 schools a year, Phonetic Spit also takes a team of 6-7 students to participate in the BNV International Youth Poetry Festival. BNV is an annual festival where students for all across the globe unite and share their personal stories and diverse cultures. With in the 5 day festival our students particapate in dynamic youth development work shop and high energy poetry slams. This is a once in a life time experience for our students, most of which come from underserved communities and low income households. This year’s festival will be held in Chicago, IL.

What we need:   

The total cost of this trip is between $8,000 & 9,000 (depending on travel expenses)

$1,500: Registration fee that covers 6 students and 1 staff/coach (This fee is due May 15th to secure our spot)

            - This fee covers room and board and 1 meal a day for the entire conference

 

$1,500: To cover room and board and 1 meal a day for 1 additional student & 2 additional staff (1 female and 1 male) to make sure we cover a proper ratio to ensure the safety of our students.

 

$3,500 - $4,500: This would cover 9 round trip airline tickets to Chicago based on air fares today. This cost will go up the closer we get to the departure date. (Based on rates as of 5-20-13)  

 

$1,500: Additional money for food at $30/per day for 7 students and 3 staff.

 

Total:$8,000 - $9000

Sponsorship:$5,000 (This sponsorship was made possible by Project Humanities)

Total needed: Approximately $5,000 based on travel expenses and incentive packages.  

 

(None of the funds raised goes towards staff salaries. The countless hours our staff put into making this trip possible with coordination, 3 times per week coaching, fundraising, etc… is all donated)

 

Impact:

 

The impact an experience like this can have on a young person is priceless. In addition to the social development these students will also be exposed to a very radical educational experience. One of the students who participated in last year’s trip, Garrett Pauli, met the lead liaison to The University of Wisconsin’s Frist Wave Program. This is a radical program that uses the pedagogy of Spoken Word and Hip Hop Theatre to further develop our next generation of leaders. They offer 10 full ride scholarships to graduating seniors from all across the globe. Upon returning home from the festival, Garrett began the process of applying for this very prestigious opportunity, and based on his participation in our programs he was 1 of 10 students to be awarded the scholarship. As the director of Phonetic Spit I am honored to say that Garrett is the third student from our program that has awarded with this opportunity.    

 

Thank you in advance for supporting our mission with your generosity.

 

Respectfully,

 

Tomas J. Stanton

story:
9168 Paris - Rio c'est : 

Un thème. La vision de l’autre et de son environnement culturel. Le projet 9168 invite les artistes à un véritable dialogue interculturel et cherche, à travers l’art, à rapprocher deux pays, pourtant géographiquement opposés.

Une rencontre. Non seulement la rencontre d’artistes de nationalités différentes mais aussi de courants différents : l’art contemporain et l’art urbain. Tous deux seront en fusion par l’intermédiaire de différentes disciplines telles que les arts visuels, la danse ou encore la musique. Notre sélection d’artistes cherchera à illustrer comment des réalisations issues de cultures différentes peuvent trouver des points de convergence.

Des artistes confirmés et émergents. Le festival sera aussi l’occasion pour de jeunes artistes en devenir d’exposer aux côtés d’artistes de renom tels que Toz (graffeur brésilien confirmé), ou encore Henry Hang (artiste plasticien). 

Nous avons besoin de vous ! 

Nous avons besoin de fonds afin de financer : 

- Les tirages des photographies qui seront exposées tout au long du festival

- Ainsi que les différents vernissages, auxquels vous êtes conviés! 

C'est pourquoi nous espérons, grâce à votre aide, atteindre la somme de 2 000 Euros. 

En contrepartie, nous vous proposons de nombreux goodies, des affiches de l'exposition, des cartes réalisées par les artistes, et une visite privée de l'exposition...  

La programmation : 

1. Une exposition d'un mois et demi à la Maison des arts de Créteil (ligne 8 : Créteil préfecture, à 30 minutes de République), à partir du samedi 24 septembre 2016. Au programme : seront exposés entre autres Toz, Henry Hang, Lazoo, 9eme concept, Batsh, Marc Goldstain, Antonin Heck, Pok, Adèle Taillefert, Nicolas Denis, Emilie Hoa Fleury, Baptiste Marescaux, Irvin Heller, Hadrien Durand-Baïssas... Et d'autres belles surprises vous attendent!  
2. Le 24 septembre sera une journée consacrée également au live painting, à l'intérieur du centre commercial Créteil Soleil, en présence de 6 artistes graffeurs. 
3. Une série de conférences à La Place, centre culturel Hip Hop au forum des Halles à Paris, dès le mois d'octobre. Le projet 9168 Paris - Rio, c'est aussi l'envie de comprendre le climat artistique et culturel actuel à l'échelle internationale, c'est pourquoi est organisée avec La Place, une série de conférences sur les thèmes de l'art urbain et de l'art contemporain au sein de nos sociétés.

4. L'exposition des œuvres du street artiste brésilien Pok à la Galerie d'art de Créteil. Dans sa dynamique de valorisation de l'art brésilien, le projet 9168 a choisi de dédier pleinement la galerie de Créteil à Pok. Le vernissage aura lieu le vendredi 23 septembre 2016.

Toute la programmation se trouve sur notre site: https://parisrio9168.wordpress.com/ 

et sur notre page Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/association9168/timeline

N'hésitez pas à parler de notre projet autour de vous! Nous vous attendons nombreux dès le 23 septembre!
story_txt:
9168 Paris - Rio c'est : 
Un thème. La vision de l’autre et de son environnement culturel. Le projet 9168 invite les artistes à un véritable dialogue interculturel et cherche, à travers l’art, à rapprocher deux pays, pourtant géographiquement opposés.
Une rencontre. Non seulement la rencontre d’artistes de nationalités différentes mais aussi de courants différents : l’art contemporain et l’art urbain. Tous deux seront en fusion par l’intermédiaire de différentes disciplines telles que les arts visuels, la danse ou encore la musique. Notre sélection d’artistes cherchera à illustrer comment des réalisations issues de cultures différentes peuvent trouver des points de convergence.

story:
The End

A collaborative Zine about the End of the World. Print issues will be out in September 2020
 

What‘s a Zine?


A Zine is something like a magazine - just not »professional«, i.e. with a budget and a publisher. Back in the days and still today zines are often created by a single person, printed at home, stitched together by hand. The plan for The End, though, is to get it printed by a company in a small number, depending on money raised via crowdfunding and preorder.

 

What‘s the Apocalypse?

 

It‘s a lot. Many different ideas and meanings. Currently a lot of people feel the Corona crisis is the Apocalypse... Anyway, whatever it is, it has to do with big things ending. Society, nature, humankind - either they cease existing completely or they just change in a drastic way that unhinges our lives. That‘s what this Zine is about.

 

What‘s in it?

 

A lot of people have been contributing content (without payment!). Fiction and essays, comics and illustrations, fotos and memes, poems and music. Basically everything was allowed, all kinds of artistic expression dealing with the End of the World.


What comes out?

 

There will be one printed issue of The End. Page count might be around 60 to 70. The number of issues will be 100, so it's limited!
With 400€ we can get the Zine printed with the full page count and also cover the shipping costs. If there is less many we might need to cut down on the page count to maximum 60 pages.

 

Who are the people contributing?

 

Friends, mostly. Old friends and new friends, some of them I befriended by asking them to make a contribution to this project. Some of them are artists, some are not or didn‘t know they were. I would say there is a certain tendency to leftist intersectional feminism as a common feature in this group but otherwise it's quite diverse. They all contributed without receiving any kind of payment.


Who is Julia Freier?

 

Hi, that‘s me! I am a graphic designer and illustrator from Berlin. I am a white cis woman, poor and queer, creative and mother. I love many aspects of my graphic design job - drawing, designing, layouting, working with clients. Furthermore I love working with people, connecting, joining forces and ideas. So this project is the incarnation of my passion. It would be cool if I got paid for it, but you can‘t have it all, right?

 

Why a Zine about the Apocalypse?

 

Storytime. I wanted to make a zine because I wanted to do some creative project on my own conditions. I pondered about the topic. Than I realised that every conversation I had with any person somehow at some point touched the End of the World. The idea seemed to be everywhere. On Netflix, at parties, in my own mind. So there was my topic.
That was in summer 2019. Now reality has caught up with art and as I am writing this, there is a worldwide pandemia that feels pretty apocalyptic...

So this is...

the Zine for 2020!

Order a copy today because who knows if the World will still be there tomorrow!

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.

  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
(Version en français plus bas)

ABOUT ME:

My name is Kate Ramsden and I am a Montreal based maker, choreographer and co-founder of the dance film collective Project Contrabête. Contrabête has produced 5 dance videos and installations screened at the Christie Pitts Film Festival, Breakthroughs Film Festival, Nuit Blanche, Bouge D’ici and Glass Door Gallery. This year I have begun making live dance performances under my name. My recent fascinations include creating live performances rooted in themes of games and play.

I am an instructor at École de Danse Variations where I teach dance and movement to children as young as 4 years old and to adults of all ages. It is through teaching that I feel most connected to my community, and it is a true joy to be able to share expression of movement with non-dancers and dancers alike!

WHAT IS THE PROJECT:

I am raising the funds to finish the creation of BALLS, a site specific group choreography presented by the 2018 Festival Quartiers Danse. This will be my first group choreography and my first presentation with the festival.

BALLS is a collaborative dance piece choreographed by myself, interpreted by six female dancers and accompanied by an interactive musical score. BALLS researches the ways women and their bodies are represented in sports and competition. The work uses the movement already present in sports to unveil the perceptions of the female body in dialogue with teamwork, competition, strength, weakness, and support.

This project includes: three weeks of final creation with the entire team, followed by three performances.

BALLS has been researched collaboratively with dancers Léna Demnati, Erin O’Loughlin, Marilyne Cyr,  Koliane Rochon Prom Tep, Katherine Ng, Jessie Lhôte, Naomi CP Hillaire, Lara Oundjian, Cara Roy, Nyda Kwasowsky, and composer Samuel Dzierzawa. Thanks to the generous input from these amazing artists!

Shows are FREE for all!! Show times are:

Sunday, September 9th at 11:30am – Marché Maisonneuve

Monday, September 10th 5pm – Jardins Gamelin

Wednesday, September 12th 12:30pm – Place des Festivals

WHY AM I FUNDRAISING:

Fundraising goal: $4000

I am using this campaign to raise $4000 to cover the fees for this final phase of creation. The money will cover the artistic fees of the six dancers involved, the composer, costume designer, and for additional props and costumes.

As a choreographer and employer, central to my practice is the ability to challenge dance norms. I value collaboration as a labour. Although I have not received funding from public grant offices in Canada or Quebec in 2018, I have taken side jobs to secure the funds to pay all collaborators fairly. However, I am now turning to my community for support. Your invaluable support will make this project a success and help me toward my dream of building sustainable jobs for dancers and artists!

HOW YOU CAN HELP:

Any size donation will help me on this journey to getting BALLS on stage! No donation is too small.

However, since many of us are artists living in late stage capitalism, I understand that not everyone can donate. If you still want to support BALLS feel free to share this campaign on Facebook, Twitter or Instagram.

Thank you for your support, I could not finish this project without you! I hope to see you at the show!

//

 

À PROPOS DE MOI:

Je m'appelle Kate Ramsden et je suis créatrice, chorégraphe et cofondatrice du collectif de films de danse Projet Contrabête. Contrabête a produit 5 vidéos et installations de danse présentées au Christie Pitts Film Festival, au Breakthroughs Film Festival, à la Nuit Blanche, à Bouge D'ici et à la Galerie Glass Door. Cette année, j'ai commencé à faire des spectacles de danse en direct sous mon nom. Mes récentes fascinations incluent la création de performances ancrées dans le thème des jeux.

Je suis instructrice à l'École de Danse Variations où j'enseigne la danse et le mouvement à des enfants aussi jeunes que 4 ans et à des adultes de tous âges. Grâce à l'enseignement, je me sens le plus proche de ma communauté et c'est un réel plaisir de partager l'expression du mouvement avec des danseurs et non-danseurs!

DESCRIPTION DU PROJET

Je recueille des fonds pour terminer la création de BALLS, une chorégraphie de groupe in-situ qui sera présentée dans le cadre du Festival Quartiers Danse 2018. Ce sera ma première chorégraphie de groupe et ma première collaboration avec le festival.

BALLS est une pièce collaborative chorégraphiée par moi-même, interprétée par six danseuses et est accompagnée d'une partition musicale interactive. BALLS est une recherche chorégraphique sur la façon dont les femmes et leurs corps sont représentés dans les sports et la compétition. L'œuvre utilise le mouvement déjà présent dans le sport pour dévoiler les perceptions du corps féminin dans le dialogue avec le travail d'équipe, la compétition, la force, la faiblesse et le soutien.

Ce projet comporte trois semaines de répétitions qui serviront à terminer la création et qui seront suivies de trois performances.

La recherche chorégraphique de BALLS a profité de la précieuse collaboration des danseuses Léna Demnati, Erin O'Loughlin, Marilyne Cyr, Koliane Rochon Prom Tep, Katherine Ng, Jessie Lhôte, Naomi CP Hillaire, Lara Oundjian, Cara Roy, Nyda Kwasowsky et le compositeur Samuel Dzierzawa. Je remercie la généreuse contribution de ces artistes incroyables!

Les spectacles sont GRATUITS pour tous !! Les horaires sont:

Dimanche 9 septembre à 11h30 - Marché Maisonneuve

Lundi 10 septembre à 17h - Jardins Gamelin

Mercredi 12 septembre 12h30 - Place des Festivals


 

OBJECTIF:

Montant visé: 4000 $

J'amasse des fonds pour assurer le cachet des artistes impliqués dans ce projet. L'argent couvrira les frais artistiques des six danseuses, du compositeur, du créateur de costume, ainsi que des accessoires et costumes supplémentaires.

En tant que chorégraphe et employeuse, la capacité de contester les normes de la danse est essentielle à ma pratique. J'apprécie le travail collaboratif. Bien que je n'ai pas reçu de financement des bureaux de subventions publics au Canada et au Québec en 2018, j'ai occupé des postes secondaires pour obtenir les fonds nécessaires au paiement équitable de tous les collaborateurs. Je me tourne maintenant vers ma communauté pour obtenir du soutien. Votre soutien est inestimable et fera de ce projet un succès en m'aidant à réaliser mon rêve de créer des emplois durables pour danseurs et artistes!

COMMENT AIDER?

Chaque don est d'une grande valeur et contribue directement au succès de mon projet!

Comme beaucoup d’entre nous sont des artistes vivant dans un capitalisme avancé, je comprends qu’il n’est pas possible pour tous de faire des dons. Si vous souhaitez soutenir BALLS autrement, je vous invite à partager cette campagne sur Facebook, Twitter ou Instagram.

Merci pour votre support sans lequel je ne pourrais mener ce projet à terme! J'espère vous voir au spectacle!

 

In studio photo by: Bobby Léon
Outdoor photos by: Megan Mericle

story:
First off, we are people who have a WAGON-LOAD of FUN! My name is Dan Fox, and I am the artist behind The Alien Siege Machine and I have the privilege of working with the GREATEST CREW IN THE WORLD. I was the Construction Coordinator and Lead Carpenter for the Trojan Horse at Burning Man 2011, and I was the Artist and Construction Lead for Anubis at Burning Man 2012. I live in the Bay Area of California, and I want to bring another fantastic sculpture to Burning Man with your help!  I have that same great crew who brought you those two projects ready and willing to help build this sculpture, and we need your financial support for our newest project.


-- Building at NIMBY May, 10th.  We are really making great progress!







What ARE we building this year?

The Alien Siege Machine is huge. HUGE. H U G E. It is a 4 story, wooden, interactive and interpretive Burning Man sculpture for Burning Man 2014. This project is going to be a hugely collaborative week-long extravaganza of kinetic connection, lights, sounds, myth and exploration. The piece is alive and active with participants: The grand perch of the elevated catwalks are brimming with participants gleefully looking out over Black Rock City and all of its artistic wonders. The interior spaces are teeming with participants working the cannons, tracks, and deciphering the trans-temporal story of The Alien Siege Machine.

Here is a computer-generated fly-through of The Alien Siege Machine.

At the $20 level, you receive a medallion with The Alien Siege Machine Logo. Wear these to proudly show your peers that you helped make this happen!

At the $50 level you receive the pendant. Metal, embossed and very, very cool.

At the $35 level you get a crew patch!  A crew patch!                                                 

$30 gets you Mike Hedge and his team's beautiful movie about Burning Man, As The Dust Settles and a Dog Tag! "I really enjoyed watching it...it took me HOME!!" 



Inside the Alien Siege Machine is a VIBRATING BOMB!  Will it Drop?  Will you ride it like Slim Pickens?  Will you have an EXCITING ADVENTURE with a friend?


We will keep you posted on the progress of The Alien Siege Machine.  Here are a bunch of FUN PEOPLE riding our VIBRATING BOMB at a party in April.  At NIMBY!

 

...and one of the crew's past endeavor's...the Trojan Horse!  We built the horse at NIMBY in 2011, while Bill Tubman's crew built the cart in Reno.  They got together for the first time out on playa, and Todd Darling made a fantastic short documentary: BLACK ROCK HORSE.


Because it is FUN!  Remember what I said earlier? Over 40 feet tall, all sorts of interactivity, interpretation, and interpersonal situations.  You and your zombie friends can decipher the ALIEN CODE, find it in history and in the future, look out into the city through the telescopes and shoot the cannon!  Shoot the cannon.  Yes, you heard that right.  Now quit reading out loud, everyone around you at work can hear!


--from a 13th century abbey.  You thought I was kidding about it being here for thousands and thousands of years, didn't you?

The Alien Siege Machine's budget is about $40,000.

Our construction materials are north of $20,000. This includes all of the lumber, fasteners, connectors and appurtenances one might find in a 4-story structure built to withstand 125 mph winds. (It is the same height as Anubis and the Trojan Horse) Yes, our architect Dan Swain designs for 125+ winds, kids. This also includes the lighting, delivery charges for lumber and materials, electrical controls, and all of those little miscellaneous items a real construction project needs.

Then, there is all of that other stuff, such as paying to truck it out to the playa, buying the on-playa decomposed granite base, leasing our build facility, buying the insurance, and buying the pyro. T-H-E P-Y-R-O. This is Burning Man…we wants us some pyro, no?  Here are a few shots of the past pyro shows from Anubis and the Trojan Horse!
story_txt:
First off, we are people who have a WAGON-LOAD of FUN! My name is Dan Fox, and I am the artist behind The Alien
Siege Machine and I have the privilege of working with the GREATEST CREW IN THE WORLD. I was the Construction Coordinator and Lead Carpenter for the
Trojan Horse at Burning Man 2011, and I was the Artist and Construction Lead
for Anubis at Burning Man 2012. I live in the Bay Area of California, and I
want to bring another fantastic sculpture to Burning Man with your help!  I have that same great crew who brought you those two projects ready and willing to help build this sculpture, and we need your financial support for our newest project.-- Building at NIMBY May, 10th.  We are really making great progress!

story:
Build The Fire


BUILD THE FIRE - Definition: v. the process of bringing to Life that which you'd like to see in the World; fulfilling a personal initiative.

n. A monthly experience displaying, building, and celebrating one another's personal “Fire” through curating of fine arts. Good Spirits and Vivid Times are guaranteed.

Build the Fire is a growing group of youth who wish to express and explore the realm of the arts. Young talented people who are seeking a community where they can be themselves and be around others of like passion. Build the Fire supports the arts and allows them to network with each other and those are ready in the field through exhibitions. We've been supported by local businesses so far by them hosting our events at no charge. We've grown at a great rate but could still use help with funding for other expenses.

WHY DOES BUILD THE FIRE MATTER?

Our State is uniquely positioned to influence and inspire the world through the Arts because its young minds are creating groundbreaking work at an extremely high caliber. However, three major issues currently plague Louisiana’s arts scene:

1. We are not improving quality of life by introducing new beneficial paradigms:

2. We are not rectifying past mistakes made by destructive social programming:

3. We are not stimulating others to become artists - keeping the movement alive:

SOLUTION

To address the problems mentioned above, creative minds of Louisiana have come together to launch a monthly music and art exhibition entitled Build The Fire. The event serves to provide the appropriate milieu for artists and supporters of the arts in three ways:

1. Build The Fire brings to independent thinkers who appraise artistic, social, political, and spiritual norms critically.

2. Build The Fire is creating a new narrative around how and why Louisianans can appreciate the arts as a tool for social improvement:

3. Build The Fire offers a platform for artists to connect with their peers as well as potential customers: 


We would like to take the next step in spreading the word by producing videos of our exhibition. Mostly we operate by volunteers, but it's hard to always request help that may not available when needed. We're looking to produce our own videos and images of our events to show just how serious and passionate we are about this. Any extra funding we receive will go to sound equipment for exhibitions, catering for our fellow artists, and any other needs that should arise.

We've hosted three events this year and hope to host more. People are traveling from further places to join us than we thought would, and we would like to share that with others.

Your contributions will help young minds reach their potential and their dreams. We need to know that more people believe in us and support our crafts. Be a supporter and support us. 

Build The Fire Thanks You!
You can reach us at BuildTheFireBR@gmail.com
Share us on facebook and check us out on twitter and instagram #buildthefire
Join our community and spread the word. We're Building The Fire for our dreams.
