story:
D.Coffey (working title), is a multi-disciplinary project based in the American South that has been in the works for nearly five years, and needs help in funding in order to continue. 

As a place of deep mystery, contradictory politics, and social cruelties – The American South offers itself as a platform for shadows and lawlessness. Hidden within the mountains is a book of history written by moonshiners, outlaws, victims, and sinner citizens. During the 70s, an Uncle of mine decided to break from the structure of the family home, and offer himself to the complications of living on the open road. Quickly, he became a runner and an outlaw – hopping trains as a broke man looking for the next bank to rob. Decades later, after incarceration, physical damage, betrayal of his own blood, and fleeting encounters with the law; traces of his past resurge within his behavioral patterns. Memorabilia and ephemera from life as a bank robber are closed into neatly confined binders and placed on the shelf, but the person who he is so consciously leaving behind cannot be fully discarded. Strings of this lawless energy tie together throughout the family blood, and evidence of this resistance is evident in the stories and documents of persons within the same immediate side of the family, whom loomed and doomed in The South. 


Why Fund?!

The reason I'm asking for help, is that recently I received a call from my Uncle explaining that his house had caught fire and burned down completely - so now I must make an unforeseen and immediate trip down there to photograph the space! The house was a major focusing point within my photographs, and its loss is both untimely and a damn shame. The house is past the point of salvation, and the fire department is due to come destroy the remains of the house really any day now. I must get down there in order to photograph and collect ephemera from what's left of this important monument and poignant structure within my project before it completely ceases to exist. Contributors will help me achieve documentation of a crucial element within my project, as well as allow for further investigation into the files, tapes, negatives, and collected objects that can only be obtained by physically being in the South. 

About Hunter-Savoy Jaffe 

-Former assistant of internationally acclaimed photographer, John Chiara.

-Senior at Maryland Institute College of Art (MICA) as a Photography Major with a Printmaking Concentration and talent in Book Arts. 
-Recipient of several MICA and non-MICA affiliated scholarships including the Presidential Scholarships, NAHS, and A.R.T.S Scholarship
-Lives in a communal arts and gallery space with seven other tenants that we built during the Summer of 2013 


What I Need/What You Get

The $600 I'm asking for and need will cover: 

- Car tune-up and general check
-Gas money from Baltimore, MD to Newport, TN and surrounding areas
-Tolls
-20 rolls of Kodak Portra 400 35mm Professional Color Negative Film
-15 rolls kodak Portra 120mm Professional Color Negative Film
- 25 sheets of HP5 400 Plus B&W Negative Film 4 x 5


    Risks & Challenges

    I understand that asking the Internet for anything, especially money in a short amount of time, it relatively faulty - however, I cannot see how I could possibly get this done any other way. Should the funding goal not be met, the funds that are contributed will go towards the exact proposal as explained above, but will be saved for a later date. 


      In Exchange

      In exchange for your contributions I will be offering limited edition lithographs, prints, or a first edition publication of the projects book due out in April. 


      I realize that not everyone can contribute in the direct funding of this project - however everyone can help spread the word!

      Email friends, mentors, professors, coworkers, galleries, independent publishers!

      Post other social media sites and reblog, share etc !

      Anything Helps! xoxo

story:
The Sunken City Side show is the New Orleans Burning Man Community (NOLABRC)'s  art project going to Burning Man 2015. It will be inside the Burning Man Midway, at the center of the city surrounding the Man. 

We are reaching out to our friends, family, and community to donate and show your support for the Sunken City Sideshow taking you back in time to the days of Storyville and Riverboat shows.  A long forgotten bayou carnival sets the background where we present a soap box stage with assorted carnival acts, mischief and improvisational performances of a 10 in 1 sideshow, an entry arch framed by posters of exhibits and assorted “freaks and oddities” with something much more mysterious once you are lured into the inner sanctum full of contraptions, photo ops and oddities to inspire the adventurous.  

Beware of the swamp rougarou and the Gator Oil salesmen! Come be part of our live Tarot Body Painting project or hitch a ride on a swamp tour!

We appreciate your support and can't wait to see you all on the playa. Love from NOLA and donate here! The perks are unique and awesome!

For more details about a few of the attractions inside and our budget, see below: 

Stage and Sunken City Sideshow decor -

  • Canvas: (1) 12 x 24 drop $133.20 + (8) 3 x 5 freakshow posters = $100.80
  • Paint: (8-10) gallons @ $45/gal average = $450
  • Poles:  (10) circus poles @ $35 = $350
  • Stage deck 12 x 24 = $200
  • Total - $1,234

Micaceous project -Using low fire Micaceous clay, Burners will each fashion a small 3" ball clay sculpture of their own design by pinch method. After left to SLOWLY completely dry each piece will be placed by guidance of Burn Techs at the base of CORE effigies where they will remain through the fire and until removed by Burn Techs into cooling lines along the Playa.  The fires will provide sufficient heat to bisque the clay sculptures, the combustibles stuffed around them & materials of the effigies will create natural markings and act as aesthetic glazes for these Burner Micaceous cups created by Burners ON PLAYA! Burners can collect and take home these pieces and may be encouraged to load images of them to an online Burner virtual art gallery.

  • Low Fire Raku Clay 25lb bag $8 x 10bags  $80
  • Sandwich ziplocs  20 per box and  13 boxes @ $50
  • Work table - $40
  • Total - $170

Body Tarot Cards - The goal of this project is to co-create a Tarot using symbols from the four suits of a deck of cards ( the original Tarot), visionary imagery illustrating the 10 Principles of Burning Man and each individual's personal style to transform a person or group into a human interpretation of each Tarot card. Images of each interpretation can be submitted to a database after the event to be compiled into an online virtual gallery showcasing the individual's image and the photographic art from the project

  • (2) Mehron 12 Color Palette $270
  • (20) 10 oz Tubes of Glow in the Dark Paint  - $140
  • (12)  Sponges $12
  • Various sized art brushes $10
  • (1) Gallon of water per day x 7 days $7
  • Baby Wipes $14
  • Stencil Paper $10
  • Scissors $5
  • Spray bottle/mist $3 
  • full length mirror $10
  • Work table - $40
  • Total = $521

Bearded Lady and The New Natives Photo Opportunities and Take-Home Photos

Bearded Lady - With the ever so popular selfie-trend, social media allows people to portray the best images of themselves even though that image may not actually be reflective of reality. This "bearded lady" sideshow allows people to play on that concept by trying on different beards and other accessories to create a different image of themselves but rather than posting it for the world to see, we will have a mirror and plan on taking a polaroid of the person for them to take away with them.

  • Film for instant photos – 500 photos = $400
  • Inventive beards (yarn, denim, etc – need elastic and hot glue) $50
  • Donated costumes and accessories $0 

The New Natives - An interactive photo project - People can wander up, put on a grass skirt and possibly a mask, and pose for an old timey portrait holding anything that is dear to them - it is sort of like "What is the one thing you would take with yourself to a desert ...or the playa!

  • Paints for backdrops $100
  • Shared backdrop material $100
  • Accessories $100
  • Total - $750

Swamp Tours – a self-push wooden swamp air boat for rides in and out of the Sunken City Sideshow (Will be self administered project. There will be riders and pushers. Almost jokingly I (and/or others) will gather 6 people and delegate some riders and some pushers to push and ride the boat from destination to destination. The boat will also be a swamp prop and can be used for seating in Midway, outside Midway, at Lil Al, representing some swamp spirit all over the playa.)

  • 8 - 10 in. Pneumatic Heavy Duty Swivel Caster = $120
  • 1 - gallon of grey/green paint recycled = $10
  • Plywood $125
  • Lumber $105
  • Total - $360

Transportation 

  • Renting space in trucks and chipping in for gas on other NOLA art projects traveling to the playa - $1,000

Grand Total - $4,035

We are asking for only half of the grand total budget to cover major expenses. If the campaign raises over $2,000 the funds will be allocated as the above budget describes. 

We thank you from the bottom of our hearts!

story:
Short Summary

We have the opportunity to curate the Temple Bus properly at Art Car World in Douglas Arizona. Douglas Arts and Humanities Association ( http://www.grandtheatredouglas.org/site/ ) is organizing this effort. We work closely with Art Car World ( http://www.artcarworld.org ) and the City of Douglas in bringing creative spirit to our region.

What We Need & What You Get

We need transportation expenses funded for the Bus.

 

The Impact

The Temple bus has been a Burning Man icon for many years. She has helped build temples and transport Burners around the Playa during the event. Mutant vehicles and artworks have been lost over the years. This is a chance to ensure the Temple Bus is properly cared for in the future.

Other Ways You Can Help

Thank you for looking at our project. Please pass the word on to your friends and contacts.
story_txt:
Short Summary
We have the opportunity to curate the Temple Bus properly at Art Car World in Douglas Arizona. Douglas Arts and Humanities Association ( http://www.grandtheatredouglas.org/site/ ) is organizing this effort. We work closely with Art Car World ( http://www.artcarworld.org ) and the City of Douglas in bringing creative spirit to our region.


What We Need & What You Get
We need transportation expenses funded for the Bus.
 
The Impact
The Temple bus has been a Burning Man icon for many years. She has helped build temples and transport Burners around the Playa during the event. Mutant vehicles and artworks have been lost over the years. This is a chance to ensure the Temple Bus is properly cared for in the future.


Other Ways You Can Help
Thank you for looking at our project. Please pass the word on to your friends and contacts.

story:
The Tale of The Temple

The Temple of Times was created in 2012. Built as a secondary effigy for Burning Flipside, a Texas Regional Event, but a shift in wind meant the Temple was not to burn. For nearly a year, designer Adam Carrell worked to find a new home for the Temple burning, and was accepted for the Burning Man Circle of Regional Effigies. Wanting his previous design to be bigger, better, burnier, Adam enlisted the help of fellow Austin designers, constructors, and go-getters and the Temple of Times is now traveling to Black Rock City with new features, and a new meaning. Representing the passage of time -- the past, present, and future, The Temple stands ready.

Austin has always been a special place with its association to Burning Man. Burning Flipside was the first regional Burning Man event, and has now grown to be its own destination and spawned its own spin-off events. George Paap (St. Tiki) was the first Regional Contact for Burning Man, and representatives from Austin continue to be deeply ingrained in the Regional Network, DPW, Art Support, Rangers, etc. for Burning Man. There are no shortage of 'Burners' in Austin, creating wonderful experiences both at home and around the world. 

What We Need & What You Get

  • We need $9,000. Most of this will be used for transporting the Temple and crew meals. It's 1,800 miles from ATX to BRC. Help us get there.

  • You get awesome Temple SWAG and friends forever in Austin.
  • If we don't hit the goal, we're still going. All money will still be funded, and we'll make it work.

The Impact

The Temple is a space where sacred impulses rest lightly upon themselves, leaving plenty of room for personal interpretation and expression while providing nudges towards introspection, connection and transformation. The Temple serves as a participatory nexus of creation & destruction, intimacy & spectacle, love & release.Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.

We want to bring this for our chosen family to experience. Your help will make that happen.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please consider donating at whatever level you are comfortable, even if you can't make it to any of the builds. No amount is too small, when we all work together and each gives even a little bit of our time, energy, resources, we can certainly make amazing things happen. 

And that’s all there is to it.

story:
Fundraiser for artist Irvin Morazan, who has been diagnosed with Cancer.

Irvin is under going Chemotheraphy treatment for the next 9 months, 30 sessions of Radiation and Surgery. 

Please help raise money for his living expenses, alternative treatments and medical bills that the insurance company does not cover. We are trying to raise the minimum of $32,800 in addition to anything extra to pay for unexpected bills that might come up in the next year. You can help by sharing the fundraiser link and by donating or buying some of his prints.

 Thank you!

story:
Who we are

CHECK OUT OUR INTERVIEW WITH MOSAIC HERE!

SCALE EFFIGY BURN IS LIVE!

Our core team is composed of four individuals who were brought together while working on the Tree of Life (LoF 2013: Superstition) and have been challenging ourselves with new projects and creative avenues. This is the second Regional Effigy for this core team. The four individuals listed below were central core members of the Effigy at Lakes of Fire: Superstition, the Tree of Life. We are eager to return to Mosaic and yet again push ourselves to create and inspire.

The Mothership Love is an effigy project like no other! Using the power of FIRE we will make the fifteen foot tall effigy defy gravity in a multitude of ways. Utilizing science and ingenuity as our tools we aim to create a highly interactive and engaging experience before, during and after the burn.

The Cause / Community Driven

As with anything in this world, to make the Mothership Love possible we need funds.
We have already secured $1000 in the form of an art grant (thank you Mosaic!) but still need around another $1000 to complete all aspects of this project. These funds will cover things like wood/build supplies, lighting, shop work(any specialized cutting and designs for the project), transport and any other costs that could potentially come up.
Any funds left over from this project will be given back to the Mosaic Experiment or gifted to other artists currently working on projects for the event to ensure the most amazing experience and help others Defy Gravity.
To help entice you we have some cool perks, but the best part is helping make Mosaic an amazing event for everyone there to enjoy!

Why Donate?

We are a team that is dedicated to making this project a reality. We are passionate about this community and what it stands for. It empowers individuals to make the impossible possible. It also represents the power that people and a community can have when we put our resources together. By helping us through donation you are channeling your intent into our project and in turn, the event.

Risks & Challenges

Our design is very ambitious in what we want to do. We are trying to envoke the theme of the event in as many ways that we can. With the Mothership Love we are literally aiming for the stars. Even so, we are ready to handle any issues that arise.

Potential issue: Getting the effigy to spin while on fire/other effects to work

Solution: We are near completion of a scale build to test all effects and concepts and have had success so far with the design and implementation of our effects. If something cannot be completed in a safe and reasonable manner though it will be modified or worst case scrapped

Potential issue: We don't make our funding goal/only get partial funding

Solution: We are also hosting an addtitional fund raising at the Necto Night Club event to help with our costs. FB event can be found here (https://www.facebook.com/events/471662093010714/)

Potential Issue: We Defy gravity so hard that we don't come back down

Solution: If such is the case we love you all

Other Ways You Can Help

Monetary help isn't the only way you can get involved with this project! Share this campaign on your Facebook! Tell friends/family/people you interact with! Even get involved locally! If you're interested in working with us on the project get in contact with us. There is plenty of on-site work left to do and we need plenty of help to complete this project.

:ATTENTION ARTISTS:
We are currently looking for an individual to design the art used for our perks! If this piece inspires you send us your design and a little about yourself!

story:
Help Ava take her Ceramic Art to the next level! 

I started doing ceramics around a year and a half ago in school and since then it has been one of my favorite things to do. It is creative and rewarding because I get to enjoy and explore the process while making a product at the same time. My goal is to buy a pottery wheel so I can continue my passion at home while advancing my skills.  Please donate and support my art. If you choose to support me there will be a gift especially made by me for you. Thank you!

When you donate make sure to select a perk! 
For $25  you get the choice of a coffee mug or small bowl
For $30 you get a larger mug for cappuccinos or soup 
For $45 you get 2 coffee mugs of similar size and color
For $55 you get 2 cappuccino mugs of similar size and color
For $90 you get 4 coffee mugs of similar size and color. 
For $100 you get 4 cappuccino mugs of similar size and color
If you donate $50 or more you can get a small vase or flower pot


Here is some of the work I have done so far
